name: Tainy
description:
Meet our Puerto Rican pups! These little ones survived thanks to the compassion of a local woman who wouldn't give up on them.

When their mama showed up and gave birth near the woman’s food stand, she kept a close eye on the pups. Mama eventually retreated into the brush to give birth to her last puppy, Tainy, but the woman didn’t know at the time if mama would return. With darkness approaching, the woman didn’t want to leave the puppies alone—so she took them in, keeping them beside her day and night. While she ran her food stand by day, the woman was a cab driver at night. And guess who came along? The woman lovingly bottle fed each of the puppies in between fares, making sure they received enough nutrition to continue growing big and strong.

Eventually, mama returned to the food stand with Tainy to reunite with the rest of her pups. The woman took the whole little family in to keep them safe, and we welcomed these survivors to NYC. Now, they’re ready to find homes!

name: Lucky Charms
description: I just arrived at Animal Haven! Please check back soon for more info about me.

name: Eddie
description:
Meet Eddie! 

We don’t know much about mom or dad, so we can only guess about Eddie and his siblings' future size! Based on their adorably plump selves right now, we’re thinking they might be medium-sized dogs once fully grown. 

Like any puppy, these little ones are blank slates! You’ll be mom or dad teaching them all their basics, from potty training to leash walking and beyond. Having a puppy is a lot of work, but it’s rewarding—especially with faces as cute as theirs.

name: Susie
description: I just arrived at Animal Haven! Please check back soon for more info about me.

name: Teddy
description: I just arrived at Animal Haven! Please check back soon for more info about me.

name: Phil
description: I just arrived at Animal Haven! Please check back soon for more info about me.

name: Lizzie
description:
Lizzie is your hype girl! She's here to remind you that you're important, special, and loved. 

This bubbly lab mix still has a lot of that goofy puppy energy, but she's a smart girl who's eager to learn. Sadly, it sounds like Lizzie has been passed around a bit in her short life. We're just as excited as she is to find her a stable, loving home! Adopt Lizzie!

name: Roxana
description:
Roxana was found as a stray in terrible condition. Every rib visible, her body spotted with sores, it's clear she spent many nights—perhaps her whole life—alone, sleeping on hard ground. She wouldn’t have lasted much longer in this condition.

Thankfully, she is now safe with us. 

When Roxana arrived at Animal Haven, she was nothing but sweet, offering small tail wags and hopeful glances. We took her straight to our partner vet for a full workup, where she was friendly and gentle with everyone she met. 

Roxana is not yet out of the woods, but thankfully, she is stable. She's on a special diet to help her safely gain weight. Our team is providing her with lots of enrichment and company to keep her fulfilled while she recuperates.

While her first year-plus of life was one of hardship and neglect, her future promises love and care. And she is sure to return the favor to anyone who opens their heart to this sweet girl.

name: Nieve
description:
Nieve is sniffin’ out a home of her own—could it be with you?

Despite her lack of spots, this spunky girl is in fact a Dalmatian! Nieve is just under 2 years old, and we suspect she may have been a bit undersocialized before arriving at Animal Haven. She’s been making great strides in our training and rehabilitation program, where she’s learning how to walk politely on leash and navigate the sights, smells, and sounds of our busy city. 

Nieve will do best with a somewhat experienced adopter who can continue reinforcing her basics. An active home would also benefit Nieve, who would make an excellent running, hiking, and adventure buddy. Nieve is learning how to meet other dogs politely, but enjoys making new human friends and can’t wait to show you her favorite tennis ball! Adopt Nieve!

name: Gina
description:
Meet Gina! This sweet shepherd mix was likely used for breeding—she was seen in a home with a male dog before being abandoned in a nearby parking lot, extremely skinny, anxious, and with signs of having recently given birth. A Good Samaritan found her and tried to return her to the suspected owners, but they refused to answer the door. 

When Gina arrived at Animal Haven, it quickly became clear that something was different about her: She would begin spinning in circles, sometimes snapping at the air in the process. Initially, we thought this might be a neurological problem and consulted with a specialist to conduct an MRI and spinal tap, but the results did not reveal any neurological or medical issues. We then consulted with a veterinary behaviorist, who suspects that Gina’s spinning episodes are caused primarily by environmental triggers. 

Gina now has a long-term plan to help reduce her stress, manage her environment, and provide her with enrichment and decompression time to hopefully reduce her spinning and air-snapping episodes, but this will be a journey. Her adopter will need to be willing to work with Gina and our trainers to manage her environment and continue her regimen. 

While Gina is definitely a project who will do best with an experienced adopter, we can say with certainty that she is a total sweetheart! She’s snuggly, playful, and responsive to treats and toys. Her episodes typically happen when she is loose in a space, whether her kennel or one of our training rooms, and she can be “snapped out” of them fairly easily. Animal Haven will of course provide ongoing support to help Gina transition and settle into her new home and life. Reach out to our team if you’re interested in meeting Gina and learning more about this darling pup!

name: Eleanor
description:
If Eleanor looks wise beyond her years, it’s because she’s been through a lot—but despite it all, she’s a sweet gal! 

At just three years old, Eleanor’s body shows signs of having had puppies, though we’re not sure if it was accidental or if she was intentionally used for breeding. 

She was involved in a court case, leaving her in limbo at a municipal shelter for around a year while the case worked its way through the courts. During that time, she became the shelter’s go-to pup for socialization and playdates with other dogs, given her social nature. 

Now, it’s her turn to shine! Eleanor is a friendly a curious lady who gets along well with other dogs, but wouldn’t mind being your one-and-only, either. Adopt Eleanor!

name: Mario
description:
Mario was found as a stray on the streets of NYC. This terrified boy was trembling when he was caught by police who brought him to a municipal shelter. It's hard to say what his life was before he was found, but he's clearly been through a lot. He was completely shut down when he first arrived at Animal Haven - he trembled in the corner and wouldn’t even take treats tossed near him. But our dedicated staff have been working with him every day to earn his trust and we’re so happy to report that their work has clearly paid off.

Mario has become fast friends with many of our staff and volunteers and has really come out of his shell, but he will need a patient and understanding family who’s willing to work at his pace to build his confidence and set him up for success. He is still a little bit nervous on walks if there is a lot of foot traffic, so he would likely do best in a quieter neighborhood. Mario has shown no aggression during his time with us, favoring avoidance if he’s ever uncomfortable in any situation. Overall, he is a gentle soul who just needs a little extra time to settle in to a new space.

He’s a big guy, but tries to be small whenever he can. We know this sweet boy has a big heart to match and will make an amazing companion for someone willing to put in a little time for him. Interested in Mario? We encourage you to submit an inquiry through his profile prior to visiting him to make sure Mario’s best friends can make his introductions. Adopt Mario!

name: Harmony
description:
Harmony is so sweet, it’s hard to believe how much she’s endured. Originally from an overcrowded southern shelter, Harmony came to Animal Haven with her 5 puppies. She was heartworm positive, with one of the heaviest heartworm burdens we’ve ever seen. Her treatment has stretched over months, during which time she’s had to remain as calm as possible. 

Even worse, when our veterinary team took x-rays of Harmony’s heart, they found her neck and chest to be riddled with BB pellets. Someone had shot at this sweet, gentle mama. 

That's all behind her now, and we're now rewriting Harmony’s story—helping her heal and ultimately find the loving home she so deserves. Harmony is currently in a foster home, where she's staying calm during heartworm treatment and recovery. Reach out to schedule a meet and greet with this incredibly sweet girl!

name: Douglas
description:
Poor Douglas was found on the side of a road in Antigua, dragging his hind legs. Although his rescuers initially thought he had been hit by a car, upon further inspection his injuries were actually fairly old. They believe that he was likely attacked by other dogs on the island, leaving him with partial paralysis in his hindquarters.

Thanks to the amazing Dogs and Cats of Antigua, Douglas has made his way up to Animal Haven where his new life begins. We are so thankful to have the opportunity to give this sweet boy the chance at life he otherwise would not have had.

Right now we are still learning more about Douglas's current condition and we don't have a lot of answers just yet. We are sending him to our partner vets for spinal x-rays and a neurological consultation to get a better idea of the extent of his paralysis. Once we have more information, we'll be able to determine if he's a candidate for corrective surgery or wheelchair! We'll keep you all updated along his journey but he is available for adoption right now! Animal Haven will of course be covering the costs of his diagnostics and treatments and we're hopeful Douglas will charm his way into someone's heart soon.

In addition to his paralysis, Douglas is also suffering from heartworm, ehrlichia, a urinary tract infection, and open lesions on his legs - we know, he's got a LOT going on.

If you'd like to learn more about Douglas or are interested in adopting him, please contact Animal Haven to get in touch with a staff member directly.

name: Milady
description: I just arrived at Animal Haven! Please check back soon for more info about me.

name: Cherie
description:
Cherie, Cherie baby! Cherie, can you come out tonight? 

Sweet Cherie is looking for a family and she knows that you're thinking, "I'm gonna make-a you mineee!"  She's a young and active staffie mix looking to be your one and only pup. She's super affectionate, big on hugs, and absolutely loves bringing her toys with her everywhere she goes.

A good Samaritan saw this poor girl being abandoned and immediately scooped her up out of harm's way. She's now safe and sound at Animal Haven and waiting for another chance to love again. 

Cherie has been in a few fosters during her time at Animal Haven and has done amazing on all of her outings away from the shelter.

Here are some notes from her last foster: 
Cherie is a sweet and well-behaved girl in a home, especially once she has a few days to settle into a new routine - she was accident free in just a few days! She's respectful of human belongings, both when you're home and when you're not.  She's affectionate, cuddly, and loves being right by your side whenever you're home! Cherie is a young and active girl who loves to play, but settles in her bed or on the couch when you leave and will wait for you to get home. 

Cherie gets incredibly excited for walks - she's ready to go whenever! Her toys are great to keep her focused and helps keep her energy directed where it needs to be. She has come a long way since she's been with us, but is still working on her leash manners. She doesn't like to say hi to other dogs, but as long as they don't bark at her, she's been learning to mind her own business.

She is a sweet and active companion and also a good jogging partner! She'll appreciate it as she has lots of energy! Cherie will likely never be a dog park kind of dog, although she has played with some other dogs in the past, she can be a lot for other dogs if they can't match her energy.

Cherie is hoping she'll be able to find a new family of her very own and we know there's someone out there looking for an active, smart-cookie like her! Come meet Cherie at Animal Haven!

name: Monte
description:
Monte lives with a condition called Megaesophagus. This condition varies in severity on a case by case basis with all dogs and we look to our vets directly on recommendations for his care. Essentially, Monte's esophagus is enlarged and doesn't function correctly to help keep his food down. Monte must sit in a special chair that keeps him upright in order to prevent him from regurgitating his food and he needs to stay upright after feedings for 10-15 minutes to ensure the food safely reaches his stomach. Monte has his own custom "Bailey Chair" and uses it like an absolute pro - he hops right into it when it's meal time! His chair will come with him when he's adopted!

Monte is a gleeful, playful dog who otherwise lives a normal life. He LOVES toys and enjoys his "party time" in our training room where he runs out his zoomies. Although his condition prevents us from using treats to train, he's highly toy motivated and has been picking up basics like a pro! We've also been utilizing special treats just for dogs with his condition which he loves! Potential adopters will need to be aware that Monte is on a special diet for his condition and currently has 3 meal times a day. If he accidentally ingests anything between those mealtimes, he will need to sit in his chair. He's a big boy that will need consistent, unique training and supervision while he works on his impulse control!

Unfortunately, Monte has spent the majority of his life in a shelter environment during the pandemic, Monte is a little behind in his socialization. He can be unsure about meeting new people and will bark at things he is apprehensive about. He is great with those who he has been properly introduced to though and good introductions will be key! Monte would likely do best in a quieter neighborhood out of Manhattan, away from any enticing sidewalk snacks he shouldn't get into and scary skateboarders. 

If you're interested in finding out more about Monte and his condition, please contact Animal Haven!

name: Bitzy
description:
Bitzy’s life was turned upside down when she found herself back at Animal Haven after nearly 6 years, due to no fault of her own. Understandably, Bitzy is adjusting to being back at the shelter, so we’re taking things slow with her. Despite everything, Bitzy is sweet as can be, leaning in for pets and offering gentle nudges. 

Will you offer Bitzy the second chance she deserves? Meet her at Animal Haven!

name: Mars
description:
Meet our chunky, hunky Bulldog boys: Bruno and Mars! These guys are all wrinkles and love, and can either be adopted together or separately (after some time with us, they don’t seem to be bonded).

These two were surrendered to us after being in a home all their lives. They’re adjusting and showing us their charming, snuffly Bulldog personalities. Don’t let their age deter you—these bullies still have a lot of love left in ‘em! They do a whole lot of nothing most of the day, so they might be a couch potato’s dream dog. But Bulldog people know this breed has a whole lot of other things to deal with. From crusty skin folds and dry eyes to allergies and breathing difficulties, expect them to need a little extra care to make up for their lower energy requirements! That said, these two are in pretty good shape, all things considered. 

Adopt Mars!

name: Bruno
description:
Meet our chunky, hunky Bulldog boys: Bruno and Mars! These guys are all wrinkles and love, and can either be adopted together or separately (after some time with us, they don’t seem to be bonded).

These two were surrendered to us after being in a home all their lives. They’re adjusting and showing us their charming, snuffly Bulldog personalities. Don’t let their age deter you—these bullies still have a lot of love left in ‘em! They do a whole lot of nothing most of the day, so they might be a couch potato’s dream dog. But Bulldog people know this breed has a whole lot of other things to deal with. From crusty skin folds and dry eyes to allergies and breathing difficulties, expect them to need a little extra care to make up for their lower energy requirements! That said, these two are in pretty good shape, all things considered. 

Adopt Bruno!

name: Sinatra
description:
Be careful, because Sinatra might just steal your heart! This dreamy low-rider is ready to shower you with sloppy kisses and show off his finest puppy dog eyes. 

He has a few lumps and bumps, which our veterinary team is checking out and will have more information on soon. This senior pup deserves a couch of his own to nap on, a best friend to go on leisurely strolls with, and all the belly rubs he could want. Adopt Sinatra!

name: Wheein
description: I just arrived at Animal Haven! Please check back soon for more info about me.

name: Hwasa
description: I just arrived at Animal Haven! Please check back soon for more info about me.

name: Solar
description: I just arrived at Animal Haven! Please check back soon for more info about me.

name: Moonbyul
description: I just arrived at Animal Haven! Please check back soon for more info about me.

name: Stevie
description:
Stevie’s backstory is a bit of a mystery to us, but what we do know is heartbreaking. She was found in a box along with two other puppies, one of which had sadly passed away. She ended up with a family who was ultimately not able to care for her, and made her way to Animal Haven for a third chance.

Stevie is a social gal who loves human attention and has been interested in the dogs she’s met at the shelter so far. She has exuberant puppy energy and is understandably a bit anxious, given everything she’s gone through. With stability, patience, and lots of love, we think Stevie will blossom into a much more confident dog and a loving companion! Adopt Stevie!

name: Bauble
description: I just arrived at Animal Haven! Please check back soon for more info about me.

name: Kobe
description: Kobe is one of those dogs everyone falls in love with. He’s the absolute nicest boy; gentle, affectionate, and so well-behaved both at the shelter and in his foster home. Kobe loves his toys, loves his people, and especially loves to cuddle (he’ll do his best to fit on your lap, no matter the size!). He’s been with us for quite some time now, and while we adore him, he truly deserves a loving home of his own. Kobe has made a few doggy friends and would make a great furry sibling to a well-matched pup. If you’re looking for a dog who’s as sweet as they come and ready to fill your life with love, Kobe’s your guy. If this animal is located at our Manhattan Adoption Center, head in to meet them and see if you are a match! We are a same-day adoption center, and an application does not put you on a list or hold an animal for you. If they are in Wantagh or in a foster home, please submit an online application and our team will reach out to further discuss the adoption process. Prior to adoption, all of our animals are spayed/neutered, microchipped, and given their age-appropriate vaccines.

name: Elvis
description: Elvis has come a long way. When he first arrived, he was extremely fearful and unsure of the world around him. Thanks to the patience and kindness of his foster family, he’s made wonderful progress and is learning that life can be pretty great. He gets along well with everyone in the household and is slowly discovering the joy of being loved. Elvis still takes a little time to warm up, but once he does, his sweet, gentle personality shines through. He’s looking for a patient adopter who will give him the love, understanding, and time he needs to feel safe, and in return, he’ll give you all the trust and loyalty he’s been saving up. If this animal is located at our Manhattan Adoption Center, head in to meet them and see if you are a match! We are a same-day adoption center, and an application does not put you on a list or hold an animal for you. If they are in Wantagh or in a foster home, please submit an online application and our team will reach out to further discuss the adoption process. Prior to adoption, all of our animals are spayed/neutered, microchipped, and given their age-appropriate vaccines.

name: Kirsten
description: Sweet Kirsten has traveled a long way from Tennessee in search of a quiet, patient forever home where she can truly feel safe and loved. This little girl has a gentle soul and a heart full of potential—she’s just waiting for the right person (and dog) to help her shine.  Kirsten is very shy and nervous around new people and unfamiliar environments. But don’t let that stop you from meeting her—because once she feels secure, especially in the company of another well-matched, confident dog, her personality begins to blossom. In fact, she thrives when she has a calm canine companion to show her the ropes and help her feel at ease.  She’s not the type of pup to jump into your arms on day one, but if you’re the kind of person who understands the beauty of slow trust and quiet milestones, Kirsten might just be your perfect match. Every tail wag, every curious glance, every moment of bravery—those are her love letters to you.  Kirsten would do best in a peaceful home with another friendly dog and adults who understand how to give her the space and time she needs to come out of her shell.  If you believe in second chances, gentle patience, and the magic of watching a scared dog learn to feel safe, Kirsten is ready to start that journey—with you.  This cutie resides at our Wantagh location and meetings are by appointment only. If you are interested in meeting them, you must click "Apply for Adoption" to submit an online application. If you're viewing this animal on Petfinder, please visit the animal's page on Bideawee.org and click on the "Apply for Adoption" button to submit an adoption application. Once we receive your application, we will be in touch to schedule an appointment to meet them! Prior to adoption, all of our animals are spayed/neutered, microchipped and given their age-appropriate vaccines.

name: Charlie
description: This little boy with the big smile is Charlie! Charlie never fails to greet us with a wagging tail, always happy to see his people friends. He's a petite cutie, perfectly sized to tag along with you wherever you go. After a day of adventure, he'll want nothing more than to cuddle up for snuggles. A total sweetheart, Charlie will make an amazing best friend. If this animal is located at our Manhattan Adoption Center, head in to meet them and see if you are a match! We are a same-day adoption center, and an application does not put you on a list or hold an animal for you. If they are in Wantagh or in a foster home, please submit an online application and our team will reach out to further discuss the adoption process. Prior to adoption, all of our animals are spayed/neutered, microchipped, and given their age-appropriate vaccines.

name: Apple Jack
description: Apple Jack, or AJ for short, is a sweet and quirky pup who just needs a bit of time and patience to show his true personality. Once he feels safe, you'll discover a funny, curious companion with a soft spot for cheese and hard-boiled eggs. AJ is quiet (you’ll rarely hear him bark!) and gets along wonderfully with well-matched dogs. While he's still learning to trust people, and his confidence is growing every day! He’s wee wee pad trained, sleeps peacefully in his crate at night, and is doing a fantastic job learning to walk on a leash. AJ is a gentle soul looking for a calm, patient home where he can continue to blossom. If this animal is located at our Manhattan Adoption Center, head in to meet them and see if you are a match! We are a same-day adoption center, and an application does not put you on a list or hold an animal for you. If they are in Wantagh or in a foster home, please submit an online application and our team will reach out to further discuss the adoption process. Prior to adoption, all of our animals are spayed/neutered, microchipped, and given their age-appropriate vaccines.

name: Iago
description: All the world’s a stage, and Iago is here to steal the scene—preferably with treats. This small breed fully grown adult dog only at 13lbs but mighty arrives ready to dazzle the audience (and his new family) with his quick wit and irresistible charm. While his Shakespearean namesake was known for mischief, our Iago uses his cleverness only for good… mostly.  Iago is a pint-sized scene-stealer who thrives on attention, playtime, and the occasional dramatic entrance. Whether he’s trotting proudly into the room or curling up in your lap after a standing ovation of belly rubs, he’s happiest when he’s part of the action. And in our little Shakespearean troupe, he’s the charismatic trickster who keeps everyone laughing. If you’re looking for a spirited sidekick with heart, humor, and a dash of drama, Iago is ready for his curtain call. Iago can be a bit reserved of hew people so we recommend him for an adult only household. He does warm up quickly once he earns your trust then you will have a new bestie for a lifetime. A home with another pooch would be great as he enjoys playing with his canine friends here at Bideawee.   This cutie resides at our Wantagh location and meetings are by appointment only. If you are interested in meeting them, you must click "Apply for Adoption" to submit an online application. If you're viewing this animal on Petfinder, please visit the animal's page on Bideawee.org and click on the "Apply for Adoption" button to submit an adoption application. Once we receive your application, we will be in touch to schedule an appointment to meet them! Prior to adoption, all of our animals are spayed/neutered, microchipped and given their age-appropriate vaccines.

name: Hershey Kiss
description: Hershey Kiss is the definition of a hidden gem. She’s so wonderful, but somehow keeps getting overlooked. It’s hard to understand why, because this girl is truly the best. Hershey is sweet, gentle, playful, and so full of joy. She greets her people friends with pure happiness, loves belly rubs, and gives the kind of cuddles that make every bad day disappear. She’s gentle but strong, silly but well-mannered, and always ready to make you smile. She also knows many commands and is house-trained! Hershey gets along with some dogs better than others and could make a wonderful sister to the right canine companion. She’s been waiting patiently for someone to see her for who she really is - a loving and loyal pup. Whoever adopts her is truly getting something special. Hershey Kiss is currently recovering from leg surgery and will need to follow a special recovery plan to help her heal properly. She’ll be placed in a foster-to-adopt arrangement, and our team will provide guidance and support throughout her recovery process. If this animal is located at our Manhattan Adoption Center, head in to meet them and see if you are a match! We are a same-day adoption center, and an application does not put you on a list or hold an animal for you. If they are in Wantagh or in a foster home, please submit an online application and our team will reach out to further discuss the adoption process. Prior to adoption, all of our animals are spayed/neutered, microchipped, and given their age-appropriate vaccines.

name: Smore
description: Meet Smore! Playful, energetic, and full of life, he’s happiest when he’s out and about, running, exploring, and spending time with his favorite humans. He also enjoys the company of other well-matched dogs who can keep up with him. Smore spent time in a foster home and loved being part of a family. Life in a kennel is hard for him, and he’s ready to have a home where he can stretch out, play, and feel loved every day. This sweet boy has so much joy to share and is ready to bring it to a home of his own.  If this animal is located at our Manhattan Adoption Center, head in to meet them and see if you are a match! We are a same-day adoption center, and an application does not put you on a list or hold an animal for you. If they are in Wantagh or in a foster home, please submit an online application and our team will reach out to further discuss the adoption process. Prior to adoption, all of our animals are spayed/neutered, microchipped, and given their age-appropriate vaccines.

name: Wrinkles
description: Wrinkles is a goofy, lovable girl who’s always ready to make you smile. She’s silly, full of personality, and never turns down a good belly rub. Playful with her dog friends and sweet with everyone she meets, Wrinkles is a true bulldog lover’s dream and she’s sure to make her future family very happy. If this animal is located at our Manhattan Adoption Center, head in to meet them and see if you are a match! We are a same-day adoption center, and an application does not put you on a list or hold an animal for you. If they are in Wantagh or in a foster home, please submit an online application and our team will reach out to further discuss the adoption process. Prior to adoption, all of our animals are spayed/neutered, microchipped, and given their age-appropriate vaccines.

name: Cora
description: This cutie resides at our Westhampton location Apply for Adoption" to submit an online application. If you're viewing this animal on Petfinder, please visit the animal's page on Bideawee.org and click on the "Apply for Adoption" button to submit an adoption application. Once we receive your application, we will be in touch to schedule an appointment to meet them!

name: Obi
description: Obi is what we lovingly call a gentle giant. This big handsome boy has stolen the hearts of everyone at the shelter. He’s so well-loved that he often takes little walks through our offices just to say hello - his daily visits are the highlight of our day. Obi is playful, incredibly sweet, and happiest when he’s with his people. He loves a good chew toy, a comfy spot to relax, and has no idea he’s not a lap dog (but we don’t have the heart to tell him otherwise). Obi will do best in a home with older children, where he can soak up all the love and attention as the only dog. He’s not a fan of cats, but he’s got more than enough affection to fill your whole home. If you’re looking for a loyal, loving companion with a big heart and an even bigger personality, Obi just might be your guy. If this animal is located at our Manhattan Adoption Center, head in to meet them and see if you are a match! We are a same-day adoption center, and an application does not put you on a list or hold an animal for you. If they are in Wantagh or in a foster home, please submit an online application and our team will reach out to further discuss the adoption process. Prior to adoption, all of our animals are spayed/neutered, microchipped, and given their age-appropriate vaccines.

name: Taffy
description: This gorgeous girl is Taffy! She's incredibly smart, friendly, and outgoing. She would do great with someone who is familiar with husky-type dogs! Taffy loves her people friends and enjoys going on walks, hiking, and other outside activities. Taffy would do best in a home with no other fur babies. And in a home with older children so she has all the love and attention. This animal is located at our Westhampton Adoption Center, head in to meet them and see if you are a match! We are a same-day adoption center, and an application does not put you on a list or hold an animal for you. We are open Tuesday-Sunday 11am-4pm. Prior to adoption, all of our animals are spayed/neutered, microchipped, and given their age appropriate shots. Apply for Adoption Today!

name: Woody
description: This cutie resides at our Westhampton location If you are interested in meeting them, you click "Apply for Adoption" to submit an online application. If you're viewing this animal on Petfinder, please visit the animal's page on Bideawee.org and click on the "Apply for Adoption" button to submit an adoption application. Prior to adoption, all of our animals are spayed/neutered, microchipped and given their age-appropriate vaccines.

name: Cannoli
description: Cannoli is a mellow, sweet dog with a big heart and a love for life’s little joys, like playing with his toys, going for walks, and spending time with the people he loves most. He’s an affectionate companion who just wants to be close to you and part of the action. If this animal is located at our Manhattan Adoption Center, head in to meet them and see if you are a match! We are a same-day adoption center, and an application does not put you on a list or hold an animal for you. name: Maggie
description: Meet Maggie, a lovable scruffball with a heart as big as her paws. She’s the kind of dog who wears her quirks proudly—whether she’s trotting with a slightly lopsided gait or flashing that endearingly goofy grin. Betta is curious, loyal, and always ready for her next adventure (or nap, depending on the time of day). She’s still got that youthful spark, loves a good game of fetch, and will happily follow you around just to be part of your world. Give her a squeaky toy, a patch of sunshine, or a cozy lap, and she’s in heaven. Maggie’s the best kind of scruffy: a little wild, a lot sweet, and totally unforgettable.  This animal is located at our Westhampton Adoption Center, head in to meet them and see if you are a match! He has become very silly and playful and absolutely loves spending time with his people friends. After an unstable start in life, this charming boy deserves the comfort of a home that will finally be his own. He would do best in a home without cats, where he can be the center of attention and enjoy all the love he has to give. If this animal is located at our Manhattan Adoption Center, head in to meet them and see if you are a match! Along with all that energy, she has a sweet side too - she’s affectionate and enjoys spending time with the people she loves. Baby Yoda would do best in an active home with older kids, and she may make a great sibling for a well-matched pup.    If this animal is located at our Manhattan Adoption Center, head in to meet them and see if you are a match! Bowtie is a very sweet, loving dog with a chill personality. He is house trained, may do well with cats, and will be a great sibling to a well-matched dog - but he'd also be happy to be your one and only! Meet Bowtie today, we know you'll love him just as much as we do!    If this animal is located at our Manhattan Adoption Center, head in to meet them and see if you are a match! Leo loves to run, with his nose down to the ground from the moment he steps outside. He is not stranger shy at all, as Leo will greet you with warm kisses in the hopes of cuddling on the couch with his favorite people. He also loves a good adventure, and so anyone who enjoys hiking and sniffing out new trails would be a great match for him.  If this pooch is located at our Westhampton Adoption Center, head in to meet them and see if you are a match! Whether he’s zooming around the yard, curling up for a cozy nap, or giving those irresistible puppy-dog eyes, Ed brings smiles wherever he goes. Loyal, curious, and always up for a snuggle, Ed is the perfect mix of adventure and affection. Life’s just better in black and white when you have Ed around! description: Sriracha is a striking black dog whose icy blue eyes seem to tell a story before she ever makes a sound. Though her appearance is bold and unforgettable, her heart is gentle, patient, and full of quiet devotion. Sriracha has a natural instinct to stay close to the people she loves—never clingy, but always present, offering a comforting nudge or a soft gaze when he senses someone needs him. Don’t let his short legs fool you—this pup moves with the confidence of a seasoned explorer and the curiosity of someone who truly believes every leaf, stick, and passing breeze is meant just for him. A natural charmer, Spur wins over humans and dogs alike with his bright eyes, playful wiggles, and signature “I definitely didn’t do anything wrong” look. He’s equal parts cuddle buddy and adventure scout, happiest whether he’s trotting ahead on a trail or curled up like a tiny monochrome marshmallow beside his favorite people. description: Maximus is a big, lovable pup with plenty of energy and a sweet, outgoing personality. name: Henry
description: Let us introduce you to Henry our 16lb little fella! He’s cute, he’s confident, and he knows exactly what he wants in life: toys, playtime, and a person who gets him. Henry loves to zoom around and show off his best moves, but he’s not a fan of sharing the spotlight, so he’ll need to be the only dog in the home. He can be a little suspicious of strangers at first (as any self-respecting small dog would be), but once he decides you’re his person, you’ll have a loyal sidekick who makes every day more entertaining. name: Tytus
description: This little guy may be small in size, but he’s packed with personality! Tytus is sweet, spunky, and playful, the kind of pup who loves to make his favorite people smile. Once he feels comfortable, his affectionate and goofy side shines through. Tytus can be a bit wary of strangers on walks, so he’ll appreciate a patient adopter who can help him feel safe and confident in new situations. He’d also do best with no felines in the home, as cats aren’t really his thing. If you’re looking for a pint-sized buddy with a big heart and a playful streak, Tytus is ready to meet you! name: Hannah
description: Hannah is a loving, loyal pup who’s perfected the art of being “just right” at 30 pounds -not too big, not too small, just exactly the size you want when you’re looking for a real companion. She adores people and turns into a full-body wiggle the moment she sees a friend coming… which, in her world, is basically everyone. Playful, affectionate, and social with well-matched dogs, Hannah would make a wonderful sibling for another friendly pup and an even better best friend for her humans. name: Molly
description: Molly's wishes to find a family and home . Molly warms up quickly, and then becomes a loving, gentle friend to all of her people pals. As Molly is a bit bashful initially, she would be best in a home with older, gentle children over 12. She would also be best in the home where she can be your only four-legged family members  If you are interested in adopting or fostering, please contact us for further information on her and we can schedule an appointment for you to meet her.

name: Boo Boo
description: Booboo is a lovable 5-year-old bundle of joy with a heart as big as his smile. He’s equal parts goofy and gentle, always ready for belly rubs, long naps, and being your shadow around the house. Whether he's chasing toys or snuggling on the couch, Booboo brings joy wherever he goes. Friendly with people and full of love, he's got a soft spot for treats and a nose for adventure — just don’t leave your snacks unattended! A generous donor is paying for his adoption fee!  This cutie resides at our Westhampton location If you are interested in meeting them, you click "Apply for Adoption" to submit an online application. name: Melo
description: Who is that handsome boy in the all white suit you may ask? It's none other than Melo, charmer extraordinaire. Melo pulls out all the stops when it comes to wooing his people pals.  As if he couldn't be cuter, you can literally "tickle him pink" as Melo has a tendency to turn a rosy hue when excited and ready for snuggles. Melo is on the search for a very special forever family, that can provide him with the perfect home. He is looking for a home in a quiet suburban or rural area, where there is a fully fenced in yard, with no other animals. However, there is more than enough of Melo to go around, so he's the only four-legged family member you'll need! A family that has previous experience with his needs is also idyllic. Melo is also seeking adopters with older children, as he enthusiastically plays and snuggles, and throws around all of his 50 pounds with lots of love and gusto. This cutie resides at our Westhampton location! Prior to adoption, all of our animals are spayed/neutered, microchipped and given their age-appropriate vaccines. If you are interested in adopting or fostering, please contact us for further information on him and we can schedule an appointment for you to meet him.

name: Riley
description: This beautiful and unique-looking lady is named Riley. Donning a caramel and chocolate brindle coat, and eyes like melted brownies, she can make you fall head over feet in love! Riley is seeking a loving and jubilant adult-only home, that has the gusto for a spirited lady, but will also give her the time that she deserves to become comfortable and settle in. New people make her nervous, so she'll need her future family to let her get cozy with them at her own pace. She'd also be best as the only four-legged family member in the home. Riley's adoption fee has been paid for by a generous donation from CCP Solutions! Riley is a member of our Oh Behave! Training Academy! Riley and her fellow pup students each have their own story as to why they've had a harder time finding a home, but we see so much potential in every one of these cuties and know that with a little guidance they can become the best friend you've always been looking for, which is why we are so excited to be able to provide this opportunity! As we want to set these pups up for success in their new homes, Bideawee will be sponsoring a free 4-week training package with our partner GoodPup, an incredible organization with a long-standing history of working with dogs and dog parents to produce happy and well-socialized four-legged family members! These pups are so deserving of loving homes, and we know this will help them start out on the right paw. This cutie resides at our Westhampton location! Prior to adoption, all of our animals are spayed/neutered, microchipped and given their age-appropriate vaccines. If you are interested in adopting or fostering, please contact us for further information on him and we can schedule an appointment for you to meet him.

name: Relish
description:
Relish is a sweet, sensitive boy with a big heart who's still learning that the world isn’t such a scary place.  Unfamiliar people and loud noises make him nervous—but don’t let that fool you. Beneath that cautious exterior is a playful, loving, affectionate dog just waiting to shine.
He’s making steady progress in building his confidence every day and just needs someone willing to let him go at his own pace.. What helps most? Other dogs! Relish adores canine companions and really comes alive when around doggie friends. He gains so much comfort and courage from having a friendly dog by his side. He also lights up during a game of fetch—it’s his favorite way to bond and burn off energy.
Relish would do best in a calm, patient home with people who understand that trust takes time.
If you’re the kind of person who believes in giving shy dogs a chance to blossom, Relish is ready to reward your patience with a lifetime of love and loyalty.

﻿Relish is approximately 1y 2m 9d old and is fully grown at 44 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

Although our dogs are listed as unknown breed, buildings with specific dog restrictions typically enforce their rules based on what breeds a dog appears to resemble. It's always important to keep that in mind and know your building's policies before adopting a dog.

This dog is available for adoption through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you're interested in adopting, the first thing you should do is begin the registration process at www.muddypawsrescue.org. If you are already a registered adopter with Muddy Paws Rescue, please email us at adoptionmeetings@muddypawsrescue.org.

name: Fiona
description:
Hello! My name is Fiona. I’m a sweet dog who loves to cuddle. I’m a little shy and can be a bit nervous at times. I enjoy treats and long walks. Despite being shy, I’m very loving and am just looking for my forever home and a caring human to call my own.

﻿Fiona is approximately 3y 10m 7d old and is fully grown at 51 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Pippin
description:
Pippin is blossoming is his new foster home, where he's in a quiet neighborhood outside of the bustling city! He loves to play with his toys and often comes to his foster mom to play with him.  He loves to play outside as well and is pretty good on a leash. He is housebroken, standing by the door when he wants to go out and is trustworthy in the house. He is slow to warm up to new people but with gentle coaxing and treats he is calm although a little standoffish. He loves belly rubs and cuddles. He has a strong prey drive, wanting to run after the squirrels in the neighborhood.  He’s fun to be with and happy when his foster mom comes home. He does well at being alone and we have left him for 8 hours!

﻿Pippin is approximately 1y 9m 19d old and is fully grown at 39 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Bam Bam
description:
Bam Bam is a 65-pound velcro dog who's convinced he's lap-sized - and honestly, we're not going to be the ones to tell him otherwise.This resilient boy has weathered heartbreak but hasn't lost an ounce of his capacity to love. Bam is the perfect combo of professional napper and tug-of-war champion. Bam is smart,  eager to please, and picks up new routines very quickly.

﻿Bam Bam is approximately 5y 5m 7d old and is fully grown at 65 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

Although our dogs are listed as unknown breed, buildings with specific dog restrictions typically enforce their rules based on what breeds a dog appears to resemble. It's always important to keep that in mind and know your building's policies before adopting a dog.

name: Muffin
description:
Meet Muffin! This adorable lady is ready to find a home of her own for the holidays. Muffin came to Muddy Paws Rescue thru NYCACC after being rescued from a hoarding situation in Brooklyn. But despite her difficult start to life, Muffin has been a brave girl and opened up so much with her fosters. Muffin's favorite thing in the whole world is other dogs. She loves to play with them, snooze near them, and follow them around. Muffin would do best in a home with at least one confident resident dog. She looks to other dogs to show her how to trust humans and during her five months at Muddy Paws Muffin has gone from cowering and refusing to leave her crate to a social happy girl. She greets her humans at the door with a smile and little grunts of joy every time. She potty trained herself and doesn't make a peep inside - we've never heard her bark ever. She needs more time still to fully open up to humans but she'll happily take treats from your hands and has even started allowing butt scritches and pets. All Muffin really wants and needs is a soft clean place to lay, good food to eat, and a canine friend or two. After all Muffin has been through and the bravery she has shown, she deserves her forever home. Could you be it for her?

﻿Muffin is approximately 7y 5m 9d old, approximately 26 pounds, and we estimate their optimal weight to be about 22 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

Although our dogs are listed as unknown breed, buildings with specific dog restrictions typically enforce their rules based on what breeds a dog appears to resemble. It's always important to keep that in mind and know your building's policies before adopting a dog.

name: Sugar
description:
Meet Sugar – a sweet soul with a spunky spirit and a heart full of love

Don’t let my name fool you- I’m more than just sweet. I’m spunky, curious, and full of personality. At 8 years young, I still have plenty of pep in my step for walks, outdoor exploring, and playtime with my favorite humans.

I was born deaf, so I experience the world a little differently, but that doesn’t slow me down one bit. I’m learning sign language (how cool is that?!) and doing great with it, though my foster mom is also teaching me touch signals. What helps me thrive is a calm, structured home with a predictable routine and people who understand that I feel safest when things are steady.

I can get a bit anxious when there’s too much change, but once I know what to expect, I settle right in and show my loving, loyal side. I adore being close to my people- whether it’s curling up on the couch, joining a little adventure, or simply being your shadow.

I’m currently being fostered with both dogs and cats, and I get along beautifully with everyone. I’ve also been around kids and am gentle and patient with them- especially when they offer belly rubs or treats!

And here’s a fun fact: after eight years apart, I was reunited with my birth sister in foster care!

I may not hear when you call me a good girl, but I feel it in my heart every time you show me love. If you’re looking for a gentle, affectionate companion who thrives on routine and will be your loyal best friend through it all, I think we might be the perfect match.

﻿Sugar is approximately 8y 2m 14d old and is fully grown at 35 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

Although our dogs are listed as unknown breed, buildings with specific dog restrictions typically enforce their rules based on what breeds a dog appears to resemble. It's always important to keep that in mind and know your building's policies before adopting a dog.

This dog is available for adoption through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you're interested in adopting, the first thing you should do is begin the registration process at www.muddypawsrescue.org. If you are already a registered adopter with Muddy Paws Rescue, please email us at adoptionmeetings@muddypawsrescue.org.

name: Swiper
description:
Swiper is a very timid little boy that needs a human that is willing to be incredibly patient with him. He can open up given enough time and some furry friends who can show him how to dog. He is still fearful around people right now but has turned into a little cuddle bug with his foster mom and makes a little bit more progress each day. He takes awhile to warm up to new environments and likes to spend a lot of his time in his crate at first, but he'll slowly start exploring and engaging if given his own space to do so. He loves playing and engaging with other dogs (as long as they're close to his size), and he gains confidence from being able to mirror their behavior and learn how to interact with the world, so he would really love a sibling similar in size to himself.

Swiper is still fearful of most humans and will run away or retreat to his crate if they try to pet him, speak to him, or make eye contact. However, over time he's gotten attached to his foster mom and proven that he can be very affectionate, cuddly, and loving with humans if interactions are slow and on his terms.

﻿Swiper is approximately 1y 7m 7d old and is fully grown at 12 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

Although our dogs are listed as unknown breed, buildings with specific dog restrictions typically enforce their rules based on what breeds a dog appears to resemble. It's always important to keep that in mind and know your building's policies before adopting a dog.

name: Charles
description:
Charles is a lil cutie sniffing machine! Even in the first days in a big city, he is a curious pup with big energy. It took him no time at all to warm up to people in our home and explore the neighborhood. Charlie may need slow introductions outside of home because he's initially a little shy but opens up fast! He's smart and really knows what's going on! A very quick learner. Charles will walk up and sniff down anything new. Walking with him is like a scavenger hunt; he'll surely show you where the good spots are. We were so surprised to find that this adult dog, even after days of traveling and relocation, had the energy to zoom all around and all over us! Charlie is just a little bundle of love. We hope he finds a family that can give him all the loving in the world.

﻿Charles is approximately 4y 8m 13d old and is fully grown at 30 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

Although our dogs are listed as unknown breed, buildings with specific dog restrictions typically enforce their rules based on what breeds a dog appears to resemble. It's always important to keep that in mind and know your building's policies before adopting a dog.

name: Ernie
description:
If you’re looking for a goofy, vivacious snuggle bug who will be completely obsessed with you, Ernie is the boy for you!

﻿Ernie is approximately 3y 1m 26d old and is fully grown at 45 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Affogato
description:
Affogato is a sweeet goofball as his name indicates! He’s a clumsy couch hippo still learning his size and strength; he has a tendency to knock some furniture over when he gets the zoomies and he tries to be a lap dog at 80 pounds. This boy has SO much love to give and just needs someone to give him some structure and consistency so he knows where to put it :)

He is a HIGH energy dog still learning manners and how to be alone so he can get mouthy and will need someone to give him good enrichment and show him the ropes!

﻿Affogato is approximately 3y 2m 12d old and is fully grown at 76 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

description:
Loki is a laid back and very sweet boy who enjoys his time lounging around, whether it's on the couch or on you. His play sessions may not last very long but he definitely enjoys a good romp. He's a foodie through and through with the quickest way to his heart being just about any snack.

name: Kilimanjaro
description:
Kilimanjaro (aka Jaro) is a very loving pup. He loves all the attention he can get and will happily stay glued to your hip, whether that’s relaxing on the couch, wrapped up in the sheets in bed, or smelling whatever you’re cooking. He’s really friendly with new people too. He’ll wag his little tail and put his big ears back and greet with kisses anytime somebody comes into the room. 

He’s still a puppy so he has a little work to do with leash training and has the occasional accident inside but he’s food motivated and seems to take well to training so I could see him being perfect with a little bit of patience. Also potty accidents are usually avoided if he’s taken out every couple hours. He’s a great companion and will have an amazing time with somebody who’s ready to give him the love he needs.

﻿Kilimanjaro is approximately 0y 6m 20d old and may be 45 to 65 pounds when fully grown. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

description:
Wilbur will burrow his way into your heart! Wilbur is an absolute lap dog and cuddle-bug, and loves being with you. He's always up for adventure, and down to snuggle. Wilbur is a very happy and affectionate pup that loves giving and receiving kisses. He loves chews, playing fetch, going on walks, and playing with Edna.

﻿Wilbur (bonded with Edna) is approximately 3y 1m 19d old and is fully grown at 9 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

description:
Edna is a super silly and sweet little potato that loves cozying up with you and being affectionate. She is a bit skittish, especially at first, but is growing her confidence! She loves playing tug, fetch (at a shorter distance than Wilbur), and burrowing under blankets and pillows.

﻿Edna (bonded with Wilbur) is approximately 3y 7m 9d old, approximately 10 pounds, and we estimate their optimal weight to be about 8 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Nefertiti
description:
Hi!  I'm Nefertiti, but you can call me Neffy or Lil' Nefs!

I spend most of my day doing my favorite activity...napping!  While I take my beauty sleep very seriously, I'll happily get up for the important things (like walking and treat time).  Once I have the time to decompress, I'm an easygoing girl who loves being near my people.  A comfy place to snooze and some belly rubs are really all I need.  If you're looking for a clumsy companion to stroll with you, snack with you, and snore with you, I think we'd be a perfect match!

﻿Nefertiti is approximately 11y 2m 1d old and is fully grown at 44 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Hustle
description:
Hustle has been such a joy to foster! He is the cuddliest little guy! He loves curling up right next to you and will happily nap on your lap for as long as you let him. He’s also great on walks and very easy to redirect if he gets curious about something.

We switched his food to Baby Blue, which he’s been doing really well on. He sleeps straight through the night without any issues and settles down beautifully at bedtime.

Hustle is such a sweet, affectionate, easygoing pup and has been an absolute pleasure to have in my home!

﻿Hustle is approximately 0y 7m 13d old and may be 59 to 71 pounds when fully grown. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Blondie
description:
Blondie is the sweetest girl you can imagine, and has had a tough road. She just wants to have someone by her side and with her to be close to. Because of her life experiences, it is clear that other dogs and exposure to other dogs are not her favorite thing, and would thrive in a place where she can relax and call her very own. She loves playing little rounds of fetch, loves her little snuffle ball, and loves to cuddle. She has yet to meet a person (adult!) she does not love. She loves her little walks, assuming she doesn't see any other doggies, and just would thrive in a quiet place where she has near constant companionship.

﻿Blondie is approximately 12y 6m 23d old and is fully grown at 13 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Champ
description:
Champ is an incredibly sweet boy who is eager to please. He walks confidently and with purpose through NYC and is happy to stop and say hello. Champ loves to snuggle and is happy to chill at your feet. He’s a great WFH companion, crate trained, potty trained and is excellent on the leash. He’s a gentle soul looking for another gentle soul.

﻿Champ is approximately 6y 1m 18d old and is fully grown at 42 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Bridgett
description:
Bridgett is a young, playful, smart and curious dog. She does amazing in her crate and when left alone, and sleeps through the night. It is her safe space. The first couple of days she was  nervous but after a couple of days you can really see her amazing sweet, playful and loving personality develop. 

She is very very intelligent and food motivated and picks up on things very quickly. She is a puller on the leash but it’s because she is nervous outside. She does a lot better on a harness and responds very well to training outside. She is a beautiful dog who would do great with someone who is willing to take the time to train her as she is incredibly responsive and capable. 

She has not shown big interest in other dogs or children, but when other dogs do come up to her to say hi she is such a lady and very friendly. Bridgett just needs someone who will love & commit to her! She is going to be an amazing dog and best friend and is such a sweet and intelligent special girl.

﻿Bridgett is approximately 1y 4m 20d old and is fully grown at 31 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Luke
description:
Luke is ready to find his best friends! He has so much love to give and wants to be friends with everyone - just at his own pace. Luke has been very gentle with dogs, cats, and has politely observed chickens. His kryptonite is also his superpower! Loud noises, sudden movements, and the like can startle him causing him to bark but it also means that he's a very smart boy and approaches things with caution (read: very, very open to training!). He LOVES play!! Dolls, bones, treats, snow - you name it, he'll happily chase it for his human. 

Luke also loves other dogs and would do really well in a home with a slightly older dog who still has play energy. Currently, Luke is residing with a human toddler and approaches cautiously. Toddlers make lots of noise which can startle Luke but he's being very brave!

﻿Luke is approximately 2y 8m 17d old and is fully grown at 42 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Coconut
description:
Coconut is just an absolute gem. Lovable, cuddly, and sweet—everyone she meets immediately loves her and people will stop me on the street just to say hi. She loves long walks and exploring her neighborhood (sometimes hard to get her to come back inside, but once she’s in she’s turns into a complete couch potato!). Big fan of belly rubs, a nice long bone to chew for hours or a toy to chase around. She behaves very well on walks, with some light pulling which has improved a ton with her new double leash. She also generally does not get distracted by other dogs or noises on walks (but always on the lookout for squirrels!). A good listener, a best friend and a fun loving spirit. I really can’t say enough good things about this girl. Best of all, she loves the outdoors, whether its rolling around in the grass or just people watching in the park, Coconut could spend her entire day outside.

﻿Coconut is approximately 1y 1m 1d old and is fully grown at 70 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Ellie
description:
Ellie is an adorable walking oxymoron! Indoors, she is a couch potato who gives her belly to everyone, showing trust and her cuddly tendencies. Outside, she is an energetic ball of energy, wanting to get everywhere as fast as possible. People are not convinced when I tell them she is not a puppy. Ellie loves everyone she meets, and we are working on her excitement level about the many potential dog besties on every block. Pretty convinced this is the first time in her eight years that she has gone places on a leash, but she’s picking it up quickly. I suspect she would make an excellent hiking partner, considering how much she has turned the city into her personal parkour course. The girl can jump!

﻿Ellie is approximately 8y 3m 3d old and is fully grown at 37 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Calua
description:
Calua is an incredibly sweet and loving older girl who has a heart full of warmth and affection. She's always ready to offer cuddles and and be your shadow. Despite her age, Calua still has a lively spirit and a playful energy. She is a pro at fetch and nibbling at her stuffed toys. She loves to follow you around, always wanting to be near, and her favorite thing in the world is a good belly rub, which she happily soaks up with pure joy. Her curious nature means she’s always interested in what’s going on around her, eager to explore and learn, but she does it all with a gentle and loving demeanor. Calua’s combination of spunk, sweetness, and open-heartedness makes her a truly special companion who brings comfort and happiness to everyone she meets.

﻿Calua is approximately 9y 1m 6d old and is fully grown at 17 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: T Rex
description:
T Rex (Odette as we call her) is such a smart and sweet pup. She gets so excited to see people and eagerly waits for attention.  While she loves affection she is equally content laying on her own. She has learned to play catch with herself. She will bring the ball on the couch and scoot it off with her nose to jump of and go catch it.  With being as smart as she is and also being food motivated training has been easy.  She takes her blankets and piles them on top of the dog bed to have a very comfy cozy spot to nap.  Her happy, sweet and loving personality with melt your heart. She would be a wonderful addition to any family!

﻿T Rex is approximately 0y 3m 23d old and may be 80 to 100 pounds when fully grown. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Marigold
description:
Marigold is a sweet, gentle, beautiful, quiet, independent pup. She is not very food/treat driven and prefers to be outside. She displays the most joy when seeing other dogs. She walks ok on the leash - occasionally pulls when excited. She loves her plush squeaky toys and will bring them to me to play with her.

﻿Marigold is approximately 1y 0m 25d old and is fully grown at 52 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Cesar
description:
Cesar - lover of tug of war, pro fetch player, and top tier snuggler. In the way cindy lou who made the Grinch's heart grown 5 times bigger, Cesar has that exact same quality. Cesar melts the hearts of everyone he comes across with his desire for pets, snuggles, and kisses. Cesar's nub says it all went it wiggles with excitement when it's time to cuddle up for bedtime or on the couch. His goofy side really begins to shine when it's play time! With his clumsy limbs accidently bumping the ball out of his reach, he still has the drive to chase after it with a smile. I cannot express enough how Cesar will change your life in the best way possible, and everyone will be envious of your furever cuddle buddy.

﻿Cesar is approximately 8y 2m 11d old and is fully grown at 47.3 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Milk Dud
description:
Milk Dud aka Dudley is the stubmuffin low rider squishy meatball of your dreams! Poor Dudley was found wandering the cold NYC streets and brought to the city shelter, where he was very fearful, with irritation around his neck and on his legs. Since coming into a foster home, he instantly blossomed into a joyful, goofy, affectionate dumpling. He flops down head first into your lap for belly rubs, grumbles with joy when pet and kissing your face, lifts one ear only when listening carefully, and happily snoozes most of the day away. He is great in his crate, and will sleep for hours when left alone. If you're looking for the ultimate friendly, low energy, indoor-preferred snuggly couch potato this winter, Dudley is your guy!

Dudley arrived to foster recently from his stay at the shelter where he was very fearful, and is working on building his courage walking on the street on leash. He currently does not go on walks on the street, but is comfortable with fosters Brooklyn yard. We are working hard to build his confidence, and he's making progress! He would also do well with a resident dog to show him the ropes.

﻿Milk Dud is approximately 3y 0m 29d old and is fully grown at 42 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Harley
description:
Meet Harley — a sweet, cuddly, affectionate boy who loves being close to his person. He’ll lean into you for snuggles and quiet time and has so much love to give once he feels safe.

He’s a sensitive guy who can be unsure in new situations, so he’ll do best with someone patient and calm who can help him feel safe and supported. With reassurance and consistency, he becomes noticeably more relaxed, trusting, and connected.

If you’re someone who values a gentle, loyal companion and understands the power of patience, Harley will be the perfect match ❤️

﻿Harley is approximately 8y 3m 2d old and is fully grown at 18 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Yoru
description:
Hi, I’m Yoru, and I’m a #BoroughBred Gentleman! I was found as a stray shortly before Thanksgiving, so not much is known about my past but that hasn’t stopped me from being optimistic about my future!
My foster mom thinks I’m the cutest, sweetest guy who loves to go on walks, meal times, naps and cuddles. My two fur siblings - a small dog and cage-free bunny - don’t mind me one bit either. I’m about 7yrs old and weigh 47lbs, so I’m perfect size for a road trip. Did I mention I love car rides?

﻿Yoru is approximately 7y 0m 7d old and is fully grown at 47 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

name: Bigsby
description:
Bigsby is a sweet, goofy boy with a bit of spunk and the perfect amount of energy. This handsome gentleman might be a little shy at first, but not for long, he warms up quickly and he’ll be your most loyal shadow and favorite cuddle buddy! He’s the ultimate lap dog happy to curl up for a nap, lounge on the couch, or keep you company while you work from home. 

Bigsby has the funniest little bursts of playful energy that are impossible not to smile at. He can be a bit of a goofball in the most endearing way! His goofy personality is paired with a clever mind, Bigsby is very smart and loves any kind of food based enrichment. Puzzle feeders, licky mats, kongs - he’s a huge fan of them all and will solve any puzzle in a matter of seconds! He’s got just the right amount of energy to keep things fun, then he’s right back to chillin'. 

When it’s time to get outside, Bigsby enjoys his walks and takes them at an easy pace, appreciating all the sights and smells. He never pulls on leash and walks right by your side the entire time. And when it’s time for treats, Bigsby is always excited for snack time! He LOVES food. He takes his role as “floor-crumb detector” very seriously.

If you’re looking for a wonderful companion who’s equal parts cozy cuddle bug, lighthearted goofball, and smart little sidekick, Bigsby is your guy. He’s ready to find his forever home and shower his new family with love, laughs, and plenty of snuggles!

﻿Bigsby is approximately 8y 1m 2d old and is fully grown at 15 pounds. They are microchipped and up to date on all age-appropriate medical care. Their breed is unknown as we have not had a DNA test done.

description:
