name: Ted
description: Ted - 6 years, 18lbs, Pug/Chi Mix, Neutered This dog is eligible to join our foster-to-adopt program. Please email fostertoadopt@socialteesnyc.org with the animal’s name in the subject line if you are interested! Want to straight up adopt? Submit an adoption application at socialteesnyc.org. Their Foster Parent Says: "Ted is a sweet, loving boy who loves treats, bones, and exploring the city. He does great in all kinds of public situations and will accompany you on your walk to the coffee shop or to a fun pet-friendly store! He is very treat-motivated but is polite with his meals and likes to graze throughout the day. Napping in a cozy blanket while watching reality TV is one of his favorite afternoon activities. He is very curious about what the people are up to and will follow to observe you (just in case you're getting a treat). Ted would love a backyard that he can freely explore and hang out in when the weather is nice, but he also loves wandering around the city, so it's not a must. Ted is very patient and doesn't mind when you leave, he will curl up and snooze or stare out the window while you're away. He has some boundaries regarding his feet and taking medicine, but is totally fine with being picked up and held for traveling and subway rides." Level of dog ownership experience needed: BEGINNER: This means we predict this dog will be low on the challenge scale due to its breed/age combo. Potentially a good fit for someone who has relevant dog care experience (fostering, dog sitting) and is looking to adopt their first pup. MEDIUM: Needs a daily 60 minute walk or window of quick paced exercise (minimum) in addition to potty break strolls (10-30 min each). Also needs significant socializing opportunities outside the home and mental stimulation at home like tricks training practice, chew items, and puzzle toys. (This is regardless of dog size – many small breeds were designed for lots of activity and will exhibit unwanted behavior when they’re understimulated.) Potty trained? Probably! Adults usually are, but all will have transitional accidents for the first week or so. A consistent walking route and schedule plus finding spots with grass or dirt can help. Social with other dogs? Yes, but we don’t know to what degree yet. Some like to wrestle with every passing pup, others can coexist well but prefer to keep to themselves. We’ll learn more soon. Social with cats? Not sure yet! Some breed mixes that are generally NOT great matches for homes with cats include large hounds, huskies, and shepherds. Comfortable with children? (ALWAYS requires adult supervision) We’re not sure yet, but we try to err on the side of caution. Respectful kids ages 8 and up are probably a safe bet. Children must always be monitored and taught to interact with dogs of any age respectfully. Okay in the city? We don’t know yet. Most adult dogs do well in the city after they’ve had time to adjust to a new environment, but some never adapt and need homes in the burbs. Medical status Ted has pulmonary hypertension - a side effect of being treated for heartworm. Requires daily medication and annual monitoring. He ended up in the ER for a few days a few months ago but has been doing really well on his medication once we were able to find out exactly what was going on! Up to date on their DHPP, Bordetella, and Rabies vaccines; heartworm negative; spayed/neutered; microchipped; treated with dewormer upon intake. name: Francis
description: FRANCIS - 8 months & 10lbs (as of 10/14), Chi Mix, Spayed Estimated to Be About 15lbs Full Grown This puppy is eligible to join our foster-to-adopt program. Please email fostertoadopt@socialteesnyc.org with the animal’s name in the subject line if you are interested! Want to straight up adopt? Submit an adoption application at socialteesnyc.org. Our Team Says: "Francis needs a home in a calm area. She's not fully a city girl. Calm areas and beyond are best for this girl!" Thier Foster Parents Says: "Francis is a sweet, silly and rambunctious gal who is very shy at first but really bursts out of her shell once she’s comfortable. She’s curious about the world around her and is always the first one to investigate new items at home (she is not this brave out in the wild). Fran loves to play hard but loves to nap just as much! Fran loves a good sunbathing moment and will always look for a sunny spot around the house to bask in. She loves going on walks especially with her K9 foster brother (her preferred company), but is very hesitant to do her business in new places, the slower the pace the better. Though she is a very friendly pup, she shies away from strangers out in public, she prefers slow meet and greets. She’s a big cuddle bug, and loves behind the ear scratches. Francis loves following her human around when they're home, on my work from home days she can be found hanging out in my study with her foster brother or napping by my feet while I take a meeting. True to her inner chihuahua nature, this small gal has a small but mighty bark, especially when she gets spooked, she’s not a fan of surprises or loud noises. Fran can be a little stubborn (especially when it involves an early morning wake up) but overall, is a very good girl!" Level of dog ownership experience needed: INTERMEDIATE: As an adult, this dog will need significant structure and plenty of daily exercise, training, and mental stimulation – 90 consecutive minutes of movement in the morning plus potty break walks and brain games throughout the day. The adopter must have relevant primary care experience with a similar breed, temperament, and/or energy level. (Primary care experience includes ownership, fostering, or dog sitting as an adult, not a dog you grew up with.) Relevant puppy care experience is a huge plus, but bare minimum the adopter must have TONS of time and patience. Raising a puppy can be a lot of fun, but it’s also tremendous work. Puppies’ personalities and exercise/stimulation requirements change dramatically between now and when they’re a year old as their bodies and brains develop, so an active lifestyle and the ability to adapt to a pup’s evolving needs are a must. We strongly urge professional dog training with a rewards based trainer from the get go. Adults only or kids ages 8 and up – all puppies go through a mouthy, rambunctious phase and often accidentally hurt children when playing. PLEASE DO YOUR OWN BREED RESEARCH to make sure you have a better understanding of the kind of temperament and exercise requirements this dog may have as an adult. Energy level MEDIUM: Very young puppies sleep and nap a lot, but their energy level skyrockets when they become teens (4 months to around a year). As an adult, this dog will need significant structure and plenty of daily exercise, training, and mental stimulation – 90 consecutive minutes of movement in the morning plus potty break walks and brain games throughout the day at a minimum. (This is regardless of dog size – many small breeds were designed for lots of activity and will exhibit unwanted behavior when they’re understimulated.) Cuddle Bug Level Medium — Likes to snuggle when he's in the mood but often stays in his own bed Potty Trained Sort of — On the way and learning! may be using wee pads (is a puppy or a brand new rescue) Comfy with strangers? Nope — Quite the wallflower, very shy with new people and takes a while to warm up. Afraid when unfamiliar people try to say hi on the street, hides or shrinks back when new people visit the home. Good with Children? (ALWAYS requires supervision) Yes for 12 and up — may be a little energetic or a little skittish, best with older children that can be extra gentle or that are big enough not to get accidentally knocked down Good with Other Dogs? Mostly — Generally good with other dogs but may be picky (scared of big dogs or plays too rough for small dogs, for example) Good with Other Animals? (cats, small pets, etc.) Francis is still too unsure of the world around to notice the birds and squirrels she encounters on her walks. Mouthy Behavior? Low – Little to no interest in chewing on stuff or putting things in its mouth that aren’t food. Doesn’t try to chew on hands, feet, etc. during playtime, doesn’t wreck your stuff — only chews on appropriate things like dog toys and bones. Leash Manners? Getting the Hang of it – Probably hasn’t been on a leash much in its life but he/she is figuring it out. Might be a mild puller but responds to correction. Okay in the city? Nope — Needs a home out of the city! Jumping on People to Say Hi? Medium – Jumps up only on people the dog knows when really excited. Stops with correction. Separation Anxiety? Medium – Might cry for a few minutes when you first leave the house but settles pretty quickly and has no problem being left alone. Crate training? Not at all – Don’t even have one, I’ve puppy proofed and we free range. Medical status: Healthy as far as we know. Up to date on their DHPP and Bordetella vaccines (for dogs under 4 months old, adopters will need to finish the DHPP vaccine series and administer the Rabies vaccine at 16 weeks of age), spayed/neutered; microchipped; treated with dewormer upon How this dog ended up with Social Tees: Most of our dogs come via partner groups who help us save them from shelters where they are at risk of euthanasia in Tennessee or St. Thomas. There are very few spay/neuter resources there and many more animals in those areas than there are people to adopt them. Rescue groups like ours bring them to the northeast where the desire for pets like these allows us to save their lives. PLEASE NOTE: We cannot guarantee any breed mix, exact age, or full grown size (if the dog is under a year old). We do our best with very educated guesses though! This animal is not at the Social Tees office, all are in foster homes. LEARN MORE ABOUT US: socialteesnyc.org and Instagram @socialteesnyc

name: Aslan
description: Aslan - 7 months, 35lbs, Collie Mix, Neutered Estimated to be about 45lbs full grown This puppy is eligible to join our foster-to-adopt program. Please email fostertoadopt@socialteesnyc.org with the animal’s name in the subject line if you are interested! Want to straight up adopt? Submit an adoption application a t socialteesnyc.org Level of dog ownership experience needed: INTERMEDIATE: As an adult, this dog will need significant structure and plenty of daily exercise, training, and mental stimulation – 90 consecutive minutes of movement in the morning plus potty break walks and brain games throughout the day. The adopter must have relevant primary care experience with a similar breed, temperament, and/or energy level. (Primary care experience includes ownership, fostering, or dog sitting as an adult, not a dog you grew up with.) Relevant puppy care experience is a huge plus, but bare minimum the adopter must have TONS of time and patience. Raising a puppy can be a lot of fun, but it’s also tremendous work. Puppies’ personalities and exercise/stimulation requirements change dramatically between now and when they’re a year old as their bodies and brains develop, so an active lifestyle and the ability to adapt to a pup’s evolving needs are a must. We strongly urge professional dog training with a rewards based trainer from the get go. Adults only or kids ages 8 and up – all puppies go through a mouthy, rambunctious phase and often accidentally hurt children when playing. PLEASE DO YOUR OWN BREED RESEARCH to make sure you have a better understanding of the kind of temperament and exercise requirements this dog may have as an adult. Energy level MEDIUM: Very young puppies sleep and nap a lot, but their energy level skyrockets when they become teens (4 months to around a year). As an adult, this dog will need significant structure and plenty of daily exercise, training, and mental stimulation – 90 consecutive minutes of movement in the morning plus potty break walks and brain games throughout the day at a minimum. (This is regardless of dog size – many small breeds were designed for lots of activity and will exhibit unwanted behavior when they’re understimulated.) POTTY TRAINED? Working on this skill. Puppies under 12 weeks old are often on track with their wee pad skills, but they’re too young to walk outside in public NYC areas yet because they haven’t finished their puppy vaccine series. Puppies older than 12 weeks are usually learning to do their business outside. Potty training takes a lot of patience, consistency, and clean up. SOCIAL WITH DOGS? Yes. Some puppies are shy, others are bold, but all have the potential to be taught healthy socializing skills. It’s a huge part of raising a puppy and must be done carefully. How they interact with other dogs depends largely on how their humans help them learn to. SOCIAL WITH CHILDREN? (ALWAYS requires adult supervision) Yes… but most puppies are not a great match for a home with kids under age 8 because they go through intense mouthy play and rambunctious phases and often accidentally hurt young kids while playing. Children must always be monitored and taught to interact with dogs of any age respectfully. SOCIAL WITH CATS? Yes. Almost all puppies have the potential to be friends with a cat. It’s on the adopter to know their cat’s temperament and preferences and to teach their puppy respectful manners. MOUTHY PLAY: High! All puppies go through phases where they chew your stuff and grab your hands, arms, feet… puppies naturally explore the world, play, and test boundaries with their mouths. (It also happens when they’re teething.) Their teeth are super sharp though, so it can be a very painful phase for humans and other animals in the home. Proper training, outlets, and socialization are key. SEPARATION ANXIETY MEDIUM: Most puppies have some level of separation anxiety as they learn to self soothe. Often they cry the first 10+ minutes when they are left home alone or in a crate. Consistent training and alone time is crucial. LEASH MANNERS: None. :) Will need to learn this skill. CRATE TRAINED: Nope. None of our new puppies have been formally trained, but many of our foster parents/adopters choose to crate train. It can be a great way to keep puppies safe and teach them independence. MEDICAL STATUS: Healthy as far as we know. Up to date on their DHPP and Bordetella vaccines (for dogs under 4 months old, adopters will need to finish the DHPP vaccine series and administer the Rabies vaccine at 16 weeks of age), spayed/neutered; microchipped; treated with dewormer upon HOW DID THIS DOG END UP WITH US? Most of our dogs come via partner groups who help us save them from shelters where they are at risk of euthanasia in Tennessee, Los Angeles and Puerto Rico. There are very few spay/neuter resources there and many more animals in those areas than there are people to adopt them. Rescue groups like ours bring them to the northeast where the desire for pets like these allows us to save their lives. PLEASE NOTE: We cannot guarantee any breed mix, exact age, or full grown size (if the dog is under a year old). We do our best with very educated guesses though! This animal is not at the Social Tees office, all are in foster homes. LEARN MORE ABOUT US: socialteesnyc.org and Instagram @socialteesnyc

name: Centralworld Plaza / Niko
description: Meet Central World Plaza, aka Niko - the sweetest pup in all of New York! 🚕🗽 Niko is the happiest dog you could ever meet! He loves playtime with humans and dogs alike, and will happily play by himself when others are occupied. Niko gets many compliments for his adorable face and for how friendly he is! Niko is as smart as he is cute - he has mastered sit, is potty trained and sleeps through the night! Niko would love a home with a yard to run around in, or alternatively someone who can take him out for long walks or to the dog run twice a day. He would do well in a home with other dogs. He’s a quiet pup - only barking occasionally when very excited when playing with other dogs. He loves head scratches, nap time, belly rubs & giving as much love as he receives. He will be an incredibly loyal companion to his forever family. Personality & Characteristics: Sweet, smart, playful Good with: People, Dogs, Kids My foster dog is: House trained 3 Keywords for your pup: Energetic, Smart, Loving Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 7 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Quiet pup, occaisonal excited barks Walking Manners: Can pull when eager/excited but otherwise great and improving Appetite: Good! Enjoys his food & is treat motivated. Favorite Things: Long walks with lots of exploration! Fetching his toys or a tennis ball. Head scratches & belly rubs. Commands/Tricks: Sit. ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. The application can be found at WaldosRescue.org and once you are approved to adopt you will be put in touch with the foster to see if it’s a good match. We are a RESCUE not a shelter. We conduct veterinary and personal reference checks during the application approval process. We are unable to contact every applicant for every dog. We will select the best applicant for each dog, based on the dogs needs. Waldos Rescue Pen is a 501c3 whose primary focus is rescuing dogs from the euthanasia list from high kill shelters throughout the United States

name: Fried Pickles
description: Meet Fried Pickles! She’s the smartest, friendliest, most loyal pup you’ll ever meet. Her energy level is right in the middle—not too hyper, but always up for some fun. She’ll bark occasionally and can be pretty vocal when playing with other dogs or when feeling territorial. The only time she has issues with other dogs is when possessive over toys or food, so being the only dog in the household would be best. She’s getting better at walking on a leash and still pulls a little, but she's smart, food-motivated and trainable, so it's getting better. With treats she’ll happily follow along and try not to get distracted too much by squirrels, rabbits and scooters. Super food-driven and smart, she already knows a lot of commands like “sit, stay, down, roll, kiss, paw, leave it, come, play dead". She loves giving her paw—sometimes without even being asked! If you’re looking for a sweet, goofy, and loving pup to be your best friend, Fried Pickles is your girl! ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. The application can be found at WaldosRescue.org and once you are approved to adopt you will be put in touch with the foster to see if it’s a good match. We are a RESCUE not a shelter. We conduct veterinary and personal reference checks during the application approval process. We are unable to contact every applicant for every dog. We will select the best applicant for each dog, based on the dogs needs. Waldos Rescue Pen is a 501c3 whose primary focus is rescuing dogs from the euthanasia list from high kill shelters throughout the United States and Korea.

name: Test Pet
description: Meet X! He/She is ready for home on X/XX from Westport MA. Please apply for X if you are willing to pre-adopt him/her before arrival or to meet once in a MA foster home, if still available. Should this pup receive an adoption commitment prior to your application being processed, we will share with you the other arriving pups that are not yet posted online. THIS PUP IS STILL AVAILABLE IF YOU ARE SEEING THIS LISTING ––we pull listings down after receiving 2 - 3 viable applications to minimize adopter disappointment. Please do not email, simply submit an application link here www.rescueinc.dog/adopt and we do respond to every application within 48 hours. Read through our adoption process and other adoption FAQs here www.rescueinc.dog/FAQs All of our pups come with the following: Spayed or Neutered Age appropriate vaccinations + dewormed + 4DX test (if older than 6 months) Dosed with flea/tick + heartworm preventatives New martingale collar with 6' lead + temp ID tag 30 days free insurance to be activated within 24 hours of your wellness visit with your veterinarian Microchip with free registration for your new pup, but also for any other pets in your household too! Our southern dogs, 6 months and older, come with a **Proheart 6 injection which provides 6 months of Heartworm protection (approx value of $100) **dogs surrendered to us in MA do not recieve the Proheart 6 injection but do go home dosed with flea / tick / heartworm preventative so there is no lapse in protection Ages listed can be approximate and breed mixes are a best guess based on physical characteristics.

name: Tink
description: Tink - 5 years, 34lbs, Pocket Pit, Spayed This dog is eligible to join our foster-to-adopt program. Please email fostertoadopt@socialteesnyc.org with the animal’s name in the subject line if you are interested! Want to straight up adopt? Submit an adoption application at socialteesnyc.org. Thier Foster Parent Says: " Tink is a very sweet girl. She’s the biggest cuddle bug and definitely thinks she’s a lap dog. She’s a good sleeper throughout the night and just stays in the bed with you until you get it. So no waking you up in the morning. She loves her morning walks in the park and saying hi to everyone she can. Silly girl does like to eat things off the ground so got to watch out for that but good news she will let you grab whatever she’s eating out of mouth without a fight. She is not food aggressive in any way. I don’t think she knows any commands but does understand the word no. Sadly she does not play with any toys! She doesn’t know what to do with them! Maybe it’s something she will learn in time. Safe to say she doesn’t tear anything up though, all your shoes and furniture are safe. She if the biggest lover girl and will be attached to your side." Level of dog ownership experience needed: INTERMEDIATE: This dog will need significant structure and plenty of daily exercise, training, and mental stimulation – 90 consecutive minutes of movement in the morning plus potty break walks and brain games throughout the day. The adopter must have relevant primary care experience with a similar breed, temperament, and/or energy level. (Primary care experience includes ownership, fostering, or dog sitting as an adult, not a dog you grew up with.) Also needs significant socializing opportunities outside the home and mental stimulation at home like tricks training practice, chew items, and puzzle toys. (This is regardless of dog size – many small breeds were designed for lots of activity and will exhibit unwanted behavior when they’re understimulated.) Cuddle bug level? EXTRA CUDDLY, wants to be in the lap at all times Potty trained? yes, had accident very first day but understandable she was adjusting! No more since then Comfy with strangers? Yes! She LOVES people and wants to say hi to everyone, gentle girl Comfortable with children? not sure, she’s not jumpy with it comes to people and wags her tail when walking past kids but so far no interaction Social with other dogs? needs some work, gets extremely excited and cries/jumps towards all dogs. I wouldn’t say unfriendly but needs to learn some manners. I think other dogs are unsure of her excitement. We need to have longer interactions so see how she is Respectful of other animals? she’s currently in a home with 3 cats. So far good but has a tendency to want to chase when they run fast. 1/10 times she will react towards them. Most of the down she just lays on the couch and ignores them. Maybe a house with one dominant cat would be ok! Mouthy behavior? soooo quiet does not bark at all, maybe heard her bark twice, unless wanting to meet other dogs! Leash manners? she pulls in the beginning, a little zig zaggy but after 15 minutes or so she’s walks along side of you Okay in the city? she prefers a quieter area with more space(currently in ridgewood) she has been in the city but gets overstimulated with all the people and dogs so close Jumping on people to say hi? not really, if you are sitting she wants to prop herself on you Separation anxiety? so far no crying just sleeps on the couch Crate no crate Medical status Healthy as far as we know. name: Bo
description: Meet Bo, a lovable boy whose journey began in March 2020 when he found his forever home. Unfortunately, Bo's owner passed away, leading this beloved boy back into our care once again. Bo is an outgoing and friendly companion who adores being the center of attention. Bo loves to chew on stuffies and Kongs, sleeps peacefully through the night, and is always eager to curl up beside you on the couch. He doesn’t beg for people food, but will come barreling into the kitchen when any bag is open (smart boy!). We suspect Bo lived a pretty sheltered life; he doesn’t seem comfortable around the other dogs, and the busy city makes him anxious. But at our Center, he is a lovable, affectionate, easygoing guy. We have no doubts that he’ll flourish in any loving home outside the city. He's a very well-rounded dog. He is housetrained and walks well on leash, but can be reactive/overexcited when he sees other dogs. He loves car rides and will greet you with a toy and a wagging tail every time you come home. He's a very loyal, happy dog, and we cannot wait to see him in a loving home where he belongs. Please complete an application today to learn more about Bo. All dogs will be altered, microchipped, and receive age-appropriate vaccines prior to adoption. Please note that the listed location for this dog may not be accurate due to technical limitations of this database and we have transportation options available within 6 hours of NYC (so don't let location hold you back)! Interested in fostering or adopting? Need more info on this dog? The first step in the process is filling out an application on our website. Adoption application: www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/general-application/ Foster application: https://www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/dog-foster-application/ Adoption process & fees: www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/process/ For a full list of our available dogs and current adoption promotions, visit: https://nycsecondchancerescue.org/adoptable-dogs/

name: Timmy
description: Timmy - 9 months & 11lbs (as of 10/15), Chi Mix, Neutered Estimated around 13lbs full grown This puppy is eligible to join our foster-to-adopt program. Please email fostertoadopt@socialteesnyc.org with the animal’s name in the subject line if you are interested! Want to straight up adopt? Submit an adoption application at socialteesnyc.org. Their Foster Parent Says: "When I say that Timmy had me falling absolutely head over heels in LOVE with him in less than 2 hours... He is an absolute delight and the MOST delicious little boy I've ever laid eyes on. He is gentle and sweet, curious and excited, and the most perfect blend of chill and fun. I truly don't know what more anyone could ask for. He's potty trained, sleeps through the night, doesn't bark, and hasn't chewed anything in my apartment (except his toys, as he should! He loves chewing toys). When he came to me, I was warned that he was timid and scared easily (which is true), but every day I have watched him challenge himself and become braver. I'm so proud of his progress. He will follow me around my apartment and offer up several kisses and hugs, which is wild because he was pretty terrified of kisses at first. (CUDDLE SHOULD BE HIS MIDDLE NAME THOUGH. He is the sweetest soul for anyone in search of a snuggly little bug.) At the same time, he will also initiate playtime with my 9 year old dog when he gets his zoomies and follow her lead on all our walks; it has been so sweet watching him look to her for guidance. It seems like she's helped him realize the world isn't such a scary place. With that being said, I would definitely recommend a home in a quieter neighborhood (and with a dog, if possible -- especially one that's not super timid, so he can continue to learn from them). For a dog that's so shy, he has been very quick to trust and love and make his way into my heart, so he is the most deserving of a home that will give him all that love right back. He enjoys exploring and sniffing everything on our daily walks (and we have even been able to increase his longer walk of the day to about 60-75 mins). Sometimes we pass a dog on the street that will give him some anxiety, so he may briefly growl a little bit, but otherwise, we can usually walk by them relatively easily. And it may be a challenge teaching him some basic commands like "sit," because he gets a bit overwhelmed and backs up if you reach your arm out at him too quickly. So I'd recommend a family who can be gentle and patient with him for that stuff and who will be very present for him (because even though he's shy, he definitely LOVES his human(s)). All in all, I truly cannot say enough positive things about his behavior, personality, and stunning good looks. He's a charmer, and whoever adopts him is quite simply the luckiest." Level of dog ownership experience needed: INTERMEDIATE: As an adult, this dog will need significant structure and plenty of daily exercise, training, and mental stimulation – 90 consecutive minutes of movement in the morning plus potty break walks and brain games throughout the day. The adopter must have relevant primary care experience with a similar breed, temperament, and/or energy level. (Primary care experience includes ownership, fostering, or dog sitting as an adult, not a dog you grew up with.) Relevant puppy care experience is a huge plus, but bare minimum the adopter must have TONS of time and patience. Raising a puppy can be a lot of fun, but it’s also tremendous work. Puppies’ personalities and exercise/stimulation requirements change dramatically between now and when they’re a year old as their bodies and brains develop, so an active lifestyle and the ability to adapt to a pup’s evolving needs are a must. We strongly urge professional dog training with a rewards based trainer from the get go. Adults only or kids ages 8 and up – all puppies go through a mouthy, rambunctious phase and often accidentally hurt children when playing. PLEASE DO YOUR OWN BREED RESEARCH to make sure you have a better understanding of the kind of temperament and exercise requirements this dog may have as an adult. POTTY TRAINING - At this point, I don't even have pee pads out (I left them out the first couple days, but he never used them and he had no accidents). So I would definitely say he's potty trained! Yes – Few or no accidents COMFORT LEVEL WITH STRANGERS - He's definitely been shy around the few friends I've introduced him to, but he's not hiding or anything. He just tends to stay close to me (if we're in my apt, he'll come sit by me), or if we've been outside, he'll just sit in my lap or lean back into my arms). But he's not avoiding the new people altogether - he seems to be curious, and I'm sure with enough constant socialization he will open up with time. BEHAVIOR WITH CHILDREN (always requires adult supervision) - Would be okay in a home with respectful teenagers and older. SOCIAL BEHAVIOR WITH OTHER DOGS - In my house, he's been nothing but amazing around my dog (and she's been gentle and kind to him, as well, which has been great!). He definitely looks up to her and looks to her for guidance and wants to be near her a lot, so I think he would do VERY well in a home with another dog(s) (I think it would be especially helpful for him so he can get out of his shell even more). On our walks, there have been a few bigger dogs that have gotten him nervous, but he did stop and give a dog a few kisses today! I was very impressed! SOCIAL WITH CATS? Yes. Almost all puppies have the potential to be friends with a cat. It’s on the adopter to know their cat’s temperament and preferences and to teach their puppy respectful manners. MOUTHY BEHAVIOR - On the rare occasion he will try to put my fingers in his mouth when we're cuddling (BUT it's not in a teething or trying to bite me type of way - it's always been very gentle and VERY brief). He hasn't really chewed anything major in my home that he isn't supposed to (he did pick up a coaster and nibbled on that for a minute, but that's about it). Past this stage– Little to no interest in chewing on stuff or putting things in their mouth that aren’t food. Doesn’t try to chew on hands, feet, etc. during playtime SEPARATION ANXIETY (Please leave your foster dog home alone every day for at least 20 minutes.)Adjusting – Might cry for a few minutes when you first leave the house but settles pretty quickly and has no problem being left alone otherwise. LEASH MANNERS - I would say he pulls a little at times or gets a bit scared by a noise and will abruptly stop walking or hop to a side or something. But all in all, I'd say he's pretty good on the leash and we're working on increasing the length of our walks. We've had a few that were 60-90 mins, and he has been loving them! Getting the hang of it – Probably hasn’t been on a leash much in their life but figuring it out. Might be a mild puller but responds to correction. CUDDLE BUG LEVEL - I would say he is VERY snuggly and cuddly - I would say somewhere between medium and high depending on the day/time. We were initially having him sleep in his little bed on the ground next to my bed (where I sleep with my dog), and the past couple nights he's hopped up into my bed and slept with us there. He likes to come cuddle on the couch with me as well, but I also leave his bed on my couch during the day, so he'll cuddle up in there a lot as well. JUMPING ON PEOPLE TO SAY HELLO - I think because of his shyness and being easily spooked, he hasn't yet explored jumping on people or dogs, but he does jump on me when I come home out of excitedness. For other people though, it's usually very calm! He definitely follows me around the house though! Calm Greetings – Doesn’t jump up on people or dogs. Always all four on the floor. CRATE TRAINING - I wasn't given a crate when I picked up Timmy, so we've been just going with it and letting him free in the apartment, even when I leave. So far, this has not been an issue How this dog ended up with Social Tees: Most of our dogs come via partner groups who help us save them from shelters where they are at risk of euthanasia in Tennessee or St. Thomas. There are very few spay/neuter resources there and many more animals in those areas than there are people to adopt them. Rescue groups like ours bring them to the northeast where the desire for pets like these allows us to save their lives. PLEASE NOTE: We cannot guarantee any breed mix, exact age, or full grown size (if the dog is under a year old). We do our best with very educated guesses though! This animal is not at the Social Tees office, all are in foster homes. LEARN MORE ABOUT US: socialteesnyc.org and Instagram @socialteesnyc

name: Luke
description: Are you looking for a loyal companion whose only goal is to love and be loved? Meet Luke, a senior dog who has been waiting patiently for a quiet home to call his own. Luke is an incredibly sweet boy who truly aims to please. It's clear he hasn't had the easiest life, as he can be a bit head shy, but his capacity for forgiveness is immense. All he wants is a gentle hand and a person to dote on. To help Luke find the perfect retirement home, a generous anonymous donor has sponsored a portion of his adoption fee! (Luke's adoption fee is $150) We've made sure Luke is all set for his new beginning. He's had a full senior bloodwork panel and a recent dental cleaning (including x-rays and extractions). Like many seniors, he has some age-related aches and anxiety, but both are easily managed with affordable daily medication. He also has some "Westie skin itchies," which are common and manageable. He's had great relief with a monthly injection and daily Benadryl. Luke's Ideal Home: He needs to be the only pet in the home. While he's friendly with other dogs on leash, he wants to be the king of his own castle and soak up all your attention. A calm, adult-only household is best. He needs a home without small children (now or in the future) to help him feel safe and secure. This wonderful, resilient boy has so much love left to give. Could you be the one to show him what a true forever home feels like? Vaccinated for rabies, DHPP, bordetella, and Lepto. Neutered and microchipped. Current on flea, tick, and heartworm prevention. To apply to adopt Luke, visit our website ( www.waggytailrescue.org ) for a foster application. It is important to fill out an application as soon as possible for consideration, and we require a complete application for you to meet an animal. We are currently unable to respond to general email inquiries as an all-volunteer run rescue. If the dog is on our website, they are still available. Waggytail Rescue CANNOT guarantee the exact age of any adoptable dog, or final size of any of our adoptable puppies. We rely on the information provided to us by veterinarians, shelters, owner surrenders and other circumstances bringing the dog into our rescue. Questions: adopt@waggytailrescue.org

name: Chewy
description: A Spirted Senior with a Zest for Life & Pinch of Spice! Prepare to be amazed by Chewy, a vibrant 12-year-old Chihuahua who defies his age with boundless energy and a remarkable zest for life! This little guy is a testament to resilience, a true survivor with a charming, spicy side. Thanks to exceptional care, Chewy is incredibly healthy and feeling his absolute best. He's beautifully settled into foster life, rediscovering trust and learning the joy of a secure environment. While he navigates the world being newly blind, it certainly doesn't slow down this energetic senior! He's looking for a compassionate adopter who will appreciate his spirited nature and help him continue to thrive at his own gentle pace. Watch him blossom further with time, understanding, and all the tender loving care you can offer! Chewy has made tremendous progress learning to use pee pads in his foster home (he's also a pro at napping on the job when visiting his foster mom's hospital – she's a great vet!). And don't worry about his occasional grumbles – with a full mouth extraction, his bite is all bark and no ouch! Despite having degenerative mitral valve disease (DVMD), Chewy is currently medication-free and living life to the fullest. He's ready to trade his past for a quiet, loving home where he can spend his remaining years feeling cherished and secure. If you're searching for a loyal, energetic companion with a dash of delightful sass , Chewy might just be the missing piece in your life. Vaccinated for rabies, DHPP, lepto, and bordetella. Neutered, heartworm negative, and microchipped. Current on flea, tick, and heartworm prevention. To apply for Chewy, visit our website ( www.waggytailrescue.org ) for an adoption application. It is important to fill out an application as soon as possible for consideration, and we require a complete application for you to meet an animal. We are currently unable to respond to general email inquiries as an all-volunteer run rescue. If the dog is on our website, they are still available. Waggytail Rescue CANNOT guarantee the exact age of any adoptable dog, or final size of any of our adoptable puppies. We rely on the information provided to us by veterinarians, shelters, owner surrenders and other circumstances bringing the dog into our rescue. Adoptions: adopt@waggytailrescue.org

name: Chiquito
description: Meet Chiquito! Chiquito is a 5-year-old, 22-pound male dachshund terrier mix from Alabama! Chiquito is a cuddly, cozy, loving pup looking for a place to nap and someone willing to throw a toy for him to chase. Chiquito has adjusted beautifully to life in Brooklyn, and is eager to go on walks in the neighborhood and meet as many neighborhood pups as possible. Chiquito lives to fetch and then curl up in a lap for a long nap. Chiquito is doing well understanding “sit” “wait” “shake” and working on other obedience training. During his time with his foster family, he seems to be house trained, and does a great job letting them know when it’s time to go outside by politely walking in circles by the door. He is good on a leash and still working on ignoring other dogs while out and about (he really reeeeally wants to make friends.) Chiquito's forever family will need to continue working with him to reinforce and advance the progress he’s been making with learning to commands and staying focused on leash. Chiquito has done well in his crate during the day - he may whimper a bit, but does a good job of self soothing and going to sleep after a few minutes. He loves to be cozy with his foster family and can often be found with his favorite meercat plushie. Chiquito is looking for a lowkey family that will take him out for walks and snuggle up with him nearby. He appreciates downtime and active moments, with a solid mix of cuddles and playtime during the day. He can keep himself occupied with a chew toy for hours, and loves to search for treats. He would do well as a solo dog or with other dogs in the house. We would recommend Chiquito go to a home with older children. Vaccinated for rabies, DHPP, and bordetella, neutered and microchipped. Negative for heartworm disease, and current on flea, tick, and heartworm prevention. To apply for Chiquito, visit our website ( www.waggytailrescue.org ) for an adoption application. It is important to fill out an application as soon as possible for consideration, and we require a complete application for you to meet an animal. We are currently unable to respond to general email inquiries as an all-volunteer run rescue. If the dog is on our website, they are still available. Waggytail Rescue CANNOT guarantee the exact age of any adoptable dog, or final size of any of our adoptable puppies. We rely on the information provided to us by veterinarians, shelters, owner surrenders and other circumstances bringing the dog into our rescue. Adoptions: adopt@waggytailrescue.org

name: Ryan Maguires
description: Meet Ryan — a sweet, affectionate, and cuddly pup who loves being around people. He’s calm, playful, and incredibly trainable. Whether you’re working or winding down, Ryan knows how to match your energy and be the perfect companion. Personality & Characteristics: Warm, gentle, and eager to please, Ryan is a quick learner who thrives on human connection and positive reinforcement. My foster dog is good with: Dogs, Kids, Adults (we haven’t observed cats yet) My foster dog is: House trained, Low shed 3 Keywords for your pup: Affectionate, Trainable, Easygoing Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 4–5 (chill at home, playful on walks) Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Mostly quiet — only barks when left alone, but settles down Walking Manners: Loves walks and is improving quickly on leash Appetite: Very food-motivated — a great trait for training! Favorite Things: Cuddling, morning playtime, walks, treats, and curling up at bedtime Commands/Tricks: Learning fast! Already responding well to basic cues ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. name: Wickham
description: Hi, I'm Wickham. I was rescued with my siblings and my mama, Austen. I'm a sweet, playful puppy looking for a loving home. Apply today to learn more about me! All dogs will be altered, microchipped, and receive age-appropriate vaccines prior to adoption. Please note that the listed location for this dog may not be accurate due to technical limitations of this database and we have transportation options available within 6 hours of NYC (so don't let location hold you back)! name: Pope
description: Meet Pope, a sweet, shy boy with big dreams of finding his forever family. Pope is a petite 30 pounds, fully house and crate trained, and excellent with other animals. In fact, Pope seems happiest around other dogs and even gets along with cats and chickens. He is a great leash walker and loves long walks and hikes. Pack walking is his favorite activity, and car rides are a close second! Pope is a bit of a shy guy and might love a home away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Apply today to learn more about Pope! All dogs will be altered, microchipped, and receive age-appropriate vaccines prior to adoption. name: Loreen
description: Loreen - 5 years, 7lbs, Maltese/Shnazuer Mix, Spayed Want to adopt? Submit an adoption application at socialteesnyc.org. Our Team Says: Loreen needs a home out of the city. She is NOT a city girl. Burbs and beyond are ideal for her. She would also do great with another dog in the home :) Our Foster Parent Says: " Loreen is a very sweet girl who still has her puppy moments. She has zoomies, especially when you come home after work of if you were just gone for 2 minutes. She recently discovered her love of toys and gathers each one of them into her bed. Unfortunately she hasn’t quite figured out toy vs non-toy yet but she’s easily redirected. Her bed is her safe space, especially when she’s has her anxious moments. When Loreen initially came to NYC from Tennessee she was very scared being in a city setting and shook for an entire week. She was then relocated to Long Island with me and the quiet environment has really let her true self show. She has slowly warmed up to being outside and now runs around happily in my yard and is learning to enjoy walks. Having another confident dog is definitely a plus! She often looks to my dog Kiba when she gets nervous and even follows him around sometimes. At home she is a cuddle bug and loves to be near you. She politely asks for airlifts onto the bed but occasionally gives a sassy bark or two to get your attention. She does well with baths and brushing, she’s also happy to be dressed! She’s very good with both of my cats and my dog, she’s very neutral around everyone and does not show any signs of guarding issues. She did well around a 3 year old boy and generally does well with everyone, she is occasionally anxious with new people. Overall she is a go with the flow type of girl and follows her people around." Level of dog ownership experience needed: INTERMEDIATE: This dog will need significant structure and plenty of daily exercise, training, and mental stimulation – 90 consecutive minutes of movement in the morning plus potty break walks and brain games throughout the day. The adopter must have relevant primary care experience with a similar breed, temperament, and/or energy level. (Primary care experience includes ownership, fostering, or dog sitting as an adult, not a dog you grew up with.) Medical status Healthy as far as we know. Up to date on their DHPP, Bordetella, and Rabies vaccines; heartworm negative; spayed/neutered; microchipped; treated with dewormer upon intake How this dog ended up with Social Tees: Most of our dogs come via partner groups who help us save them from shelters where they are at risk of euthanasia in Tennessee, Puerto Rico or Southern California. There are very few spay/neuter resources there and many more animals in those areas than there are people to adopt them. Rescue groups like ours bring them to the northeast where the desire for pets like these allows us to save their lives. PLEASE NOTE: We cannot guarantee any breed mix, exact age, or full grown size (if the dog is under a year old). We do our best with very educated guesses though! This animal is not at the Social Tees office, all are in foster homes. LEARN MORE ABOUT US: socialteesnyc.org and Instagram @socialteesnyc

name: Elle Magazine
description: Elle (Ellie, Ellie girl, or Ellie Bellie in a tummy rub) is the perfect companion; sweet, kind and a complete cuddle bug!! At home she loves nothing more than to cuddle up on the sofa for a nap, or with a bone and live her best lazy life, with the occasional belly scratch for good measure :) She loves to watch films, and is a particular fan of 101 Dalmations! Outside, Ellie loves to come on walks with you (she’ll lay down for you to put on her lead!) and is keen to sniff all the things, taking in the sights and sounds - a born New Yorker! She loves to say hi to the neighbours, and will wait for scratches, and is super keen to meet other dogs, sometimes a little clumsily as she forgets her size :) Shes a great apartment-mate to a grumpy Frenchie and is happy to follow her lead, hang out together and share toys - they'll even nap together! Ellie is happy to be left at home and equally keen to come on all your errands, she’s made for the love and companionship of a person or family and loves to be loved!! Could easily be a city or suburban pup, as long as she has you!! Personality & Characteristics: My foster dog is good with: Dogs My foster dog is: Crate Trained, Low Shed 3 Keywords for your pup: Sweet, Graceful, Polite Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 4 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Quiet! Quiet! Walking Manners: Great in general, working on clumsy meets :) Appetite: Loves to eat, enjoys bones, treats and babybel cheese! Does the following: Favorite Things: Napping, Chews, Soft Blankets, Cheese Commands/Tricks: Sit ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. name: Prince Hans
description: **Located in Korea** Rescue Story: Prince Hans is a remarkable dog with an even more remarkable story. Rescued from deplorable conditions at a gas station, he endured a life of neglect, tied up and surviving on coffee and food scraps. His life took a turn for the better when a compassionate resident, who had cared for him and another dog named Sleeping Beauty, stepped in to save them from an uncertain and bleak future. Physical Description: Prince Hans is a medium-sized mixed-breed dog with striking features. His coat is a handsome blend of caramel and white, with soulful brown eyes that speak volumes of his resilience and longing for a loving home. Personality: Energy Level: Prince Hans is a calm and gentle soul, scoring a 4 on the energy scale. He enjoys a leisurely pace and appreciates a peaceful environment. Barking: You'll hardly hear a peep from Prince Hans. He's a quiet and composed companion who prefers to listen and observe. Leash Manners: After three months of dedicated training, Prince Hans has transformed from a strong leash-puller into a well-behaved walker. He now strolls calmly by your side, making walks a pleasure for both of you. Appetite: Prince Hans has a hearty appetite and eagerly devours his meals. He's not a picky eater and enjoys a well-balanced diet. Bathing: While he may not particularly enjoy bath time, Prince Hans patiently stands still. He's a cooperative dog who understands that some things are part of the grooming routine. Treats and Walks: Prince Hans lights up when it's treat time or time for a leisurely walk. These are some of his favorite activities, and you'll see his excitement shine through during these moments. Otherwise, he's content to lounge quietly and relax. Training: Prince Hans already knows commands like "Sit" and "Stay," which is a testament to his intelligence and eagerness to please. He's a quick learner and is ready to embark on further training adventures with his new family. Ideal Home: Prince Hans would thrive in a calm and loving home where he can continue to heal from his past experiences. He's a perfect fit for individuals or families seeking a loyal and low-energy companion who appreciates the simple pleasures in life. He would do well in a home with a secure yard for leisurely strolls and playtime. Adoption Notes: Prince Hans has come a long way from the gas station where he was found. He's a survivor with a heart of gold, and all he's looking for now is a forever home filled with love, patience, and understanding. If you're ready to open your heart to this resilient and gentle soul, Prince Hans will reward you with unwavering loyalty and a lifetime of companionship. Adopt Prince Hans and give him the loving family he so deserves. ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. name: Dori
description: Dori, along with his sibling Hagi (also adoptable!) were rescued from the streets of South Korea, where they bravely survived by scavenging for scraps and even had to eat newspapers to survive. Tragically, their mother was euthanized at the shelter they were taken to, but these resilient siblings have shown incredible strength and love despite their tough start. Now safe and thriving, they’re looking for their forever homes! These sweet pups are playful, affectionate, and ready to bring endless joy to their new families. They’re young, full of potential, and will make the most loyal companions. They are in foster homes in New York after flying over from Korea! Dori is still very timid but is warming up to his environment and learning to trust people. He is very smart! If you’re ready to give these survivors the love and security they deserve, apply to adopt today! ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. name: Berlin
description: Berlin is a goofy, affectionate pup who wins everyone over with his charm and smile! He’s a playful, happy dog who loves being part of the action but also knows how to relax and enjoy some quiet cuddle time. Berlin is crate trained and mostly potty trained — he’ll let you know when he needs to go outside. He walks well on leash, loves meeting new people, and gets along with other dogs, though he does best when given a few minutes to warm up first. He’s very treat motivated and loves toys, especially anything he can chew or play fetch with. Berlin thrives on routine and does great with a mix of playtime and downtime. He’s the type of pup who’ll make you laugh with his silly personality and then melt your heart by curling up next to you for naps. name: Cloud
description: Hi! I just arrived! My foster pawrents are getting to know me and will add more info soon. Put Short Bio here: Cloud is a very gentle and demure angel who has been through a lot in her short life so far! She arrived in NYC on November 10, just 2 weeks after having 11 puppies. She is very aware of her surroundings and eager to please. So good at snuggling and wants to be close to her caretaker. Fill out all below: Personality & Characteristics: My foster dog is good with: (Dogs, Kids, Cats). She seems to get along with other dogs. No exposure to kids yet but she is very gentle and has been quick to warm up to addults, though sometimes barks at tall men. She has not yet interacted with any cats. name: Flow
description: Hi! Flow is a playful puppy dog that loves belly rubs, licking everywhere and anywhere (you have to keep both eyes on her) and when it's time to eat. Although she's a messy eater, she cleans up her mess very nicely. Whines sometimes but that's to be expected. name: Glitch
description: Meet Glitch, who we are calling Bunny (she’s open to names still), is a snuggly young girl! She hits the wee pads, sleeps through the night, has a great appetite, and loves our cat. Well, cat isn’t exactly open to puppy love…when she’s bored of us, she likes to just chill in her bed. ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. The application can be found at WaldosRescue.org and once you are approved to adopt you will be put in touch with the foster to see if it’s a good match. We are a RESCUE not a shelter. We conduct veterinary and personal reference checks during the application approval process. We are unable to contact every applicant for every dog. We will select the best applicant for each dog, based on the dogs needs. Waldos Rescue Pen is a 501c3 whose primary focus is rescuing dogs from the euthanasia list from high kill shelters throughout the United States and Korea.

name: Git
description: Git AKA Elphie is truly as sweet as they come - there isn't a single wicked thing about her ;) This southern girl loves to play with her sister and foster brother (who is 70 lbs) or is happy to snuggle up on the couch. Those things only come second to treats - she loveeees cookies and is learning how to take them gently in all of her excitement! She is doing very well on her potty pads and has been outdoor potty training in the suburbs over Thanksgiving - she has been amazing! Her and her sister sleep in the crate until 6am and either go right to sleep or cry for max 5 minutes before snoozing the night away. She has gained so much confidence since being out of the shelter, and she loves to meet new people - this girl has SO much love to give. She hung out with small kids over thanksgiving and was patient and sweet the entire time. This wiggly lady would be an amazing addition to any household! 🤍

name: Dot
description: Dot is a sweet little lady who is still learning how to trust humans, experience the joy of being a dog, and enjoy the sights, sounds and smells of NYC. She was surrendered by a breeder and is most comfortable in her crate, but she is coming out of her shell and exploring the apartment more and more. We're working to help her get desensitized to noises and she's making great progress. Dot allows us to hold her in our laps and stroke her but definitely prefers her crate. She loves walking outside and will voluntarily come out of the crate to be leashed. She also enjoys being taken on errands in her dog carrier and sticks her head out to see what's happening. In the park she sniffs the ground and is curious about other dogs -- she will approach them and allows herself to be sniffed without fear. She especially likes the freedom of a long leash in the park. She is also very treat motivated in the apartment -- outdoors she seems to be more on high alert and rarely takes a treat. Personality & Characteristics: My foster dog is good with: (Dogs, Kids, Cats) Fine with dogs. Unknown about kids and cats My foster dog is: (Crate trained, House trained, Low shed): Crate trained, pee pad trained and house trained. 3 Keywords for your pup: Quiet, Submissive, Curious Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 3 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Silent. Does not bark or whine Walking Manners: Needs to be taught to walk on a leash. Enjoys a long leash in the park but a bit erratic on the sidewalk Appetite: Very good. Food motivated. She loves her Farmers Dog, kibble, cheese and cooked chicken. She prefers that we don't stand too close while she is eating. Favorite Things: Her crate, peanut butter in a Kong, a long leash in the park, head scratches Commands/Tricks: None yet ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. name: Navi
description: Put Short Bio here: Navi (lovingly known as Milo) is a sweet, sensitive, and gentle soul who also just happens to be absolutely stunning Fill out all below: Personality & Characteristics: Navi is a beautiful 7 month old puppy who just wants to be loved and give love. He is so gentle and sweet and just a big cuddle bug. He loves to be with people! He is so great with other dogs of all sizes and personalities. He is super treat motivated so very easy to train! Even though he is a puppy, he is pretty good at managing his puppy energy! All he needs is a few quick walks and one longer one (or a long play session) and he'll spend the rest of the day snoozing away. He would thrive in an environment with stability, where he can more consistently work on his crate training. He is just a joy and truly the sweetest boy who is the best cuddler of all time! My foster dog is good with: (Dogs, Kids, Cats): Dogs My foster dog is: (Crate trained, House trained, Low shed):House trained, working on crate training, low shed 3 Keywords for your pup: Sweet, sensitive, silly Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 7 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Barker when he wants attention, otherwise quiet Walking Manners: A little bit of a puller but has been doing really well with a front clip harness. Appetite: Great! Favorite Things: His person, chews, other dogs Commands/Tricks: Sit, down, shake, come ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. name: Drama
description: Drama - 14 weeks & 19lbs (as of 10/31), Aussie Mix, Spayed Estimated full grown size around 60lbs This puppy is eligible to join our foster-to-adopt program. Please email fostertoadopt@socialteesnyc.org with the animal’s name in the subject line if you are interested! Want to straight up adopt? Submit an adoption application a t socialteesnyc.org Thier Foster Parents Say: "Drama doesn’t live up to her name in the best way. She’s brilliant, incredibly well behaved, pretty chill throughout the day, and loves to go for walks and play respectfully with our dog. She’s wonderful on a leash - it’s actually really impressive. She has been going to the bathroom outside and on pee pads inside. She has also let us know when she needs to get off of our couch or bed for a potty break. Drama is cuddly and affectionate, pretty independent and doesn’t mind resting by herself or hanging out with a toy or bully stick. She’s food motivated and a great listener - Drama will be an absolute joy to train. She responds to corrections and redirection extremely well. Whoever adopts Drama will be so lucky to have her. She has the best temperament and tons of potential - she is truly a rare find." Level of dog ownership experience needed: INTERMEDIATE: As an adult, this dog will need significant structure and plenty of daily exercise, training, and mental stimulation – 90 consecutive minutes of movement in the morning plus potty break walks and brain games throughout the day. The adopter must have relevant primary care experience with a similar breed, temperament, and/or energy level. (Primary care experience includes ownership, fostering, or dog sitting as an adult, not a dog you grew up with.) Relevant puppy care experience is a huge plus, but bare minimum the adopter must have TONS of time and patience. Raising a puppy can be a lot of fun, but it’s also tremendous work. Puppies’ personalities and exercise/stimulation requirements change dramatically between now and when they’re a year old as their bodies and brains develop, so an active lifestyle and the ability to adapt to a pup’s evolving needs are a must. We strongly urge professional dog training with a rewards based trainer from the get go. Adults only or kids ages 8 and up – all puppies go through a mouthy, rambunctious phase and often accidentally hurt children when playing. PLEASE DO YOUR OWN BREED RESEARCH to make sure you have a better understanding of the kind of temperament and exercise requirements this dog may have as an adult. Energy level MEDIUM: Very young puppies sleep and nap a lot, but their energy level skyrockets when they become teens (4 months to around a year). As an adult, this dog will need significant structure and plenty of daily exercise, training, and mental stimulation – 90 consecutive minutes of movement in the morning plus potty break walks and brain games throughout the day at a minimum. (This is regardless of dog size – many small breeds were designed for lots of activity and will exhibit unwanted behavior when they’re understimulated.) TOLERANCE TO CITY City pup – Seems unfazed by the sights and sounds, may as well have been born here. POTTY TRAINING Sort of -- On the way and learning! May be using wee pads (is a puppy or a brand new rescue) COMFORT LEVEL WITH STRANGERS Social butterfly – Wants to be friends with everyone who walks by, loves anyone who will stop to say hello. BEHAVIOR WITH CHILDREN (always requires adult supervision) Yes for most ages – very confident, gentle, low energy, tolerant, not mouthy SOCIAL BEHAVIOR WITH OTHER DOGS Yes – Good with most other dogs (sizes, breeds, etc.) as far as we know and enjoys socializing with other canines RESPECTFUL BEHAVIOR WITH OTHER ANIMALS (cats, small pets, etc.) Not sure – Wants to chase squirrels and birds so may not be a good match for a home with cats, rabbits, etc. MOUTHY BEHAVIOR Past this stage– Little to no interest in chewing on stuff or putting things in their mouth that aren’t food. Doesn’t try to chew on hands, feet, etc. during playtime SEPARATION ANXIETY (Please leave your foster dog home alone every day for at least 20 minutes.) Past this stage – Completely fine being left home alone. Doesn’t cry or exhibit destructive behavior when you leave the apartment or house. LEASH MANNERS Getting the hang of it – Probably hasn’t been on a leash much in their life but figuring it out. Might be a mild puller but responds to correction. CUDDLE BUG LEVEL Medium – Likes to snuggle when he's in the mood but often stays in his own bed JUMPING ON PEOPLE TO SAY HELLO Needs training – Very excited to greet everyone and has no idea how to do so politely. Jumps up on most strangers or other dogs that go by. In puppy phase or wasn’t trained as a young adult. CRATE TRAINING Working on it – We set one up and leave the door open but rarely close it because the dog freaks out *We haven’t used the crate much but are working on it. She’s a calm girl overall and not super needy, so I’m confident she will do fine. MEDICAL STATUS: Healthy as far as we know. Up to date on their DHPP and Bordetella vaccines (for dogs under 4 months old, adopters will need to finish the DHPP vaccine series and administer the Rabies vaccine at 16 weeks of age), spayed/neutered; microchipped; treated with dewormer upon HOW DID THIS DOG END UP WITH US? Most of our dogs come via partner groups who help us save them from shelters where they are at risk of euthanasia in Tennessee, Los Angeles and Puerto Rico. There are very few spay/neuter resources there and many more animals in those areas than there are people to adopt them. Rescue groups like ours bring them to the northeast where the desire for pets like these allows us to save their lives. PLEASE NOTE: We cannot guarantee any breed mix, exact age, or full grown size (if the dog is under a year old). We do our best with very educated guesses though! This animal is not at the Social Tees office, all are in foster homes. LEARN MORE ABOUT US: socialteesnyc.org and Instagram @socialteesnyc

name: Melo
description: My name is Melo beause I am MELLO. I'm an older guy (10 years old) that likes to be a couch potato. I've also realized the couch is the most comfortable place so I don't like to share it. Therefore, I do better in a quiet home where I'm the only dog. I'm good on walks and I'm house trained. I've been with a foster for 2 years and I really would like to find my forever home!!! ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. name: Duchess
description: **Located in Korea** Rescued by firefighters after being abandoned on the streets, she was taken to the city shelter when her owner never came forward. This sweet and affectionate girl adores people and thrives on love and attention. While she’s still learning to socialize with other dogs, she’d be happiest as the only pet in a home where she can soak up all the love. name: Chat
description: Hello everyone, glad you've made it to my profile! My name is Chat and I am a little 6 year old retired breeding mama that was used to just make puppies my whole life. I am getting use to life inside a loving home and just learning my surroundings. I do not ask for much but for someone who can be patient and kind to me as I have not had that before. I am working on my potty training and doing very well, just a few accidents here and there, but my foster mommy said that's normal. I feel more comfortable with dogs than humans as they have not treated me the best. I do not ever growl or show aggression, however sudden movements, loud noises, and being in unfamiliar places or people gets me anxious and causes me to shake. I definitely am a suburbs kind of girl and would do best in a quite home to help me flourish , loud noises or alarms can be very scary for me. As of right now I am definitely SMALL dog friendly, bigger dogs can be scary to me as I am a small girl. I probably wouldn't mind cats but not tested with them as of yet (soon to come though) I also have not been tested with children yet as my foster mommy is helping me decompress (will be introduced soon to confirm) However, she thinks I would do best in a home with older children, who can understand my needs and understand to give me time to come out of my shell and understand my shyness. My foster mommy thinks I am mixed with another breed of some sort, my hair is straight, doesn't seem to shed, and my hair dries super quick after my baths! I am quite calm and good for people who don't care about too much physical activity outside my potty walks. I like to lay in the grass and in the shade breathing in the fresh air, giving a few snorts here and there. I am doing a great job learning to potty outside, a quick 5-10 minute walk is all I need, right now getting walked 4x a day. I do not pull and quite easy to walk, but make sure you hold onto my leash in case I get scared. I adore my food very much and that is what I've been most excited about other than meeting other doggie friends. Unfortunately I have not had treats yet but that will hopefully change soon because they smell really tasty but I haven't been motivated to eat them yet, although offered. My foster doggie name in the house is what my original name was, Oreo (I respond best to that) ! I can't wait to meet you and find a great loving forever home that I deserved from the start ! ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. name: Tilia (Tilly)
description: Hi! Tilly the perfect city dog has just arrived in NYC. Tilly loves nothing more than sitting outside in the sun. She is a calm slow walker and a trip around the block is enough exercise for this gal. Her energy level is about a 1/10. She is a very quiet girl who likes to avoid other dogs and is not reactive to squirrels or other small animals. Tilly is not motivated by dog treats or interested in toys atm. She does however go crazy for a tiny bit of ham or chicken from your plate! Her tail goes at a hundred miles an hour when she sees one of her people close by. Tilly is house trained and can be left alone by herself without any separation anxiety. She is happy enough sleeping in a crate but prefers to sleep on the sofa or in her bed. She is a gentle loving girl who would love nothing more to hang with you all day and rest her head on your lap. ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. name: Karlena
description: Meet Karlena! Known affectionately as "Sass/Sassy" in her foster parent's house. Karlena is still recovering from a traumatic past life, but as each day passes, so grows her confidence. This little girl is the definition of brave and strong, but she is still learning more each day that she can trust humans after the ones in her past have let her down time and time again. Karlena is still getting accustomed to living inside with her foster parents and isn't ready yet to go outside for walks, but she's been a quick learner with pee pads. This little girl is also very food motivated and loves her beef treats and slices of cheese. She is incredibly shy, and still keeps to herself most of the day when her foster parents are home, but she does like to explore and sniff around at night and when she's home alone. Karlena will thrive with adoptive parents who are understanding, patient, and willing to meet her where she is and not rush her, and continue to foster a safe, calm and quiet environment for her to decompress, heal, and learn to trust. In time, when she's ready, we have no doubts in the world this sweet, sweet girl will come out of her shell and be the most perfect pup to a very lucky family! ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. name: Tron
description: Hi I'm Tron! My foster mom says I'm pure joy wrapped in a tiny, wiggly body. I'm super sweet and I absolutely love to play, chase after my siblings and explore every corner with my perpetually wagging tail. I'm equally thrilled to snuggle up when I'm tired, often curled right into the puppy pile. I would thrive either with other dogs or as a solo pup, all I need is a family ready to give me plenty of pets, playtime, and love. I'm the definition of a happy little companion and can't wait to meet my furever family soon! Personality & Characteristics: Wiggly, Playful, Handsome, Happy go lucky, Fearless My foster dog is good with: Dogs (not yet cat or child tested) My foster dog is: Getting the hang of pee pads and the crate 3 Keywords for your pup: King of the Toy Box, Snuggle Bug, Curious Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 4 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: I get excited when playing and love to communicate my excitement, but I have yet to actually find my bark! Walking Manners: N/A Appetite: A great eater! name: Coda
description: Meet Coda (known to her foster as Opera) — the sweetest soul waiting for her chance at a real life. Opera is a gentle, about one-year-old mixed-breed pup (very likely with some AmStaff in her), and she is looking for a patient, loving home where she can finally feel safe. Opera has been through more than any dog should. She was found with a severe injury to her neck and brought to a county shelter in Tifton, Georgia, where she got surgery to heal. She is 100% better health wise, but the emotional scars still remain. She arrived scared, shut down, and unsure of the world — but every day she shows us that she wants to trust. With quiet routines, kindness, and a calm environment, she is already making small, meaningful steps forward. Opera has not shown an ounce of agressivesness. Her instinct is to freeze when she is unsure or scared. She loves her food, responds beautifully to a soft voice, and finds comfort in having a cozy spot of her own. Once she feels secure, her sweet personality shines through. Opera will absolutely blossom with someone willing to give her time, consistency, and reassurance. If you’ve ever wanted to witness a transformation — to help a fearful dog discover joy, play, and confidence — Opera is your girl. She deserves a family that will love her gently, at her pace, and celebrate every victory along the way. If your home has patience, love, and calm, Opera will give you her whole heart. Help her start the life she’s always deserved. name: Cortana
description: Hi! I just arrived! My foster pawrents are getting to know me and will add more info soon. Short Bio : Cortana is a sweet, affectionate young dog with a good head on her shoulders. She responds well to structure, is highly food-motivated, and learns quickly with calm, consistent guidance. She’s gentle, people-oriented, and enjoys being close to her humans. Personality & Characteristics: Quiet, low-barking, and calm indoors Loves plush beds, blankets, and cozy spots (she’ll happily sleep next to you if allowed) Enjoys belly rubs, training sessions, and physical affection Sensitive and eager to please — she thrives under predictability and routine My foster dog is good with: (Dogs, Kids, Cats) Kids: Yes — very gentle, affectionate, and loves giving kisses Dogs: Yes — friendly, appropriate play, social Cats: Unknown — no exposure in foster care yet My foster dog is: (Crate trained, House trained, Low shed) Crate trained: Goes in willingly and settles well House trained: Zero accidents in foster care Low shed: Short coat Food motivated: Excellent for training; benefits from a slow feeder Knows: Sit, Stay, Drop 3 Keywords for your pup: Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Walking Manners: Appetite: Energy Level: ~6/10 (balanced — playful outside, calm inside) Barking: Very quiet; not a vocal dog Walking Manners: Needs guidance and a structured leash; benefits from a shorter leash. She’ll try to pick up food or items from the ground if not monitored. Favorite Things: Commands/Tricks: Treats, walks, belly rubs, physical touch, soft beds, and learning new things. name: Stream
description: Meet Miss Stream! The biggest snuggle bug, looking for her forever BFFL. Stream is a one-of-a-kind pet. She has a big personality and SO much love to give. She deeply cares about her people, and doesn't have a mean bone in her body. Stream sleeps the whole night through cuddling her little lovebug body right by yours. Stream is also incredibly adventurous and loves to run around the city saying hi to people and sniffing all the smells. Or Quiet Pup?: Barks outside when she gets excited at other dogs, in house when she is getting settled into her new environment and then fine. name: A Boy Called Rivi (Rivington)
description: Introducing Rivington, affectionately known as Rivi! This handsome boy holds the record as our longest resident at Waldo's foster care. Currently finding love and care in NYC with his foster family, Rivi is ready to embark on a new chapter in life, seeking a forever home away from the bustling city. He is such a special dog and he deserves a wonderful home! While his foster family adores him, they believe Rivi will flourish in a quieter environment, free from the hustle and bustle of city sounds and traffic. He gets anxious around loud sounds. With his intelligence, loyalty, and excellent leash manners, Rivi is the perfect companion for a home with minimal foot traffic or a family experienced in caring for dogs. This clever pup is already house trained and crate trained, making him a well-behaved addition to any family. Moreover, Rivi has undergone professional training, which we are thrilled to extend to his future adopter throughout their lifetime together. The training facility, conveniently located in NJ, will provide guidance and support during the transition to a new home. If you're looking for a smart and devoted furry friend, Rivi might just be the perfect match for you! Reach out to Waldo's to learn more about this amazing canine and offer him the loving forever home he deserves. Let Rivi's next chapter be filled with joy and love, as he eagerly awaits to meet his forever family! ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. The application can be found at http://www.WaldosRescue.org and once you are approved to adopt you will be put in touch with the foster to see if it’s a good match. We are a RESCUE not a shelter. We conduct veterinary and personal reference checks during the application approval process. We are unable to contact every applicant for every dog. We will select the best applicant for each dog, based on the dogs needs.
