name: Sugarberry
description: Meet Sugarberry — affectionately known as “Suggy”! Sugarberry is a 6-year-old southern sweetheart who recently traded country roads for city sidewalks — and she’s been stealing hearts ever since. She’s gentle, affectionate, and loves nothing more than long walks, belly rubs, soft head scratches, and, of course, her favorite treats — duck jerky and cheese! While loud noises can startle her, Sugarberry has been adjusting beautifully to the hustle and bustle of New York City. She’s fully potty trained, friendly with all people and most dogs, and loves spending time with her humans. Sugarberry would thrive in a calm, patient home that can continue helping her build confidence around other dogs. In return, she’ll offer endless love, loyalty, and quiet companionship. If you’re looking for a gentle soul with a big heart who’ll fill your home with love, Sugarberry is your girl. 💗 🐾

name: Sycamore
description: Meet Sycamore! 🐾 Sycamore is a 5-year-old Jack Russell Terrier with a bright mind, a playful spirit, and a heart ready to grow. At 15 lbs, this energetic little guy is a true JRT—full of curiosity, cleverness, and a zest for life. A former breeder dog, Sycamore has made incredible progress in just a few weeks of fostering. What was once a shy dog who wouldn’t accept touch is now happily letting himself be petted (with a little patience) and even carried. He’s eager to be part of the action, loves to play, and is highly motivated by food—treats are the key to his heart and his learning! Sycamore is crate trained, sleeps quietly through the night, and is almost fully house trained. He enjoys walks and exploring the outdoors, though new sights and sounds can sometimes startle him. A patient family who understands his need for gentle guidance will help him continue building confidence. He thrives with other dogs and would especially love a home with a confident canine companion to show him the ropes. A yard where he can safely run and burn off energy would be ideal. If you’re looking for a smart, food-loving, and affectionate companion who will blossom with patience and love, Sycamore is ready to meet his forever family! ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. The application can be found at WaldosRescue.org and once you are approved to adopt you will be put in touch with the foster to see if it’s a good match. We are a RESCUE not a shelter. We conduct veterinary and personal reference checks during the application approval process. We are unable to contact every applicant for every dog. We will select the best applicant for each dog, based on the dogs needs. Waldos Rescue Pen is a 501c3 whose primary focus is rescuing dogs from the euthanasia list from high kill shelters throughout the United States and Korea.

name: Dev
description: Dev loves exploring and following around her foster parents, and a single glance her way will send her tail into a joyous, wagging frenzy! Huge fan of ice cubes, toys, and treats of all kinds! Foster parents have left them briefly outside of their crate to take out the trash/ recycling, and upon return, the puppies are found either sitting patiently, or quietly walking around the house. Personality & Characteristics: My foster dog is good with: Adult men and women, and her brother. She hasn't been around other dogs, cats, or children yet. My foster dog is: Making great strides with being crate trained and wee pad trained! 3 Keywords for your pup: Joyful, playful, affectionate Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 7 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Very, very quiet pup! Will cry for only a few minutes when first put in crate, and then will settle down quickly. description: Hi! I just arrived to my foster parents about 3 weeks ago and have become very comfortable! I am cuddly, playful and very sleepy most of the time. This backgrounder will be updated as my personality shows more and more :) Put Short Bio here: Cursor is an absolute sweetheart. She warms up quickly and loves being by your side. She's happy to sit next to you all day -- and will if you let her. After her Georgia move, she has acclimated well to NYC living and does very well in busy streets roaming around. Very people and dog friendly. name: Snippet
description: Snippet aka Glinda is as kind as she is cute! This southern girl has a great personality - a little sass with a whole lot of sweet. She loves to play with her sister and foster brother (who is 70 lbs), snuggle up. on the couch, and play with toys. Those things only come second to treats and mealtime. She is doing very well on her potty pads and has been outdoor potty training in the suburbs over Thanksgiving - she has been amazing! Her and her sister sleep in the crate until 6am and either go right to sleep or cry for max 5 minutes before snoozing the night away. She had her first interaction with kids over Thanksgiving and did amazing - she let them hold her and played with them with no issues. Anyone would be lucky to have this sweet girl🤍

name: Codec
description: Meet Codec! She is a 10 lb 1.5 yr old Chihuahua mix. Lovable, snuggly, friendly and full of love! She is a sweet, spunky southern belle from Georgia looking for her FURever family. She loves people, dogs & treats! Codec would be a perfect addition to any family. She is house broken, uses weeeee pad and goes outside. She is the perfect dog to cuddle , practice her zoomies and watch tv with. She loves to be outdoors and is practicing her leash skills. Personality & Characteristics: My foster dog is low shed, sleeps through the night like a baby and affectionate. 3 Keywords for your pup: a Velcro dog, friendly and playful. Energy Level 6 (1= calm, 10= high ) She loves kisses and company. She has a great appetite and can be food motivated. She loves belly rubs and snuggling close. Favorite Things: belly rubs,, toys & walking around the yard. Commands/Tricks: recognizes her name, command "come" and is working on "sit". Get ready to fall in love with Codec! name: Frog Prince
description: *Located in Korea* Meet Kkamie! Kkamie was rescued on the street after being abused and mistreated. He is well socialized and trained. He would love to be the only dog in a family, or get adopted into a family with a second dog that is calm and gentle. He is extremely gentle and super well behaved. He is ready to love you & be loved for life! My foster dog is good with: Dogs, Kids (he has no interest in cats) My foster dog is: Crate trained (but sometimes doesn't want to go into the crate); he is housebroken and goes potty on pee pads as well as outdoors. He only likes to make poopies on walks! 3 Keywords for your pup: gentle, well behaved, calm Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 5-6 outside, and 2-3 inside Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Quiet - he only howls right before going for a walk to let you know just how excited he is to go out! Walking Manners: Great leash manners, loves his walks! Appetite: she loves treats more than anything, but will sometimes leave some food in her bowl if she eats too many treats before eating Does the following: he does get car sick if he rides in a crate, but doesn't get as car sick if he sits in her person's lap. He might vomit if she gets car sick, but nothing too serious! He is very well behaved for baths and to get brushed. He also doesn't have any separation anxiety! He is very well-behaved during vet visits. Favorite Things: going for walks and enjoying a treat (but he does not like if other dogs steal her treats - who would?) Commands/Tricks: Sit, Wait, Hand" Kkamie was rescued on the street after being abused and mistreated. ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. description: Dublin aka Oreo! Dublin is a sweet, quiet soul who prefers the calm comfort of a cozy hiding spot until its time to eat or play. He may be shy at first, but once he warms up, he's gentle, loving and playful in his own laid- back way. name: Router
description: Hi! I'm Router! My foster mom calls me Vinny and she says I'm an absolute dream. If she didn't travel for work, she would keep me in a second. I love to play and my foster mom's friends brought me some squeaky toys which are my FAVORITE. I love to hang out with her and her roommate and my toughest decision every day is who's bed to sleep in at night. I'm a big cuddle bug and love some good scratches. I am house trained and will do just about anything for a treat. I haven't met a cat yet and I haven't spent much time with kids, but my foster mom would be really surprised if I didn't like children. I currently live in the East Village and while I'm a better walker on a quiet street, I love a late night walk before bed around a busy street because that means I get more attention. The only time I bark is when I hear the doorbell or if there is something spooky in the street, but each time I bark, my foster mom is a bit confused because I usually am a pretty quiet pup. I would prefer having a yard, but I've been good in an apartment because I get to go on a lot of walks. My tail does not stop wagging and I'm a magnet to my foster mom, but I can't wait to find my forever home! Fill out all below: Personality & Characteristics: Goofy and energetic My foster dog is good with: (Dogs, Kids, Cats) My foster dog is: House trained and a people lover 3 Keywords for your pup: Goofy, loving, happy Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 7 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Pretty quiet, but will bark or howl occassionally Walking Manners: Pulls a bit if on a busy street, but loves to go outside and walk Appetite: Loves food Favorite Things: Sqeaky toys, breakfast & dinner, all my foster mom's friends Commands/Tricks: Sit ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. name: Bash
description: Bash is a very sweet 1-2 year old dog from Georgia. He has the most beautiful eyes and loves to use them to get lots of treats and food as he has a big appetite. He currently lives in a foster home with a 10 year old, male chihuahua and they get along well! Bash loves times with people and currently one foster parent works from home so he's not left alone longer than 4 hours. Sometimes he'll have an accident or overnight but not too often. He's scared of loud sounds and fast vehicles so we're building our confidence walking outside but he's a quick learner! He currently likes sleeping in bed with us but will move to the couch at times. Overall his routine is easy but he would do well with someone who works from home or has another dog in the home. Welcoming him into your home will mean someone who always greets you at the door, constantly has his tail wagging, and gives the best cuddles. Personality & Characteristics: My foster dog is good with: dogs and kids of all ages My foster dog is: working on becoming house trained but doesn't have accidents everyday 3 Keywords for your pup: Energy Level: 4 Mostly quiet but barks if he hears someone outside or a delivery comes Walking Manners: walking has improved a lot as he was fearful, still doesn't love walks but we're getting there Appetite: big appetite! Favorite Things: stomach stratches and looking out the window Commands/Tricks: he knows sit and we're working on come and stay ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. name: Cleo (Guava)
description: Cleo is a total sweetheart and would make an amazing addition to any family or loving home. This gentle, affectionate girl adores everyone she meets, and is amazing with people, kids, and other dogs. She is fully house-trained, sleeps through the night in her bed, and loves going for walks, playing fetch, and curling up beside you at the end of the day. Cleo has the softest fur you'll ever run your hands through and is just looking for someone to give her love. She gets a lot of compliments for being such a cutie. Photos do not do her justice! name: Glinda
description: **Located in Korea** Meet Glinda! She is surely going to be pop-u-lar! Rescue Story: As a puppy, she went home with a family that had four children. The kids begged to have a dog and, without any preparation, they family decided to adopt. As she grew, she began to shed, and the children became frightened. They decided to tie her up in the parking lot and left her there, neglected, for two years. The family that adopted her said that they couldn't take her with them when they moved, so she was abandoned in a parking lot and was unfortunately infected with heartworm (which has since been cured!) More About Glinda: Energy Level (1-10): 6.5 3 Keywords: Playful, Affectionate, Smart She barks when strangers visit, and sometimes barks as if she's talking when she wants something - a great communicator! When she goes for a walk, she gets scared when motorcycles or loud cars pass by. She's afraid of machine noises. However, she walks well without pulling on the leash. Despite her fear of loud noises when walking, her foster thinks she would do just fine living in the city. Favorite Things: She enjoys sniffing around and exploring! Apply to make Glinda your fateful sidekick today! ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. name: Heirloom
description: This little blue-eyed wonder just made a big journey into our home and is slowly finding his paws. He’s made so much progress in the last few weeks and loves playing with our dog, can't get enough treats, and will hang out and lounge around the house. He is still very skiddish if you try to touch, pet or pick him up so will require patience and lots of treats as mentioned. He's lets us give him treats by hand and is making good progress getting comfortable with humans:) He's playful, vocal (some whines and talking), but doesn't bark when people come to the door. Personality & Characteristics: Playful (with other dogs), Curious, Sweet, Gorgeous. My foster dog is good with: (Dogs, Kids, Cats). Heirloom is very good with my dog and loves playing with him. He's not been around a cat or kids so that would be something to assess. My foster dog is: (Crate trained, House trained, Low shed) Has not been crate train or house trained as we are still just trying to get him touch/pet/pick him up and that's been the challenge in getting him trained. Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 6-7, he likes to play but he's also a sleeper Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: he sings throughout the day a bit when we wants something and he can make little talkative growls if he feels your getting too close but not aggressively. Doesn't bark often Walking Manners: n/a Favorite Things: TREATS/food. he had some toys he plays with and can self entertain, but I'd say his favorite thing right now is out dog Commands/Tricks: he can sit for a treat :) ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. name: Olivewood (Olive)
description: Olive (we are calling her Charli girl) is extremely chill and easy going! She loves cuddling up and watching TV and is always happy getting lots of pets and tummy rubs! She is pretty good on a leash and loves going for walks too! She is completely house broken and lets us know when she needs to go out! Personality & Characteristics: very easy going and full of love! My foster dog is good with kids and dogs don't know about cats! Olive is completely house trained! We have not crated her! 3 Keywords for your pup: Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): very calm overall but can get excited getting ready for walks or when visitors arrive. Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: overall pretty quiet but when deliveries arrive she gets excited! Walking Manners: Good and getting even better! Appetite: Olive has healthy appetite! She does not beg for food when we are eating which is a first for this dog lover! Favorite Things: Olive loves her favorite blanket, tummy rubs and cuddles and going outside for walks. name: Ashford
description: Hello! My name is Ashford and I arrived in NYC in October. I'm pretty unphased by all the people & sounds, just happy to be here! I'm a sweet, energetic & playful boy. I'm friendly with everyone and don't react to other dogs on the street or bark, I just want to smell & explore! I'm crate-trained and have learned to go potty outside only. My foster parents are hybrid workers and I've done well with my new routine. I would thrive with a yard and more space to run around & explore, as I'm so curious about the world around me! I would be a good fit for someone who lives an active lifestyle & has time to work on training. name: Cookie
description: There is nothing sweeter than a warm cookie and new mama! Mama Cookie has recently joined our rescue and has just given birth to nine healthy puppies. At just two years old, we've now learned Mama Cookie is as sweet as her name. Check back soon for all the updates on Cookie and her bakery babies.

name: Kloe
description: Meet Kloe! Meet Kloe: The Chill Queen with a Heart of Gold (and a Nose Boop to Prove It) If you're looking for a dog who can handle the chaos of life with grace and a dash of humor, look no further than Kloe. Tantruming toddlers? She offers a comforting nose boop, then gracefully removes herself from the drama like the mature queen she is, even at the young age of two years old. Kloe is the gold standard of gentle play—excited zoomies with adults, four-on-the-floor patience with kids, and not a single snatchy move in sight. She takes treats like a lady, has no interest in guarding resources, and frankly doesn’t even notice if someone strolls past her food. (We don’t recommend toddler taste-testing her kibble, but you get the vibe.) Her nighttime routine? Legendary. She potty breaks at 6pm and calls it a day. Even if you beg her from the backyard in your PJs, she’ll be upstairs in bed like, “Nah, I’m good.” She sleeps through the night like a champ and waits patiently for you to rise, whether it's 6am or a lazy Sunday 8am. Car rides? Loves them. Visitors? Welcomes them. Delivery people? Whatever. Kloe is unfazed by the world’s noise and just wants to vibe, cuddle, and be your loyal sidekick. One thing to know: Kloe prefers her personal space when it comes to other dogs. She’s not the dog park type, and that’s okay—she’d much rather be your one-and-only. With people, she’s a total lovebug; with other pups, she appreciates a little distance and respectful boundaries. Think of her as the introvert who loves her humans but doesn't feel the need to mingle with the whole dog block. She’s the full package: calm, kind, gentle, hilarious, house-trained, and delightfully opinionated about bedtime. Come meet the girl who’s got it all—Kloe’s ready to boop her way into your heart. 🌟 In the home: Extremely chill and well-mannered — not a jumper Total cuddlebug and wants to be snuggled up next to you — and any visitors — at all times Loves toys and playtime Potty trained and will stand by the door when she needs to go out Doesn’t chew furniture — or anything but squeaky toys :) Not mouthy — no play biting Loves lounging on the floor and only hops on the couch when invited Doesn’t beg for food — minds her own business during meals Loves to play fetch and has a special affinity for hoses :) Crate trained Patient & loving with toddler foster sister 🌟 On leash: Very treat-motivated and easy to redirect with a tasty snack We are still working on leash manners, but Kloe improves every day! Kloe is the perfect mix of playful and relaxed and is ready to find her forever family.

name: Sunny
description: ☀️ Can you be the sunshine for our senior boy, Sunny? ☀️ We're looking for a truly special, patient person for a truly special dog. Meet Sunny , a magical 12-year-old scruffy Chi/Terrier mix. This 8.5-pound sweetie has a name that perfectly matches his goal: to find a patch of sun and snooze. Don't let his age fool you—Sunny is a spry guy with pep in his step! He loves walks, adores his humans, and is friendly with other dogs and cats. Sunny's Wish List: A patient, understanding human who can give him stability. A quiet, structured home where he can be the king of his own castle. A plush, comfy bed (he gives bonus points for a bolster so he can prop his head up! 🥰) What Sunny Needs: After so much change since leaving the shelter in early October, Sunny struggles with general anxiety and can be somewhat vocal. He just needs time, patience, and a predictable routine to help him settle and feel safe. This is your chance to give a deserving senior the one thing he wants: a stable, loving home to keep him comfortable for all his days. He is so deserving. The love you'll get back from this magical creature will be tenfold. Can you be Sunny's safe landing? Vaccinated for rabies, DHPP, and bordetella, heartworm negative, and microchipped. Current on flea, tick, and heartworm prevention. Sunny has a neuter appointment on January 15, 2026; this appointment will be covered by Waggytail Rescue, should Sunny be adopted. To apply for Sunny, visit our website ( www.waggytailrescue.org ) for an adoption application. It is important to fill out an application as soon as possible for consideration, and we require a complete application for you to meet an animal. We are currently unable to respond to general email inquiries as an all-volunteer run rescue. If the dog is on our website, they are still available. Waggytail Rescue CANNOT guarantee the exact age of any adoptable dog, or final size of any of our adoptable puppies. We rely on the information provided to us by veterinarians, shelters, owner surrenders and other circumstances bringing the dog into our rescue. Adoptions: adopt@waggytailrescue.org

name: Timber
description: 🐾 Meet Timber! Hi, I’m Timber — a 15 lb bundle of sweetness and joy! I’m playful, loving, and always ready for snuggles. I’m crate trained, working hard on my potty training, and love hanging out with kids and other dogs. ✨ Personality & Characteristics: I’m a happy, gentle little guy who loves playtime, cuddles, and following my humans around. I’m affectionate, social, and full of puppy charm! 🐶 My foster dog is good with: ✅ Dogs ✅ Kids ✅ Cats 🏡 My foster dog is: ✅ Crate trained 🚽 Potty training in progress 🐾 Low shed 🔑 3 Keywords for your pup: Playful, Sweet, Cuddly ⚡ Energy Level (1 = calm, 10 = high energy): 5 — playful but knows when it’s cuddle time! 🔈 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Mostly quiet, with a few happy puppy barks 🚶‍♂️ Walking Manners: Getting better every day. 🍗 Appetite: Great eater and very food-motivated (treats = best thing ever!) 🎾 Favorite Things: Toys, belly rubs, playing with other pups, and snuggling up after playtime 🧠 Commands/Tricks: Knows “sit” and learning “come” — smart cookie alert! ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. The application can be found at WaldosRescue.org and once you are approved to adopt you will be put in touch with the foster to see if it’s a good match. We are a RESCUE not a shelter. We conduct veterinary and personal reference checks during the application approval process. We are unable to contact every applicant for every dog. We will select the best applicant for each dog, based on the dogs needs. Waldos Rescue Pen is a 501c3 whose primary focus is rescuing dogs from the euthanasia list from high kill shelters throughout the United States and Korea.

name: Bombshells
description: Meet Bombshells (Nala) 💖 – a calm, sweet soul who’s slowly opening up to the joys of home life and companionship. Nala is a mellow, easygoing mama who recently arrived in NYC after raising a litter of pups. She’s still decompressing and adjusting to city life, but every day she’s becoming more trusting, more curious—and more ready for her next chapter. A little shy and scared at first, Nala finds her greatest joy outside with her doggy friends. She absolutely loves being around other pups—they help her feel safe and confident. (A home with a friendly resident dog would be a big plus!) She’s also cool with cats and seems comfortable around kids, though she hasn’t had much direct interaction just yet. Indoors, Nala is a quiet observer. She’s crate-trained, house-trained, and low-shedding. She is easy on her own at home, communicates when she needs to go out and walks beautifully on leash—calm, close, and with no pulling. She’s not a barker and has shown zero signs of aggression. Most of the day, she’s content to snooze in her crate or quietly explore a little more of her space. Her favorite hobby? Chillin’ 💤 Navigating the building lobby and elevator still makes her a bit nervous, but with gentle encouragement, she’s learning to get more comfortable and build trust in her surroundings. Nala is currently on heartworm medication and otherwise doing great—eating well, resting lots, and slowly blooming into the relaxed, loving companion we know she’s meant to be. She would thrive in a calm, loving home—especially one with other dogs—and with someone who’s happy to let her open up on her own terms. Ready to fall in love? Nala is waiting. 💕 Personality & Characteristics: Very calm and happy to be resting, happiest outside and around other dog friends My foster dog is good with: Loves being around other dogs, good with cats, seems good with kids but haven't had the opportunity for much interaction with kids yet (expect she would be fine!) My foster dog is: Crate trained, House trained, Low shed, leash trained 3 Keywords for your pup: Calm, sweet, opening up Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 3 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Quiet Pup Walking Manners: Very good. Easy and walks right next to you. Appetite: Normal Favorite Things:Chillin Commands/Tricks: not sure ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. We will select the best applicant for each dog, based on the dogs needs. name: Sensitive Gangster
description: Hi, I’m Arty (aka Sensitive Gangster)! My foster mom can’t stop smiling about how gentle and loving I am. I’m an easygoing, affectionate guy who loves making new friends — especially other dogs! I’d do great as a second dog (I love having a buddy!), but I’d also be okay soaking up all the love as your one and only. I’m calm and cuddly with a peaceful, gentle soul. I enjoy quiet walks, lounging nearby while you work or relax, and following your lead — I’m a go-with-the-flow kind of pup. My foster mom says I’m housebroken and totally fine being left alone at home. I’m quiet, polite, and full of love — the perfect companion for someone who wants a loyal, affectionate friend without the chaos. Quick Facts: Personality: Sweet, affectionate, gentle Good with: Dogs ✅, Kids ✅, Cats (not tested, but likely fine) Training: Housebroken; calm when left alone Energy Level: 5/10 (easygoing and mellow) Barker: Quiet pup Walking Manners: Still learning — I get excited and pull a little! Favorite Things: Other dogs (!!), plain chicken breast,hot dogs, and the occasional cracker snack Knows: “Sit” (and “melts hearts” 🥰) If you’re looking for a loving, gentle companion who gets along with everyone and adds warmth to any home, Arty’s your guy. Put Short Bio here: Fill out all below: Personality & Characteristics: Sweet, loving, very gentle My foster dog is good with: (Dogs, Kids, Cats): dogs, kids, not cat-tested but probably okay My foster dog is: (Crate trained, House trained, Low shed) housebroken. not sure about crate since we don't use one (he's totally fine being left alone outside without a crate) 3 Keywords for your pup: sweet, affectionate, gentle Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 4 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: quiet Walking Manners: pulls Appetite: okay, not food-motivated but usually eats when fed Favorite Things: other dogs (!!), crackers and plain chicken breast Commands/Tricks: seems to know sit ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. The application can be found at WaldosRescue.org and once you are approved to adopt you will be put in touch with the foster to see if it’s a good match. We are a RESCUE not a shelter. We will select the best applicant for each dog, based on the dogs needs. name: Jose "Pepe" Garcia
description: Hi! I'm Pepe and I'm looking for my forever home. I am the sweetest boy who loves to snuggle and play fetch. Once I get to know you, I will be your loyal shadow and love to make sure you are safe at all times. I've recently learned to sit and lay down with my foster mom and am getting used to the big city after spending most of my life in GA. I am perfectly trained - I only go potty outside and am always on my best behavior when I'm inside. I'm still learning to trust other dogs and can be protective on walks but I am getting more and more comfortable every day. I promise I will win you over! 3 Keywords for your pup: Cuddly, playful and affectionate Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 5 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Mostly quiet, can get protective when I hear loud noises outside or when I'm home alone Appetite: Normal, does not beg for human good Favorite Things: Fetch, Treats, Cuddling Commands/Tricks: Sit, Lay Down ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. The application can be found at WaldosRescue.org and once you are approved to adopt you will be put in touch with the foster to see if it’s a good match. We are a RESCUE not a shelter. We conduct veterinary and personal reference checks during the application approval process. We are unable to contact every applicant for every dog. We will select the best applicant for each dog, based on the dogs needs. Waldos Rescue Pen is a 501c3 whose primary focus is rescuing dogs from the euthanasia list from high kill shelters throughout the United States and Korea.

name: Islander
description: Meet Islander! Affectionately calling him snappy this puppy is so silly, smart, affectionate, cuddly, and a fast learner. Snappy is completely food motivated, so lots of treats have helped him in crate training and house training (mostly) in a matter of days. My foster dog is good with: Dogs for sure! Curious about cats, also great with kids My foster dog is: House trained, mostly crate trained" poop pad, train and working on potty training on the wee wee pads," 3 Keywords for your pup: Goofy, loving, eager Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 5 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Mostly quiet! Quiet when you leave him in the crate when you leave home after he settles, but gets a little lonely if in the same house/apartment as you and he isn't in the room with you, will likely cry. Getting better at being alone and keeping himself entertained :) Love to cuddle snuggle, loves to sleep with you on your bed working on teaching him how to sleep on his own dog bed. Walking Manners: Improves everyday on the leash, just needs some encouragement with big noises and distracting people/birds/dogs on the street., extremely treat motivated so this helps. Knows to potty immediately after going outside on leash. Appetite: Huge Favorite Things: Sleeping in your lap, stuffed toys, sniffing outside, treats!, his daily meals Commands/Tricks: Sit, come, learning "Leave it"

name: Leila
description: Leila is a female Pit Bull Terrier mix born in approximately February 2019 and rescued in South Carolina. Leila has had a very rough start to life and has been working very hard with a behaviorist to erase the remnants of that life. Leila absolutely loves other dogs and she must have a doggy sibling in her forever home. Her forever place will be a single famiy home in a quiet neighborhood with a fenced in yard and no young children. Leila is crate trained and house trained, but she wants nothing to do with a leash. She can be talkative. Leila is a bit reserved when meeting new people and she is hoping to meet someone who understands it might take her a little while to warm up. Once she is comfortable, she’ll love you forever! Leila needs a very experienced owner who will commit to continued training. Leila is a work in progress, but with the right person, she will flourish and the investment will have been well worth it! We know that special person is out there for Leila. If that's you, please apply online to adopt Leila at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. All pets are also current on age-appropriate vaccines at the time of adoption. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Shelly
description: Shelly, a beautiful Pittie, was rescued from Manhattan ACC where she had been brought in as a stray, with broken teeth and was emaciated at only 24 pounds!! She is thought to have been born in 2015. Her foster mom has been taking such good care of her and despite her obvious neglect, Shelly remains a very sweet and loving girl, she is super smart and would do well in a suburban home with a fenced yard and an active family who can devote time to her and to make sure she gets enough of her favorite activity. . . chasing tennis balls! She is great with kids and people of all ages. She does not do well with cats, and slow introductions are required if there are other dogs in the home. Shelly is spayed, up to date on vaccinations, housebroken, crate trained and knows basic commands. Please apply online if you are interested in adopting Shelly: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. All pets are also current on age-appropriate vaccines at the time of adoption. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Chestnut (Tx)
description: Chestnut (TX) is a male Shepherd mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Chestnut is 1.5 years old at the time of intake in Dec 2022. Chestnut is good with people and other dogs. Chestnut was homeless wandering the streets doing his best to survive and not getting hit by a car. He was in need of medical care so we got him and he's healing nicely. All this guy wants is a home of his own with a family who will do anything to keep him safe and happy. In the meantime he is in a foster home and his foster mom says that he is the sweetest, most affectionate and playful dog. He likes to run, play with toys and with other dogs. he's very intelligent and a quick learner. If you can give Chestnut the best home with lots of love, kisses, cuddles, treats and soft beds, please apply online to adopt Chestnut (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. All pets are also current on age-appropriate vaccines at the time of adoption. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Riley (Tn)
description: Riley (TN) is a 2-3 year male Australian Shepherd blend (as of June 2023). Our veterinary partner estimated that Riley was 2 years old at the time of intake in October 2022. Riley is good with people and great with other animals. Riley is a very sweet boy who doesn't let his impairments get in his way. He is such a special fella! You see, Riley, is deaf and has limited sight. But no fears, that doesn't slow him down. He is well adjusted and a very happy boy! He is a fun loving fella who prefers to be with his person rather than be left alone in his crate. We suppose that is likely due mostly to the fact that he is sight and hearing impaired. If you would like very handsome Riley to flourish in your home as part of your family, please apply online to adopt Riley (TN) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. He is up to date on vaccines, microchipped, and such a good boy! RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. All pets are also current on age-appropriate vaccines at the time of adoption. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Sweet Pea (Al)
description: Meet Sweet Pea: The Little Fighter with a Heart Full of Love! Life hasn’t been perfect for little Sweet Pea, but don’t tell her that—she’s far too busy wagging her tail, chasing sunbeams, and melting hearts wherever she goes! At just 5 months old (as of April 14, 2025), this female Pit Bull Terrier mix has already faced challenges that would make the toughest souls pause. Born with bent front legs, her journey started with uncertainty. But Sweet Pea? She doesn’t know the meaning of giving up. She romps, she plays, she cuddles like the world’s most perfect snugglebug—and she doesn’t let anything slow her down. Our veterinary team is giving her the best chance at mobility with braces, but whether her little legs stay the way they are or find improvement, Sweet Pea is already perfect. Spunky, happy, and absolutely adorable, Sweet Pea is ready to find her forever family—the one that will love her for exactly who she is. She’s microchipped, up to date on her vaccines, and will be spayed before heading home unless a medical reason prevents it (in which case, we’ll guide you through it at the right time). She may have been dealt a different paw in life, but Sweet Pea is pure joy wrapped in fur. She’s proof that resilience can come in the tiniest of packages—and now, she just needs someone to love her the way she deserves. Apply to adopt Sweet Pea (AL) today at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Somewhere out there, her forever family is waiting—and we hope it’s you. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport suport for pets in foster care at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Riley (Al)
description: Meet Riley (AL), a charming female Pit Bull Terrier mix who was about 10 weeks old when she was rescued in early March 2025. Despite being a young stray, Riley is now safe and thriving, and she knows it! This adorable, sweet, and spunky pup boasts a unique painted nose that makes her even more special. Riley is up to date on age-appropriate core vaccinations and has been microchipped for her safety. She will be spayed before joining her forever home, unless there's a medical reason for delay, in which case RDR NYC will coordinate with the adopter to ensure it happens at the right time. This lovely girl is great with people of all ages and gets along well with other dogs. Her adoption fee is $575. If you're interested in welcoming beautiful Riley into your family, please apply online to adopt her at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Carly (Ga)
description: Sweet Carly finds herself needing an adopter through no fault of her own. Her owner has faced some lifestyle changes that no longer allow her to care for Carly. Carly is a friendly, loving, energetic girl who would love a yard to play in - or at least a lot of exercise every day - and a human to hang out with most of the time. She loves long walks, but can help you work from home, as well. She is great with people, but a bit excitable around children, so we recommend older children only. Carly would love a male sibling to play with, someone around her size is best. Carly is about 6 years old, approximately 40 lbs, and up to date on vaccines. If you are looking for a best friend, Carly is your girl! If you would like to adopt Carly, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. name: Bonnie (Tx)
description: Bonnie (TX) is a female American Pit Bull Terrier mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Bonnie is 3 years old at the time of intake in June 2024. Bonnie is good with people, but must be an only pet. Bonnie was found neglected on the streets trying to survive the best she could. We have taken her in and given her tender love and care. She is looking for her family. She loves to run, play, hike, snuggle- you name it. She is a wonderful soulful girl, just look at her eyes! Bonnie's foster mom reports she is super friendly and wiggly. She loves to be with her people and is super smart and affectionate. Working on leash walking and potty training. She’s definitely a diamond in the ruff ! If you fall in love with her gorgeous eyes, please apply online to adopt Bonnie (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org.

name: Paco (Tx)
description: Paco (TX) is a male Labrador mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Paco is 7 months old at the time of intake in July 2024. Paco is good with people, other dogs and children. Paco's foster mom reports he is a beautiful boy that is wanting to be in his forever home. He loves balls, frisbees, treats and food. He’s good with all people, kids and dogs. He’s crate trained and enjoys the outdoors. He gets excited when he sees cats and birds. He loves belly rubs, getting brushed, doesn’t mind teeth brushing, running in the yard and walking around the neighborhood. Please apply online to adopt Paco (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. name: Kiwi (Ga)
description: Kiwi (GA) is a female Hound mix rescued in Georgia. Our veterinary partner esimates that Kiwi is 2 months old at the time of intake in December 2022. Kiwi is good with people, gets along with other dogs and pays no mind to her feline foster siblings! Kiwi is a happy, playful, funny pup who is a little ball of love and puppy energy. She loves to cuddle and will make a fantastic 4-legged companion. If you have room in your heart, home and life for Kiwi, please apply online to adopt Kiwi (GA) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. All pets are also current on age-appropriate vaccines at the time of adoption. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Talbot (Al)
description: Talbot (AL) was born into rescue in April 2021, to mom, Liz. He is growing up to be a medium-sized Lab mix. Talbot is timid and will do best in a calm home in a semi-rural area with a fenced yard and a confident resident doggy companion to help him continue to build his confidence and social skills. He is not a fan of noises or sharp movements, so if there are children in the home, they should be on the older side. Once his humans gain his confidence and trust, Talbot is a sweet and loving boy who just wants to be loved. He has been neutered and microchipped, and is up to date on core vaccines (age appropriate). If you have a leaf on your family tree with Talbot's name on it, please apply online to adopt Talbot (AL) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org.

name: Cookie (Al)
description: Cookie (AL) is a female Pit Bull Terrier mix whose age is estimated to be 2-3 weeks old at the time of intake in early December 2023. Cookie is up to date on core vaccines (age-appropriate). She is also microchipped and will be spayed prior to placement in her forever home unless there is a medical reason why it has not yet been completed (in which case RDR NYC will work with the adopter to ensure this is done at the appropriate time). Cookie came into rescue after a good samaritan saved her from being intentionally drowned in a lake. Cookie is a sweet, adorable, happy, playful pup who will make her forever home smile! She is a very social girl! If you would like Cookie to grow up as a member of your family, please apply online to adopt Cookie (AL) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Her adoption fee is $575. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Ate
description: Meet our super sweet and gentle 5-year-old pug girl. She’s shy and still learning the world, but gaining confidence and trust in humans every day. She’s a bit weary of the busy NYC streets and not yet fully leash-trained, so for now she feels safest inside. House training is a work in progress—she has occasional accidents and hasn’t mastered potty pads—but she’s tidy and never destructive! She is friendly with other dogs, and would likely do well in a home with another dog who can teach her the go around. She relaxes best in her crate (dim lights + soft music = bliss), and once she feels safe there, she’ll happily accept gentle pets. She eats and drinks well, sleeps through the night, and her curiosity about toys shows a playful spark. She needs a calm, patient home that celebrates small wins. If you love helping dogs blossom, she’ll be your little soulmate. 3 Keywords for your pup: Sweet, shy, curious! Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 6 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Occasional barker Walking Manners: She needs patience learning how to walk on a leash. Appetite: Great! Favorite Things: Sleeping in a comfy crate ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. The application can be found at WaldosRescue.org and once you are approved to adopt you will be put in touch with the foster to see if it’s a good match. We are a RESCUE not a shelter. We conduct veterinary and personal reference checks during the application approval process. We are unable to contact every applicant for every dog. We will select the best applicant for each dog, based on the dogs needs. Waldos Rescue Pen is a 501c3 whose primary focus is rescuing dogs from the euthanasia list from high kill shelters throughout the United States and Korea.

name: Piper (Tx)

name: Cassidy (Sc)
description: Meet Cassidy – A Brave Little Survivor Cassidyi (SC) s a 2‑month‑old female Shepherd mix with a spirit as strong as her will to live. This tiny fighter was rescued from a shelter after enduring a terrifying fall from three stories high. She was found on the pavement with a spinal fracture, and though she currently cannot use her back legs, Cassidy is safe in our care and receiving all the medical attention she needs. She is awaiting a neurology consult to determine the best path forward, and we are committed to giving her every chance at recovery. Despite her ordeal, Cassidy’s sweetness shines through. She is super affectionate and loves people, melting hearts instantly. She is also dog‑friendly, gentle, and social with other pups. Most of all, Cassidy is resilient—her courage inspires everyone who meets her. Cassidy deserves a loving home where she can continue her journey surrounded by compassion and care. She may have special needs, but she has endless love to give. Apply online to adopt Cassidy (SC) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Charlie (AL) may only be about two weeks old (as of November 23, 2025), but he’s already working hard on his résumé: professional snuggler, snack enthusiast, and future couch hog. This little Labrador Retriever mix was rescued with his Momma and siblings after their owner moved away and left them behind. Now, Charlie is ready to trade heartbreak for belly rubs. Charlie is basically a starter kit for happiness: floppy ears, puppy breath, a heart full of love, and enough charm to make you forget he just chewed on your shoe. He’s the kind of pup who will keep you laughing while stealing your spot on the couch. Ready to add a little chaos and a lot of love to your life? Charlie’s your guy. name: Teddy (Ga)
description: Meet Teddy – A Gentle Soul Ready for Love Teddy (GA) is a 2-year-old French Bulldog with the kindest eyes and the sweetest heart. Rescued from a shelter, Teddy has already endured more than most pups should — a history of untreated ear infections has left him with painful growths in both ears, and he’s now awaiting surgery to help him heal. We’re still learning whether Teddy is deaf or if his upcoming procedure will affect his hearing, but one thing is certain: he hears love loud and clear. Despite his medical challenges, Teddy is a total sweetheart. He is great with people, cats and other dogs. Teddy greets every human with quiet affection and leans into gentle pets like he’s been waiting his whole life for them. His resilience is inspiring, and his calm, loving nature makes him a perfect companion for someone who can offer patience, kindness, and a safe place to land. Teddy deserves a home where he’ll be cherished — not in spite of his past, but because of the brave little dog he’s become. If you’re ready to open your heart to a pup who will fill it with gratitude and unconditional love, Teddy is waiting. name: Savannah
description: Savannah is a female Pit Bull Terrier mix rescued in Georgia. Our veterinary partner estimates that Savannah was born in 2016. We received the plea for help when she had been spayed at the shelter, and had somehow managed to break her spay stitches. This allowed her intestines to come through the incision site, and she was in critical condition and needed emergency surgery to repair the site. Savannah has been all fixed up and she is now doing well. Savannah is a sweet pup who is great with people of all ages. She must be the only dog in the home, and if there is another dog in the home (which we don't recommend), Savannah cannot be crated. Otherwise, Savannah does great in a crate! She currently sleeps all night in her crate and will rocket into the crate from anywhere in her foster home in response to the "Crate Up" command! She will also go into her open crate with a toy or snack and happily hang out there. Savannah is an excellent listener who will make a great companion! She is housetrained, knows basic commands and not destructive. She is easily overwhelmed with groups of dogs, and cannot visit dog parks. She seems to be okay on leash when there is one other dog around. Savannah will need a family who understands and accepts her issues with other dogs. If you can provide a stable, loving home for Savannah and would like to adopt her, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. name: Madonna (Ga)
description: Madonna (GA) is a female American Pit Bull Terrier mix rescued in Georgia and estimated to be 2 years old at intake in September 2020. Madonna is a low-energy, super sweet, shy girl who is great with women and children, but fearful of men and quick hand movements. She needs a calm home and a gentle female owner. Madonna is good with other dogs with slow introductions, but is not a fan of cats; she prefers to eat in her crate and not have to worry about others taking her food. When we first found Madonna, she was tethered to a tree in the woods, with wounds sustained in an attack by another dog, as well as many scars and broken and missing teeth - signs of horrifying prior abuse. Madonna also had a non-cancerous mammary tumor removed; the biopsy came back as benign hyperplasia. We really want to show Madonna that life is full of wonder, love, companionship and can indeed be happy! She walks nicely on a leash, adores kids, sits for treats. She loves to sit with her toys in her foster family's fenced in yard. Dana prefers sleeping in her dog bed over sleeping in her human's bed. She is crazy for toys, and her favorite is her squeaky chicken. Dana is playful, happy, snuggly, kissable and lovable. She asked us to let you know that she is not a fan of car rides! Dana will be a wonderful family dog. If you are looking for 4-legged love, Dana is looking for you! Please apply online to adopt Dana (AL) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Her adoption fee is $500. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Hatcher (Ga)
description: Meet Hatcher — a 1-year-old Boxer mix with a heart as big as his second chance at life. Rescued as a puppy from a shelter, Hatcher was found with a devastating burn along his back. But with love, care, and the resilience only a dog can teach us, he’s made a great recovery and blossomed into the sweetest, most joyful boy. Now healed and thriving, Hatcher is looking for his forever family. He’s a cuddly, happy-go-lucky pup who adores playtime, zoomies in the yard, and snuggles on the couch. He gets along beautifully with other dogs and is always eager to make new friends — canine or human. If you're looking for a loyal companion with a remarkable spirit and an even bigger heart, Hatcher is your guy. Apply online to adopt Hatcher (GA) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org . Let’s give Hatcher the happy ending he’s waited a whole year for. 🐾 Hatcher is up to date on core vaccines (age-appropriate) and is microchipped. Hatcher will be neutered prior to joining his forever home unless there is a medical reason why it has not yet been completed (in which case RDR NYC will work with the adopter to ensure this is done at the appropriate time). His adoption fee is $500. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Gizmo
description: ALL our cats and dogs are in the NY area but can be adopted out of state to the purrfect furever home. In some cases, we can help transport. Zani's al fresco Summer Adoptions follow us on FB to find us this summer as we will try new locations to meet the needs of NYC and support the little stores:) Handsome 4yrs old 45lbs Gizmo from Jamaica. All dogs are located in NY/NJ area All our puppies need puppy play dates/doggy facetime so we recommend homes with other pups or daily interactions to keep them tired out, happy and social. Facebook: Zani's Furry Friends ZFF (weekly adoption event info posted there) Twitter: zanisff Instagram: zanisfurryfriends Dogs are spayed/neutered, UTD on age appropriate vaccines, Rabies vaxed, and microchipped (not Lyme vaxed but we seriously recommend it!) All are in the NY/NJ area but we will adopt out of state to the purrfect home and in some cases, we can arrange transport. Please go to our site https://zanisfurryfriends.org fill out an application Many of us (cats/dogs) will be on display on Saturdays or Sundays, weather dependent--please ask by writing us at dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org and following us on FB. If you are seriously interested in adopting one of us in particular, please fill out an application early Friday so that we can be sure to be there. Otherwise we decide based on other variables. Usually we are in our foster homes so this is a bit more stressful and a slightly artificial environment but we do want to be seen and find our furever homes too. Please consider providing a home for more than one dog, especially if you are considering adopting a puppy. Dogs are pack animals and very much enjoy as well as need other dog company to learn to play, socialize and be good companion animals to people. The upside to this is that you won't feel as guilty leaving them alone and you get twice the love. Please come! And if you can't adopt, maybe you can foster or volunteer, and you can always donate! If you want to know about cats/dogs specifically being shown at our adoption locations, please email us info@zanisfurryfriends.org closer to the date so we know your interest and will make every effort to have that pet at the event or let you know how and where you can meet. It is extemely helpful and speeds up adoption if the application is filled out prior to visiting us so please do that before coming to our weekend events. Our weekend locations are: Saturdays or Sundays, weather dependent Follow us on FB, Zani's Furry Friends ZFF, for latest updates. Usually we are in our foster homes so all this is a bit more stressful but we do want to be seen and find our furever homes. Please come! And if you can't adopt, maybe you can foster or volunteer. And you can always donate:) Cats and Dogs are spayed/neutered, UTD w/ all age appropriate shots and microchipped. Cats are feline combo tested for FIV/FeLV; dogs are heartworm tested and rabies vax'd, (NOT lyme vaxed but we seriously recommend it); rabbits are spayed/neutered. Please fill out an application and email to: For Cats: cats@zanisfurryfriends.org For Dogs: dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org For Rabbits: nyc.acc.rabbits@gmail.com. Please visit our website zanisfurryfriends.org.

name: Dixby Daxby (Tx)
description: Dixby (TX) is a male Shepherd mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Dixby is 8 years old at the time of intake in Nov 2022. Dixby is good with people and other dogs. This senior boy was found living in the dirt abandoned by his owners. He had little chance of survival on his own but we've rescued him and got him the care he needs to start his new life. He is looking for a family that will cherish him and provide him all the comforts of a happy life. He dreams of soft beds and love. This boy is a DOLL!! Dixby is an adorable ball of energetic love! Though his past he endured neglect and heartbreak, he is a happy energetic pup! He enjoys head petting, love and playing in the yard and going on walks. His favorite thing is chewing on his Benebone and rolling around the rug! He also likes to cuddle on the couch, napping on your lap or having his paws touching you, he loves to be with his family. Because he loves to play a fenced in yard would be best for him. He's smart too and learning his commands, he is mastering sit, wait, come and off. This sweet boy is so full of love even after all that he has been through in his life. If you would like to give Dixby the happy life he deserves as a member of your family, please apply online to adopt Dixby (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. All pets are also current on age-appropriate vaccines at the time of adoption. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. name: Christian (Al)
description: Meet Christian (AL) – the sweetest little rescue pup! Christian is just about two weeks old (as of November 23, 2025) and already stealing hearts! This adorable male Labrador Retriever mix was rescued alongside his loving Momma and siblings after their owner sadly moved away and left them behind. We believe his Dad may have been a Lab/Catahoula mix, which makes Christian extra special with his unique heritage. Despite such a rough start, Christian is thriving—playful, cuddly, and oh-so-precious. He’s the kind of puppy who will wiggle his way right into your lap and your life. With his big puppy eyes and boundless love, Christian is ready to find a forever family who will never let him down. If you’re looking for a loyal companion and a bundle of joy, Christian is waiting for you! Apply online today at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org to adopt Christian (AL) and give him the happy home he deserves. Please be sure to reference this pet's name as Christian (AL) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. Thank you! RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. name: Beau (Sc)
description: Beau (SC) is a 70 lb. neutered male Pit Bull Terrier mix. Our veterinary partner estimated that Beau was 2 years old at the time of intake in September 2021. Beau is a super sweet, gentle, friendly boy who is good with people. Although Beau loves children, he's a big guy who doesn't know his own strength, so he would do best with teens and older. This beautiful boy was shot in the mouth while a drug warrant was being served; fortunately, the bullet lodged in Beau's neck in a spot that is not causing any pain or limitation. It was determined that it's best left there as the surgery to remove it is dangerous. Beau is a couch potato and LOVES to cuddle, is completely housebroken, enjoys car rides and does not chew or destroy anything (except for his toys which he loves to remove squeakers from). Beau would be perfect for a person or couple that doesn’t have other animals or has one submissive female (the only type of dogs he seems to get along with). He needs to be the center of attention so he can get all the love and attention he deserves. Beau is reactive to other dogs, so walking can be a bit challenging (he has a loud bark). Having a fenced in yard would be a plus. Beau can truly be your forever, loyal best friend if you crave pure unconditional love. You will be blessed to encounter this special guy. If you would like to star in Beau's new, improved life, please apply online to adopt Beau (SC) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. ************************************************************************ RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. All pets are also current on age-appropriate vaccines at the time of adoption Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. name: Figaro (Al)
description: Figaro (AL) is a male Terrier mix, estimated to be 18 months old at the time of intake in November 2024. Figaro is up to date on core vaccines and is microchipped. He will be neutered prior to joining his forever family unless there is a medical reason why it has not yet been completed (in which case RDR NYC will work with the adopter to ensure this is done at the appropriate time). Figaro is great with people, more mellow dogs and he is good with cats. This very cool looking guy ended up in a shelter before finding his way into rescue. He is suffering from a skin infection that has caused his fur to fall out, and he has a severe case of cherry eye. Our veterinary partner will fix Figaro up and we can't wait to see how even more handsome he is once his fur grows back! Figaro is a goofy, sweet, friendly boy. If you would like Figaro to join your family, please apply online to adopt Figaro (AL) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Given technical constraints on this dtabase, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Hudson (Al)
description: Meet Hudson: A Gentle Soul Ready for His Second Chance Hudson (AL) is a 6-year-old English Bulldog with a heart as big as his jowls. Recently surrendered by his owner, Hudson arrived at the shelter with tired eyes and a few skin issues that speak to a life that hasn’t always been kind. But don’t let his sad expression fool you—this boy is on the brink of something beautiful. Despite everything, Hudson remains a sweet, trusting companion. He adores people and thrives around other pets, greeting everyone with a quiet warmth that melts hearts. He doesn’t bark for attention—he simply waits, hoping someone will see past the rough patches and recognize the love he’s ready to give. Hudson is neutered, gentle, and house-savvy. He’s not asking for much—just a soft bed, a kind hand, and a home where he can finally exhale. His skin is healing, his spirit is rising, and with the right family, his story will turn from sorrow to joy. If you’ve ever wanted to be someone’s hero, Hudson is waiting. Let him show you how resilient love can be. Please apply online to adopt Hudson (AL) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Please also be sure to reference his name as Hudson (AL) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. Thank you! RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. name: Fitz (Ga)
description: Meet Fitz (AL): The Fluffiest Comeback Story of the Year! Once upon a time, Fitz took a tumble—probably chasing squirrels or trying to out-jog a jogger—and ended up with a gnarly road rash. But don’t worry, this 9-year-old Australian Shepherd mix is now fully healed, fully fabulous, and fully ready to be your new best friend. Fitz is a certified good boy. He’s friendly with humans and fellow pups alike, rocking a distinguished salt-and-pepper look that screams “wise but still down to party.” He’s house-trained in the art of chill and snuggles, and he’s the kind of dog who’ll listen to your problems, won’t judge your snack choices, and might even help you pick better ones (he’s very pro-cheese). Whether you’re into long walks or long naps, Fitz is your guy. Apply to adopt Fitz (AL) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org and give this comeback king the loving home he deserves.Because every hero deserves a happy ending—and Fitz is ready for his. Please be sure to reference this pet's name as Fitz (AL) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. Thank you! name: Lillian (Ga)
description: Meet Lillian (GA)! Lillian is a Labrador Retriever mix estimated to be 4 years old at the time of intake in February 2025. Lillian's story is one of remarkable resilience and boundless love. Rescued by a compassionate police officer from a cruel and abusive home, Lillian's journey to recovery has been nothing short of inspiring. Despite the hardships she endured, this sweet, loving girl has an incredible capacity for affection and trust. Currently receiving care for a severe skin condition at our veterinary partner, Lillian is on the path to health and happiness. She will receive all the medical attention she needs to ensure a full recovery. She is friendly, gentle, and gets along wonderfully with people and other dogs. Her warm heart and gentle nature make her the perfect companion for any loving home. Lillian has all her core vaccinations and is microchipped for her safety. She will be spayed prior to joining her forever home unless a medical reason prevents it. If so, RDR NYC will work with the adopter to ensure it is completed when appropriate. Lillian is now looking for her forever home where she can share her love and joy. If you have space in your heart and home for this incredible dog, please apply to adopt Lillian (GA) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Let's find Lillian the loving home she truly deserves! Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter. name: Kaleb (Al)
description: Kaleb (AL) is a male Labrador Retriever/Hound mix estimated to be 2 years old at the time of intake in early January 2024. Kaleb is up to date on core vaccines. He is microchipped and will be neutered prior to placement in his forever home unless there is a medical reason why it has not yet been completed (in which case RDR NYC will work with the adopter to ensure this is done at the appropriate time). Kaleb is good with people and other dogs after a slow introduction. He is an a ctive boy looking for an active, outdoorsy family but one who also wants an affectionate dog that loves to snuggle and enjoys lots of attention. Kaleb would likely not do well in a city environment. He t hinks he’s a lap dog and loves to be held and snuggled. Kaleb is being fostered on a farm with horses and chickens, and he is doing great. He is good with his foster bunny sibling. He loves other dogs but isn’t always great at first intros so his foster family is working with him on his confidence. Once he gets to know other dogs, he loves to play, play, play with them! Kaleb is vision impaired (he is currently being evaluated). He loves to swim, loves food, people and dogs. He is smart and works great with positive reinforcement. He does fine sleeping on the couch when alone, but he will need someone to give him an active lifestyle. Kaleb is a handsome, sweet southern gentleman who can't wait to find his happy ever after in his forever home. If you would like to be Kaleb's forever family, please apply online to adopt Kaleb (AL) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. name: Baby Doll (Ga)
description: Meet Baby Doll (GA), the resilient Yorkshire Terrier with a heart full of love! Sweet, affectionate, and eager to find her forever home, Baby Doll has been through quite a journey. At just 6 years old, this precious girl was adopted from the shelter but returned after one day due to seizures. Yet, she never had a seizure while in the shelter—and hasn’t had one since returning. Perhaps she simply wasn’t in the right home! Baby Doll is a happy, loving pup who deserves a second chance with a family that will cherish her unconditionally. She’s playful, gentle, and sure to bring joy wherever she goes. Could you be the perfect match for this special girl? Apply online to adopt Baby Doll (GA) today: www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Her forever home is waiting! Please also be sure to reference her name as Baby Doll (GA) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. Thank you! name: Hatcher (Al)
description: Hatcher: The Brave Little Explorer with a Wink and a Wag Once upon a time (okay, like a few weeks ago), a scruffy little Shepherd/Husky mix named Hatcher was found roaming the streets like a pint-sized adventurer. At just 10–11 weeks old, he’d already survived a mystery trauma and now sports a permanent wink after the removal of his left eye. But don’t let the past fool you—this boy is pure sunshine. Hatcher is sweet, silly, and loves everyone he meets. People? Obsessed. Other dogs? Instant BFFs. Cats? Wants to play, but respectful with zero prey drive. Squeaky toys? Life-changing. He’s got the fluff of a Husky, the loyalty of a Shepherd, and the heart of a hero. If you’re looking for a pup who is equal parts cuddle bug and comedy act, Hatcher’s your guy. He’s ready to turn the page and start his happily-ever-after—with you. Apply to adopt this little legend at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. His tail’s already wagging at the thought. Please also be sure to reference this pet's name as Hatcher (AL) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. Thank you! name: Samson (Ga)
description: Samson (GA) is a male Pit Bull Terrier mix estimated to be 6 weeks old at the time of intake in early February 2025. Samson is up to date on core vaccinations and is microchipped. He will be neutered prior to joining his forever home unless there is a medical reason why it has not yet been completed (in which case RDR NYC will work with the adopter to ensure this is done at the appropriate time). Samson is good with people of all ages and other dogs. This happy guy was rescued from an apartment where he had been abandoned to fend for himself. Fortunately, Samson was rescued from the apartment and brought to a shelter. His story doesn't end there, though. The shelter was going to euthanize Samson because he had ringworm! Well, not today . . . Samson is now a Rescue Dogs Rock guy, that ringworm was treated and he's now on the road to happiness! Samson is not a city type of guy; he prefers a quiet suburb or country life. Samson is handsome, sweet, adorable and friendly. If that's what you're looking for in a friend, look no further, here he is! His adoption fee is $575. Please apply online to adopt Samson (GA) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. name: Tigger
description: Tigger, a high-energy bull terrier and pit bull mix born in late 2015, is the friendliest, most fun-loving little guy. He absolutely loves everyone he meets. While he especially loves children he is better suited to older kids, not little ones. He likes to be king of his castle, so he should be the only pet in his home. And his home should be in a quiet suburb with a fenced yard where Tigger can play and burn off his energy. He loves his people so much, he needs them to be home a lot. name: Lena (Ga)

At her tender young age of 5 months, she should have no issues becoming acclimated to a cat, should one also live in the home. Lena (GA) is the perfect little girl, loving, friendly, playful, happy, and so ready to leave that vet crate behind! Her life is going to be fantastic with her new family and she is really looking forward to it. Is that with you? www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org to apply for Lena (GA).

name: Chance (Al)
description: Take a Chance on… Chance! Meet Chance (AL), a two-week-old (as of November 23, 2025) Labrador Retriever mix who’s already proving that tiny paws can make a big impact. He was rescued with his Momma and siblings after their owner moved away and left them behind—but Chance is ready to turn his luck around with a forever family. Rumor has it his Dad was a Lab/Catahoula mix, which means Chance is destined to be both handsome and hilariously goofy. Right now, he’s all about puppy snores, wobbly walks, and practicing his “puppy dog eyes” (spoiler: he’s already a pro). Chance comes with a starter pack of joy: a face that could melt steel, eyes that you can't look away from, and a heart so big it might just take over your couch. He’s the kind of pup who will make you laugh when he tumbles over his own paws and then melt your heart when he climbs into your lap for snuggles. Don’t miss your Chance—this little guy is ready to bring love, laughter, and a dash of chaos into your life. Please be sure to reference this pet's name as Chance (AL) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. Thank you! name: Chase (Al)
description: Wanted: One Forever Family for Chase! Hi, I’m Chase—though at just two weeks old (as of November 23, 2025), I’m not exactly chasing much yet… unless you count chasing naps, milk, and cuddles. I was rescued with my Momma and siblings after our owner decided to move away and leave us behind. But don’t worry—I’m not bitter. I’m too busy being cute. I’m a Labrador Retriever mix, and rumor has it my Dad was a Lab/Catahoula mix. Translation: I’m destined to be handsome, smart, and maybe a little goofy. Basically, I’m the full puppy package. Here’s what I bring to the table: puppy breath that’s scientifically proven to melt hearts, tiny paws that will one day be big enough to steal your couch, unlimited snuggles with no subscription required, and comic relief—because watching me learn how to walk is like watching a baby giraffe on roller skates. So if you’re ready for a lifetime of love, laughter, and a little chaos, I’m your guy. Apply online today at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org to adopt me! As soon as we found out about Spanky, we pulled him out and sent him to our veterinary partner where the tumor was removed. He is doing great now with his foster and is ready for a forever home! Spanky is good with people and other dogs. He is very sweet, loving, and alert. He loves peanut butter, toys, and spending time in the sun. He takes a toy to bed with him each night. He also enjoys running around the yard. This boy is super sweet and friendly, and his tail never stops wagging! He deserves to live the rest of his life in a happy, loving home. If you have room in your heart for Spanky, please apply online to adopt Spanky (SC) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. He will be neutered prior to joining his forever home unless there is a medical reason why it has not yet been completed (in which case RDR NYC will work with the adopter to ensure this is done at the appropriate time). name: Justus
description: This stunning boy is Justus, a Pit mix born in 2015, who came into rescue from Texas - found chained, with no fur, eyes filled with mucus, skin raging from infection from neglect and abuse, unable to use his back legs and left on a blanket to die. An MRI determined that blunt force trauma caused a fracture to his spine that was never treated. With intensive physical therapy, our strong-willed warrior with the now-gorgeous coat is running, playing and ready for a home of his own! Justus absolutely adores his humans, including older children, but needs to be the only pet in his home. And he is reactive to loud noises, so his home should be in a quiet suburb with a yard. He is neutered and up to date on vaccines. If you are the special someone who can finally show Justus what it’s like to be loved unconditionally, never to be abandoned or mistreated ever again, please fill out an adoption application here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue.
