name: Lotus (Ga)
description: Meet Lotus (GA), the sweet and confident companion! This beautiful girl is a female mixed breed pup estimated to be 1.5 years old as of August 2025. Lotus might be a little shy at first, but with a patient and loving guardian, she blossoms into the sweetest and most loyal companion you could ask for. Her adorable underbite and gentle nature only add to her irresistible charm. Lotus thrives on adventure! She'll happily join you on outings to festivals, stores, and even loud events as long as she's with someone she trusts. Imagine all the fun memories you'll create together. Walking with Lotus is a dream. She's a leash pro, trotting along gracefully without pulling, completely focused on her trusted person. It's almost like she disappears into your shadow, a constant and comforting presence by your side. But don't let her preference for a feminine touch fool you – she's friendly and respectful towards everyone, including men. Lotus is a true gem, a bomb-proof companion around other animals and children. Whether you have other furry friends or not, she'll fit right in and bring a calming presence to your home. In fact, she loves to nurture and care for those around her. Give her a high-value treat, and she'll try to share it with you. She's even the first to greet new dogs and welcome them into her space, showcasing her friendly and accepting nature. This sweet girl might be a bit vocal if she feels something isn't quite right, but it's her way of communicating her feelings and protecting her loved ones. And when it's time to relax, get ready for some serious snuggling! Lotus is a professional at cuddling and will shower you with love and affection, a true furry shadow who's always there for you. If you're a patient and kind woman looking for a loyal, adventure-loving, and affectionate companion, Lotus could be the perfect match for you. Give her a chance to open her heart to you, and she'll fill your life with joy and unconditional love. Interested in giving Lotus her forever home? Apply now at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. If you would like to adopt Sophie (GA), and invite her into your comfortable, loving home as a family member well loved and safe, please put your application in here: www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org Please also be sure to reference her name as Lotus (GA) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. name: Theo (Ga)
description: Meet Theo: Your Gentle Giant with a Heart of Gold Hi, I’m Theo — a 3-year-old Rottweiler with soulful eyes, a goofy grin, and a heart that’s bigger than my paws (and trust me, those are huge ). Life didn’t start out easy for me. When I was rescued, I was skin and bones — a shadow of the dog I was meant to be. But even though humans let me down, I never stopped believing in love. And now? I’m ready to find my forever person. Could it be you? I’m a certified snuggle bug. I’ll happily plop my giant self right into your lap like I’m a Chihuahua — personal space is overrated, right? I’m also a toy connoisseur. I carry my favorite squeaky wherever I go, like a toddler with a teddy bear. It’s my comfort, my joy, and sometimes my pillow. I’m a people magnet, too. I adore humans — big ones, small ones, loud ones, quiet ones. If you’ve got a heartbeat, I want to be near it. I get along great with other pups. And most of all, I’m loyal to the core. Once I know you’re mine, I’ll be your shadow — following you from room to room, offering silent support, and maybe a slobbery kiss or two. Despite my rough past, I’m not bitter — I’m better. I’ve got so much love to give, and I’m just waiting for someone to give me a chance to show it. I’m Theo, your big-hearted best friend, your cuddle companion, your toy-toting goofball. Adopt me, and you’ll never be alone again. I’ll be your shadow, your protector, and your biggest fan. Let’s start our happily-ever-after. Please put your application in here: www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org Please also be sure to reference his name as Theo (GA) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. Thank you! name: Polly (Sc)
description: Meet Polly: The Mastiff Mix Marvel! Hi, I’m Polly (AL)! At just 8 months old, I’ve already mastered the art of melting hearts with my big puppy eyes and goofy grin. I’m a Mastiff mix, which means I’ve got the perfect combo of gentle giant vibes and silly puppy energy. I'm going to be a big girl but that's all the bigger I can love you! My Story: I came into rescue with an embedded collar (ouch!), but don’t worry—those tough days are behind me. Thanks to kind humans, I’m healing beautifully and ready to start my next chapter: finding my forever family. My Personality: I’m sweet as sugar with people and will happily be your shadow. I’m playful and friendly with other dogs, becoming instant besties wherever I go. I’m also an expert snuggler, tail-wagger, and treat enthusiast. Fun Facts About Me: I believe belly rubs should be a daily requirement. I’m convinced squeaky toys are the greatest invention of all time. And my dream job? Professional couch cuddler. Why Adopt Polly? Because life’s better with a loyal sidekick who makes you laugh, keeps you company, and loves you unconditionally. I’ve already proven I’m a survivor—now I just need someone to help me thrive. Apply to adopt me today at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. name: Missy
description: ALL our cats and dogs are in the NY area but can be adopted out of state to the purrfect furever home. In some cases, we can help transport. Zani's al fresco Summer Adoptions follow us on FB to find us this summer as we will try new locations to meet the needs of NYC and support the little stores:) Sweet 4yrs 25lbs Missy from Jamaica All dogs are located in NY/NJ area All our puppies need puppy play dates/doggy facetime so we recommend homes with other pups or daily interactions to keep them tired out, happy and social. Facebook: Zani's Furry Friends ZFF (weekly adoption event info posted there) Twitter: zanisff Instagram: zanisfurryfriends Dogs are spayed/neutered, UTD on age appropriate vaccines, Rabies vaxed, and microchipped (not Lyme vaxed but we seriously recommend it!) All are in the NY/NJ area but we will adopt out of state to the purrfect home and in some cases, we can arrange transport. Please go to our site https://zanisfurryfriends.org fill out an application Many of us (cats/dogs) will be on display on Saturdays or Sundays, weather dependent--please ask by writing us at dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org and following us on FB. If you are seriously interested in adopting one of us in particular, please fill out an application early Friday so that we can be sure to be there. Otherwise we decide based on other variables. Usually we are in our foster homes so this is a bit more stressful and a slightly artificial environment but we do want to be seen and find our furever homes too. Please consider providing a home for more than one dog, especially if you are considering adopting a puppy. Dogs are pack animals and very much enjoy as well as need other dog company to learn to play, socialize and be good companion animals to people. The upside to this is that you won't feel as guilty leaving them alone and you get twice the love. Please come! And if you can't adopt, maybe you can foster or volunteer, and you can always donate! If you want to know about cats/dogs specifically being shown at our adoption locations, please email us info@zanisfurryfriends.org closer to the date so we know your interest and will make every effort to have that pet at the event or let you know how and where you can meet. It is extemely helpful and speeds up adoption if the application is filled out prior to visiting us so please do that before coming to our weekend events. Our weekend locations are: Saturdays or Sundays, weather dependent Follow us on FB, Zani's Furry Friends ZFF, for latest updates. Usually we are in our foster homes so all this is a bit more stressful but we do want to be seen and find our furever homes. Please come! And if you can't adopt, maybe you can foster or volunteer. And you can always donate:) Cats and Dogs are spayed/neutered, UTD w/ all age appropriate shots and microchipped. Cats are feline combo tested for FIV/FeLV; dogs are heartworm tested and rabies vax'd, (NOT lyme vaxed but we seriously recommend it); rabbits are spayed/neutered. Please fill out an application and email to: For Cats: cats@zanisfurryfriends.org For Dogs: dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org For Rabbits: nyc.acc.rabbits@gmail.com. Please visit our website zanisfurryfriends.org.

name: Shadow (Ny)
description: Meet Shadow: The Littlest Tough Guy with the Biggest Heart Shadow (NY) is a 5–6 week old (as of 11/9/25) terrier mix who just escaped a kill shelter like a tiny, wrinkly action hero. He’s currently rocking some battle scars—sores on his eyes, ears, and face—but don’t worry, he’s getting a little better every day with one of our fosters. Despite his rough start, Shadow is basically a marshmallow with legs. He loves people, adores other dogs, and has the kind of face that makes grown adults squeal in baby talk. He’s sweet, snuggly, and ready to be your sidekick in everything from Netflix binges to snack raids. Shadow’s looking for a forever home where he can heal, grow, and maybe steal a sock or two. If you’ve got room in your heart (and on your couch), apply to adopt this adorable goofball at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Warning: extreme cuteness may cause spontaneous happy dancing. Please be sure to reference this pet's name as Shadow (NY) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. Thank you! RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. All pets are also current on age-appropriate vaccines at the time of adoption. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Anitta
description: Meet Anitta (I call her Bella!) This adorable girl has truly blossomed since arriving in foster care. Once timid and unsure, Bella has gained so much confidence and now loves going for her daily walks she’s incredibly curious about her surroundings and enjoys exploring the world at her own gentle pace. Bella is wonderful with other dogs and people, and she picks up new habits quickly. She’s also fully potty trained and thrives on routine and positive encouragement. She’s still a sensitive soul who appreciates a calm, loving environment, but every day she shows more of her sweet, affectionate personality. With continued patience and love, Bella will reward her forever family with endless loyalty, cuddles, and joy. Plus, she’s hypoallergenic and adorable and low-maintenance! Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 3 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Quiet ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. The application can be found at WaldosRescue.org and once you are approved to adopt you will be put in touch with the foster to see if it’s a good match. We are a RESCUE not a shelter. We conduct veterinary and personal reference checks during the application approval process. We are unable to contact every applicant for every dog. We will select the best applicant for each dog, based on the dogs needs. Waldos Rescue Pen is a 501c3 whose primary focus is rescuing dogs from the euthanasia list from high kill shelters throughout the United States and Korea.

name: Carmel Tx
description: Carmel (TX) is a Jack Chi mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Carmel is 8 months old at the time of intake in October 2025. Carmel is good with people and other dogs and cats! Carmel was found wandering around by herself at such a young age. Just look at those eyes! This beautiful girl is super sweet and would love a home of her own. She is a happy girl who would love to be part of a family to play and run with! She is eager and willing to learn, she's doing well on a leash and eats up all the attention she can get. Can you show Carmel the love she craves? Please apply online to adopt Carmel (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. All pets are also current on age-appropriate vaccines at the time of adoption Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Sydney (Ga)
description: Sydney (GA) is a female Pit Bull Terrier mix estimated to be 7 months old at the time of intake in November 2024. Sydney is up to date on core vaccinations (age-appropriate) and is microchipped. She will be spayed prior to joining her forever home unless there is a medical reason why it has not yet been completed (in which case RDRNYC will work with the adopter to ensure this is done at the appropriate time). Sydney is good with people and other dogs. We rescued this sweet girl from a shelter where she was taken after having been picked up by Animal Control. Sydney was suffering from a painful skin condition, flea and ant bites. Her fur has fallen out and her skin is raw and red. We don't know how long this poor baby has suffered like that, but she is now receiving all the medical care she requires and Sydney is well on the way to recovery! Sydney is friendly and sweet. If you can give Sydney the fantastic home she deserves, please apply online to adopt Sydney (GA) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Bronx (Tx)
description: Bronx (TX) is a female Husky mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Bronx is 2 year old at the time of intake in October 2024. Bronx is good with people and other dogs. Bronx was found malnourished and in bad shape. Don't let this tripod fool you (she doesn't even know she has 3 legs) her spirit and attitude is infectious! Bronx's foster mom reports she is crate trained and loving life ! She gets along with other dogs and is a happy go lucky dog despite not having her leg ! If you check off all the boxes, Bronx is looking for in her family, please apply online to adopt Bronx (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org.

name: Bogey (Ms)
description: Bogey (MS) is a male Pointer mix estimated to be 1.5 years old at the time of intake in July 2024. Bogey is up to date on core vaccinations and is microchipped. He will be neutered prior to joining his forever home unless there is a medical reason why it has not yet been completed (in which case RDR NYC will work with the adopter to ensure this is done at the appropriate time). Bogey is good with people and other dogs. This big, goofy, silly mush of a dog loves to be wherever his people are. He adores every dog he’s ever met--big ones, little ones, even the ones who wish he would go away! Bogey is not a fan of being crated but hasn't destroyed anything (except for stealing food) while roaming free. This handsome, fabulous boy is looking for his happy ever after with his forever family. If Bogey's path to happiness leads to your front door, please apply online to adopt Bogey (MS) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Missy (Ga)
description: Missy is a beautiful 3yr old Lab/Chow mix weighing in at 54 lbs! Missy came to rescue from GA with a terribly painful skin infection and mange. Look how stunning this beautiful girl is now! Missy was extremely scared of people when she came into foster. She has absolutely “blossomed” and is the life of the party in her foster family’s pack. Missy MUST have another dog as she builds confidence and finds much happiness and peace surrounded by other canines. She does well with male and female dogs of all sizes, and she must have a fenced yard to run around in. She is VERY shy and timid at first with human strangers and must build trust at her own pace. Once she feels secure, she turns into a playful, loving, affectionate girl who brings joy wherever she is! Missy is spayed, crate trained and house trained. She has very nice manners in the home. She enjoys her crate for her personal “den” and finds security there. Adopter must be willing to allow Missy to open up and trust at her own pace and seek attention in her own time. I f you can open your heart and home to Missy and give her the time and patience she so deserves, please apply at http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. name: Rey (Tx)
description: Hi, I’m Rey (TX)! I am a 4 and 1/2 year old Lab/Plott Hound mix. I don’t mean to brag but I’m a very beautiful girl and I’m also very sweet! I really like people and love to play with older, respectful kids, other confident male dogs, and even cats! Are you the lucky one who will get to love me forever?! To adopt me, please fill out an application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application

name: Lila (Ga)
description: Lila is a beautiful 3-5 yr old Lab/Vizsla mix weighing in at 54 lbs! This girl spent a majority of her young life on her own fending for herself without much socialization. Lila is learning to trust humans. She is an absolute treasure!! Sweet disposition, shy and very well behaved. Crate trained/ house trained beautiful manners. Lila MUST have another dog in the family. She is playful and happiest with canine companions. She truly is a pack dog and gains confidence surrounded by others. Good with all sizes, breeds. Lila has bonded with her foster sister Missy and would do well if they could be adopted together. She needs to have a very patient owner who will allow her to take her time building trust and seeking out affection on her own terms. She is a very low maintenance dog. Must have a fenced backyard. She loves to play with other dogs and she loves her crate for her quiet time and her own space. Lila has been spayed. I f you would like to learn more about Lila and are interested in adopting her, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. All pets are also current on age-appropriate vaccines at the time of adoption. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. name: Panda (Al)
description: Panda (AL) is one of Paisley's pups, born on December 26, 2022. DNA shows 50% Dogue de Bordeaux mixed with Shar-Pei, Neopolitan Mastiff, Lab & Bulldog! Panda is good with people of all ages and other dogs. We rescued Panda from a hoarding situation where he was born just 16 days before. Panda is now about to set out on the path to happiness. He is a cute, funny boy who loves to snuggle in between puppy zoomies. If Panda's path to happiness leads to your front door, please apply online to adopt Panda (AL) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. name: Mable (Tx)
description: Mable (TX) is a female chihuahua mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Mable is 3 years old at the time of intake June 2024. Mable is good with people and other dogs. Mable was found homeless on the streets but RDR has taken her in and she is now ready to find her forever home. She is the cutest little girl who just needs a human to show her love and affection - and a chew toy or two won't hurt either! If you can open your heart and home to Mable, please apply online to adopt Mable (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. name: Mindy (Tn)
description: Mindy (TN) is a female Pit Bull Terrier blend who came to rescue incredibly skinny, heartbreakingly so. She was estimated at the time of intake in Jan 2023 by our veterinary partner to be 4 years old at that time. Mindy is good with people and other dogs, is up to date on core vaccines, and has been microchipped. The face on this beautiful pup tells the sad story of Mindy's life. We found her in the euthanasia room of a kill shelter just minutes away from losing her life because she was suffering from a painful, itchy skin infection that was ravaging her body. We immediately pulled Mindy from the jaws of death, and now her face will soon be smiling at her promising future. Mindy is such a sweet girl, and she would love to share her future with you! (But no cats in this pup's future, please!) This beautiful girl is 50 lbs of love & snuggles! She is super smart, crate & house-trained and walks great on a leash. Mindy is very well behaved. If you would like Mindy to join your family, please apply online to adopt Mindy (TN) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. name: Mocha (Tx) Aka Noir
description: Mocha (TX)—or the Mocha Man as his foster calls him—is thought to be a male Rottweiler/Pincher mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Mocha is 2 months old at the time of intake November 2023, so he would be about 2 as of August 2025. Mocha is good with people of all ages, other dogs, and cats. Mocha's foster reports he is great with everyone and dog and cat friendly! He is full of puppy energy and sweet kisses. He would do great in a home with a yard to run. Mocha is a fun-loving dog who would make you laugh with his silliness. He likes to play tug-of-war and is fond of his routine, getting up and going to bed early and waiting for permission to eat. His mortal enemy is cardboard boxes (he sometimes chews them). Can you please share your address and apply online to adopt Mocha (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. name: Rosalie Tx
description: Rosalie (TX) is a female shepherd mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that she is 7 yrs old at the time of intake in June2025. This poor girl was found on the streets, nearly dead, annorexic, starving. Luckily RDR got to her and she is healing up wonderfully. She is eating and gaining her strength back. She is getting ready to head to the Northeast where her forver family can show her she is truly loved! Rosalie foster reports she is near perfect! She's affectionate, potty trained,her poops look good and healthy. She sleeps through the night, greets neighbors on our walks. Becoming more playful as she adjusts to home.life...She's a joy. She is such a smart girl who would make the perfect companion! Please apply online to adopt Rosalie (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. name: Alex (Ga)
description: Alex (GA) is a male Great Pyrenees mix rescued in Georgia, estimated to be 7 months old in October 2021 and likely to be 85-95 pounds when full-grown. His foster mom says he is a 'giant, crazy and insanely happy puppy!' All people are his friends (he especially loves men!), he loves other dogs, and even likes cats. Alex will do best in a suburban home with a fenced yard and an energetic doggy companion on the larger side who wants to play much of the day. He loves to eat as much as he loves to play. If there are children in the home, they should be on the older side: Alex really doesn't know how big he is! He's working on his chewing, mouthing, leash and meal-time manners - the usual puppy behaviors which will benefit from continued and consistent training in his adoptive home as he grows into adulthood. True to his breed, he can be stubborn, he is very smart and his big personality matches his size. He has a true zest for life, so he's a fun, interesting and busy guy! Alex has been neutered and microchipped, and will be up to date on core vaccines (age appropriate) at time of adoption. If you would like to take Alex home, please apply online to adopt Alex (GA) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org.

name: Dana (Nc)
description: Dana is a playful, curious, snuggly and sweet pup who can't wait to bring all of that to her forever family. Dana is 4 years old and aproximately 33lbs, she is spayed and up to date on vaccinations. Dana is a lovely dog who enjoys treats, fetch, and going to daycare twice a week to play with all her many friends. Dana is great with all people and other dogs, she would do great with another dog in the home! If you are Dana's forever family, please apply online to adopt Dana (NC) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. All pets are also current on age-appropriate vaccines at the time of adoption Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Dre
description: This handsome brindle boy is Dre! Born in 2012, Dre looks like a Boxer/Pit mix on a Boston Terrier frame...he really is the cutest little lowrider! He was rescued from a high kill NYC shelter where he found himself moments from euthanasia. Dre is wonderful with people of all ages and other dogs. No cats for him. Dre would do best with someone who is retired, or works from home, as he has separation anxiety. Dre takes medication daily for arthritis and does have some accidents in the home. He's waiting to be your new best friend. If you would like to make Dre the love of your life, please fill out an adoption application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. name: Leela
description: Leela comes to rescue as an owner surrender from South Carolina, with an eye injury, and at 4 months old and 25 pounds. She is up to date on shots (age appropriate) and will be spayed prior to placement in her forever home. Leela will have her injured eye removed on Wednesday, Oct 3rd if nothing prevents her from being able to undergo surgery. Leela is very sweet with people and other dogs. She is really a perfect girl! If you are interested in adopting Leela, please get the process started and put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

name: Sable (Sc)
description: Sable (SC) is a female Boxer mix rescued in South Carolina. Our veterinary partner estimates that Sable is 3 years old at the time of intake in March 2022. Sable is good with people, kids and other dogs. This beautiful girl was picked up as a stray, and it's obvious that life has not been kind to Sable. She suffered from entropion, a painful eye condition, in both eyes which has been surgically repaired. Sable is very sweet, is housetrained, sleeps through the night, is great on a leash and ignores critters as she walks. She is great with smaller children and loves to give kisses to everyone--big or small. Sable has shown no sign of food aggression at her foster home. If you can find a place in your heart for Sable, please apply online to adopt Sable (SC) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. name: Bebe (Tx)
description: Bebe (TX) is a male Shar Pei mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Bebe is 1 years old at the time of intake in September 2024, so he would be about 2 years old as of August 2025. Bebe is good with people and other dogs. He can be very active, giving lots of kisses and jumping around. He can also be very sweet and cuddly. He is not a fan of water. Bebe was found neglected on the streets, attacked by other dogs, trying to survive the best he could. Bebe's foster mom reports that he is settling in well and learning how to be a dog from his siblings. He is a playful boy and does love his toys and chews. We have taken him in and given him tender love and care. Now look at this young baby ! If you fall in love with all those adorable wrinkles, please apply online to adopt Bebe (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org.

name: Bunny (Tx)
description: Bunny (TX) is a male Husky mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Bunny is 1 year old at the time of intake in October 2024. Bunny is good with people and other dogs. Bunny was rescued from a garbage dump where like many others, was left to die on his own. Bunny has been recovering and is almost ready to come to the Northeast. He only requires a fluffy bed, lots of toys, and a trustworthy human who won't let him down like before. If you check off all the boxes, Bunny is looking for in his family, please apply online to adopt Bunny (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org.

name: Austin (Ny)
description: Austin (NY) is a 7 year old Chihuahua mixed male who comes to rescue in June 2025 with his brother due to his adopters no longer beig able to take care of them. Austin is great with both dogs and people. He is a cutie who found himself in a scary shelter with his RDR brother and of course we coould not leave him there and pulled him into rescue. Austin deserves a loving home where he can be his silly self and shower you with kisses and love. If you would like to give Austin (NY) the life he deserves ,please apply online at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Cloud
description: Cloud is a spayed female Boxer mix rescued from a North Carolina kill shelter, emaciated and suffering from a life of neglect. Our veterinary partner estimates that Cloud was born in approximately 2017. She is a beautiful little petite pixie - 45 pounds of dynamite: a big personality in a small package! She's a total love bug and very affectionate with her people. Cloud is house trained, crate trained, has great leash manners and knows basic commands. Extremely smart, Cloud learns quickly and is eager to please. A high- energy girl, she requires daily exercise and stimulation. A fenced-in yard is a must. Cloud is dog-selective and although she tends to do well with large dominant male dogs who offer correction and leadership, she's not a fan of other females. She has a high prey drive, so no small dogs or cats for Cloud, thank you! Cloud must have a strong and confident leader. She is an absolute JOY, but not for a first-time dog owner or novice handler. She requires patience, direction and a family who will set her up for success and be vigilant in keeping her from bad situations. Her foster parents have worked with her on some food guarding tendencies, which result from her hungry times on the streets. Cloud is a great cuddler and good napper. Her forever home must be exceptional because she is an exceptional girl! If you are the special person who can open your heart and give Cloud her happy ever after, please fill out an adoption application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. name: Charlotte (Al)
description: Charlotte: Tiny Pup, Huge Heart! Charlotte (AL) may only be about two weeks old (as of November 23, 2025), but she’s already proving that good things come in small, wiggly packages. This sweet female Labrador Retriever mix was rescued with her Momma and siblings after their owner moved away and left them behind. But Charlotte isn’t dwelling on the past—she’s too busy practicing her puppy wiggles and perfecting her “pick me!” face. With a Lab/Catahoula mix likely in her family tree, Charlotte is destined to be both gorgeous and delightfully goofy. Right now, her hobbies include: falling asleep mid-play, making humans swoon with her puppy breath, and attempting to walk like a baby giraffe on roller skates. Spoiler alert: she’s already the star of the show. Charlotte is the kind of pup who will keep you laughing, melt your heart with snuggles, and remind you daily that life is better with a wagging tail by your side. She’s sweet, funny, and absolutely irresistible—basically the perfect recipe for a forever best friend. Don’t miss your chance to bring Charlotte home—she’s ready to fill your life with love, laughter, and a little chaos. Apply online today at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org to adopt Charlotte (AL) and give her the happily-ever-after she deserves! Please be sure to reference this pet's name as Charlotte (AL) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. Thank you! RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. name: Casper (Ga)
description: Casper (GA) is a male Pit Bull Terrier/Boston/Chihuahua mix (maybe!) estimated to be 5-6 months old at the time of intake in late September 2024. Casper is up to date on core vaccinations (age-appropriate) and is microchipped. He will be neutered prior to joining his forever home unless there is a medical reason why it has not yet been completed (in which case RDR NYC will work with the adopter to ensure this is done at the appropriate time). Casper is good with people, other dogs and even cats. This cute little guy was abandoned at a vet's office and fortunately made his way into our rescue and into our hearts! Casper is friendly and super sweet. If you have room in your heart and home for this beautiful boy, please apply online to adopt Casper (GA) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Malachite (Al)
description: Malachite (AL) is ready to meet his forever family—and he’s hoping it might be you. This neutered, male 7 month old (as of July 2025) Terrier mix has already been through more than most pups his age. He came into rescue with a painful skin infection, but thanks to dedicated care and lots of love, he’s now fully healed and absolutely stunning. His coat is soft, his eyes are bright, and his spirit is stronger than ever. Malachite has spent most of his puppyhood in foster care, learning how to be a happy, well-socialized dog. He’s great with people, loves other dogs, and even attends doggy day camp where he’s a total favorite. Friendly, sweet, and full of puppy charm—he’s the kind of dog who’ll melt your heart the moment you meet him. What Malachite needs now is a home that’s forever. A place where he can grow up loved, safe, and surrounded by people who see how special he is. If you’re ready to open your heart and home to this beautiful boy, apply to adopt Malachite (AL) today at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. He’s waiting—and he’s worth it. His adoption fee is $575. If Malachite's happy future can be found in your home, please apply online to adopt Malachite (AL) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Please also be sure to reference his name as Malachite (AL) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. Thank you! All pets are also current on age-appropriate core vaccines at the time of adoption. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter. Due to technical constraints on this website, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Maw Maw (Al)
description: Meet Maw Maw: A Senior Beagle with a Heart Full of Love Maw Maw (AL) is a 10ish-year-old Beagle who was picked up as a stray and traced back to a breeder—who sadly refused to claim her. But Maw Maw didn’t let that rejection define her. She wandered onto the property of a kind family, where the children instantly fell in love and gave her the name that suits her perfectly: Maw Maw. Despite her age, Maw Maw still has plenty of pep in her step. She adores strolling through the yard, nose to the ground, tracking every scent like the curious little hound she is. She walks beautifully on a leash and is fully house-trained, always waiting to potty outside. Maw Maw is a gentle soul who’s wonderful with kids and other dogs. She’s patient, polite, and calm—an easy companion who fits right into any loving home. She already knows how to “Sit” and takes treats with the softest touch. Though she’s currently very thin, just skin and bones, her spirit is strong and her heart is open. Now, Maw Maw is waiting for someone to see her for who she truly is: a sweet, spunky senior with so much love left to give. Please apply to adopt Maw Maw (AL) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Please also be sure to reference this pet's name as Maw Maw (AL) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. Thank you! All pets are also current on age-appropriate core vaccines at the time of adoption. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter. Due to technical constraints on this website, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Zeus
description: Meet Zircon (AL) – The Best-Good-Boy You’ve Been Waiting For! Zircon is a male Terrier mix estimated to be 8 months old as of August 2025. Zircon is already proving to be a shining star. He’s had significant training and outstanding socialization in his foster home, and it shows. This clever pup has mastered sit, down, paw, and roll over — all with enthusiasm and a tail wag. He’s a social butterfly who adores everyone he meets, including dogs, cats, and kids. Whether he’s out in public or at doggy daycare, Zircon is a perfect gentleman and a crowd favorite. Smart, confident, and level-headed, Zircon packs a working cattle dog-type brain into a pint-sized body. He’s not just looking for a home — he’s looking for a mission. He thrives on learning, pleasing his people, and being part of the action. After a day of play and purpose, he’s all about cozy snuggles and quiet companionship. Zircon would love an active lifestyle and a family who values his intelligence and charm. Ideally, he’d like a job — complete with signing bonus treats, recognition for excellent work, and the occasional promotion. In return, he’ll give you loyalty, laughter, and a lifetime of love. Ready to welcome this best-good-boy into your life? His adoption fee is $575. If you are Zircon's forever person, please apply online to adopt Zircon (AL) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Please be sure to reference this pup as Zircon (AL) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. Thank you! RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. All pets are also current on age-appropriate vaccines at the time of adoption. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Banzai (Tx) Now Nellie
description: Banzai (TX) is a female thought to be Shepherd mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Banzai is 1 years old at the time of intake in July 2023. Banzai is good with people and other dogs. Banzai has spent much of her young life on the streets of Texas which is no place for a sweet girl like her. Her foster reports Banzai TX is a pure bundle of love, looking for her forever family. She is up to date on shots, fully house broken, socializing well with other dogs, she loves walks and playing in the yard. She has grown a lot since I have had her, about 40-45 lbs now and a yr old. She will make you smile and laugh all day long. Do you think that you can provide Banzai the life she deserves? If you can, please apply online to adopt Banzai (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. name: Dillon (Md)
description: Dillon/Rocky is an 8-year-old Chocolate Lab/Doberman mix (38 lbs) with a heart full of love. He’s sweet, shy, and thrives in a calm, stable home. Indoors, he’s a perfect gentleman—house-trained, crate-trained, and great with dogs, cats and children. Dillon/Rocky loves being near his person, enjoys peanut butter treats, and will quietly keep you company. Outdoors, he can be a bit nervous around strangers or dogs, but he quickly warms up. And in a safe environment, his curious, loving side shines. If you would like to adopt Dillon, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application

name: Lucy (Bailey Tx)
description: Bailey and Lucy (TX) are a bonded brother and sister duo who were born into rescue on May 5, 2019. Bailey and Lucy are Heeler mixes, although Bailey looks more like a Labrador Retriever. Bailey is a neutered male, and Lucy is a spayed female, and they weigh 45-50 lbs. They are good with people of all sizes and other dogs. Their ideal home would be in a quiet suburb with a fenced yard with an experienced dog owner who's very active and is home most of the time. True to the breed, Lucy and Bailey are equal parts super sweet snugglers and high energy whirlwinds and need to be exercised well every day. If you can open your heart and home to Bailey and Lucy (TX), please fill out an application at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. All pets are also current on age-appropriate vaccines at the time of adoption Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

name: Freya
description: Freya - 5 years, 17lbs, Jrt/Chi Mix, Spayed This dog is eligible to join our foster-to-adopt program. Please email fostertoadopt@socialteesnyc.org with the animal’s name in the subject line if you are interested! Want to straight up adopt? Submit an adoption application a t socialteesnyc.org Level of dog ownership experience needed: BEGINNER: This means we predict this dog will be low on the challenge scale due to its breed/age combo. Potentially a good fit for someone who has relevant dog care experience (fostering, dog sitting) and is looking to adopt their first pup. Energy level MEDIUM: Needs a daily 60 minute walk or window of quick paced exercise (minimum) in addition to potty break strolls (10-30 min each). Also needs significant socializing opportunities outside the home and mental stimulation at home like tricks training practice, chew items, and puzzle toys. (This is regardless of dog size – many small breeds were designed for lots of activity and will exhibit unwanted behavior when they’re understimulated.) Okay in the city? We don’t know yet. Most adult dogs do well in the city after they’ve had time to adjust to a new environment, but some never adapt and need homes in the burbs. Potty trained? Probably! Adults usually are, but all will have transitional accidents for the first week or so. A consistent walking route and schedule plus finding spots with grass or dirt can help. Social with other dogs? Yes, but we don’t know to what degree yet. Some like to wrestle with every passing pup, others can coexist well but prefer to keep to themselves. We’ll learn more soon. Social with cats? Not sure yet! Some breed mixes that are generally NOT great matches for homes with cats include large hounds, huskies, and shepherds. Comfortable with children? (ALWAYS requires adult supervision) We’re not sure yet, but we try to err on the side of caution. Respectful kids ages 8 and up are probably a safe bet. Children must always be monitored and taught to interact with dogs of any age respectfully. Medical status Healthy as far as we know. Up to date on their DHPP, Bordetella, and Rabies vaccines; heartworm tested if coming from the South or Puerto Rico ; spayed/neutered; microchipped; treated with dewormer upon intake How this dog ended up with Social Tees: Most of our dogs come via partner groups who help us save them from shelters where they are at risk of euthanasia in Tennessee, Los Angeles and Puerto Rico. There are very few spay/neuter resources there and many more animals in those areas than there are people to adopt them. Rescue groups like ours bring them to the northeast where the desire for pets like these allows us to save their lives. PLEASE NOTE: We cannot guarantee any breed mix, exact age, or full grown size (if the dog is under a year old). We do our best with very educated guesses though! This animal is not at the Social Tees office, all are in foster homes. LEARN MORE ABOUT US: socialteesnyc.org and Instagram @socialteesnyc

name: Dulce
description: Meet Dulce 💛 this adorable little guy is available for pre-adoption and will be ready to go to her forever home on December 30th when she’s 8 weeks old! If you’re looking to add a sweet new family member to your home, we’re now accepting adoption applications for Dulce and her siblings.

description: Meet Babka 💛 this adorable little guy is available for pre-adoption and will be ready to go to his forever home on December 30th when he’s 8 weeks old! If you’re looking to add a sweet new family member to your home, we’re now accepting adoption applications for Babka and his siblings.

description: Meet Brulee 💛 — this adorable little girl is available for pre-adoption and will be ready to go to her forever home on December 30th when she’s 8 weeks old! If you’re looking to add a sweet new family member to your home, we’re now accepting adoption applications for Brulee and her siblings.

name: Goldie
description: Meet Goldie! This one-year-old, 47-pound sweetheart just joined Every Last One Rescue’s foster program, and she’s already stealing hearts. Here’s what we know so far: Goldie starts off a little shy, but she warms up quickly and greets new people with a wiggly body, soft eyes, and a happy, hopeful tail. She LOVES having a foster dog brother and is learning leash skills by following his lead. We think she’d truly thrive with a confident dog sibling to show her the ropes. She’s also proving herself to be a fast learner—Goldie is picking up both crate training and potty training incredibly quickly, and we expect she’ll have both mastered soon. After just a few hours in her foster home, she was already climbing into her foster mom’s lap for hugs and kisses… a clear sign that this gentle girl is a cuddlebug in the making. Goldie is tender, eager to connect, and so ready for a family to call her own.

description: Meet Churro 💛 this adorable little guy is available for pre-adoption and will be ready to go to his forever home on December 30th when he’s 8 weeks old!
